original: bstan bcos de la gnod par bya ba na chos can med pa'i phyir khyad par sems pa bzlog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos de la gnod par bya ba na chos can med pa'i phyir khyad par sems pa bzlog par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one refutes that treatise, the qualification is refuted because the subject does not exist.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu'i yul zhes bya ba dpyod pa'i rten bstan bcos las grub pa la ni gdon mi za bar bstan bcos tshad mar 'gyur dgos so //üîΩgal te bstan bcos las grub pa'i chos can la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu'i yul zhes bya ba dpyod pa'i rten bstan bcos las grub pa la ni gdon mi za bar bstan bcos tshad mar 'gyur dgos so // gal te bstan bcos las grub pa'i chos can la /
translated: Therefore, when the subject is established by the treatise, the basis of the analysis called ‚Äúsuch a type of object‚Äù must certainly be a valid treatise.üîΩIf one speaks of a contradiction with the treatise with regard to the subject established by the treatise,

original: bstan bcos las 'gal ba smra na bstan bcos kyis gnod na /
analyzed: bstan bcos las 'gal ba smra na bstan bcos kyis gnod na /
translated: if the treatise contradicts it,üîΩnow how could one enter?

original: da ni ji ltar 'jug dogs dag tu khrus byed pa dang / de la sogs pa g-yang sar mchod pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de chos ma yin par dag par byed pa ma yin no zhes de skad smra ba khas blangs pas gnod pa ma yin /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar 'jug dogs dag tu khrus byed pa dang / de la sogs pa g-yang sar mchod pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de chos ma yin par dag par byed pa ma yin no zhes de skad smra ba khas blangs pas gnod pa ma yin /
translated: It is not that the claim that bathing in sacred waters and making offerings in dangerous places and so on are not purifying acts is refuted by the treatise.

original: chos can chos ma yin pa ni bstan bcos las grub pa yin no //
analyzed: chos can chos ma yin pa ni bstan bcos las grub pa yin no //
translated: The subject and non-subject are established by the treatise.

original: de la chos can khas len pas ni bstan bcos tshad mar byas pa yin la /
analyzed: de la chos can khas len pas ni bstan bcos tshad mar byas pa yin la /
translated: Accepting the subject makes the treatise valid.

original: de tshad mar byas na yang chos ma yin pa khrus la sogs pas dag par byed pa yin pas khas blangs pa na de yang 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pas gnod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de tshad mar byas na yang chos ma yin pa khrus la sogs pas dag par byed pa yin pas khas blangs pa na de yang 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pas gnod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you accept that, then it is undermined by your acceptance, because it is not Dharma, since it is purified by ablutions and so on.

original: chos ma yin pa khrus la sogs pas bzlog par bya ba ni bkag par gyur du zin kyang skyon med do //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa khrus la sogs pas bzlog par bya ba ni bkag par gyur du zin kyang skyon med do //
translated: Even if it is the case that non-Dharma is refuted by ablutions and so on, there is no fault.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: ma mthong ba chos dang chos ma yin zhes bya bar rtogs par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi bstan bcos thams cad khrus kyi chos ma yin pa sbyong bar byed do zhes de skad mi brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba chos dang chos ma yin zhes bya bar rtogs par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi bstan bcos thams cad khrus kyi chos ma yin pa sbyong bar byed do zhes de skad mi brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all treatises that are the reasons for understanding Dharma and non-Dharma are not stated to purify the Dharma of ablutions.

original: gal te bstan bcos thams cad ni de skad mi brjod kyi 'on kyang 'ga' zhig yin pa de lta na yang chos can bstan bcos las grub pa yin pa des na ci ltar skyon med ce na /
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos thams cad ni de skad mi brjod kyi 'on kyang 'ga' zhig yin pa de lta na yang chos can bstan bcos las grub pa yin pa des na ci ltar skyon med ce na /
translated: If you say that all treatises do not state that, but some do, and in that case the subject is established from the treatises, then how is there no fault?

original: bshad pa / @45b rang gi khas len pa'i rten khas blangs pa'i bstan bcos zlog par byed pa la gnod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bshad pa / @45b rang gi khas len pa'i rten khas blangs pa'i bstan bcos zlog par byed pa la gnod par 'gyur la /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: When you refute the treatise that you yourself accept, you are undermined.

original: chos can chos ma yin pa rnam par 'jog pas kyang gang rnam par gzhag pa'i bstan bcos de des khas blangs pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos can chos ma yin pa rnam par 'jog pas kyang gang rnam par gzhag pa'i bstan bcos de des khas blangs pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: And since the subject is posited as a non-phenomenon, the treatise that posits it is accepted by you, not by others.

original: chos ma yin pa nye bar ston pa'i bstan bcos thams cad du ni khrus la sogs pas dag par byed pa yang mi smra'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa nye bar ston pa'i bstan bcos thams cad du ni khrus la sogs pas dag par byed pa yang mi smra'o //
translated: In all treatises that teach non-phenomena, it is also said that purity is achieved through bathing and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir rang gi bstan bcos kyis rnam par 'jog pa na sangs rgyas pa'i chos can rten khas blangs pa'i bstan bcos la mi gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir rang gi bstan bcos kyis rnam par 'jog pa na sangs rgyas pa'i chos can rten khas blangs pa'i bstan bcos la mi gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since that is the case, when you posit your own treatise, it does not undermine the treatise that accepts the Buddhist subject.

original: khas ma blangs pa la gnod pa skyon ma yin no//
analyzed: khas ma blangs pa la gnod pa skyon ma yin no//
translated: It is not a fault to undermine what is not accepted.

original: de ni bstan bcos des khas blangs pa chos can yin yang 'gal ba med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de ni bstan bcos des khas blangs pa chos can yin yang 'gal ba med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To show that even though the subject accepted by that treatise is a phenomenon, there is no contradiction, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: bstan bcos de'i'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos de'i'o //
translated: That is the subject of that treatise.

original: ci lta bu'i khyad par can zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci lta bu'i khyad par can zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of special kind of person?

original: khrus kyis dag par smra ba yin pas na der smra'o //
analyzed: khrus kyis dag par smra ba yin pas na der smra'o //
translated: He is a proponent of purification by bathing, so he is called a ‚ÄúBather.‚Äù

original: rang gi tshig ni bstan bcos kyi phyogs gcig ste /
analyzed: rang gi tshig ni bstan bcos kyi phyogs gcig ste /
translated: His own words are one part of the treatise.

original: de nyid kyi khrus kyis dag par bya ba'i don de la gnod pa'i phyir de bkag pa la skyon med do zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi khrus kyis dag par bya ba'i don de la gnod pa'i phyir de bkag pa la skyon med do zhes 'brel to //
translated: Since the meaning of purification by bathing is undermined by that very treatise, there is no fault in refuting it.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: bstan bcos tshad mar byas nas de dang 'gal ba brjod pa gang yin pa'i tshig de la bstan bcos kyis gnod pa yin na /
analyzed: bstan bcos tshad mar byas nas de dang 'gal ba brjod pa gang yin pa'i tshig de la bstan bcos kyis gnod pa yin na /
translated: If one takes the treatise as authoritative and then states something that contradicts it, one‚Äôs words are undermined by the treatise.

original: 'dir ni bstan bcos nyid don 'gal ba brjod kyi skyes bu ni ma yin pa'i phyir gang la bstan bcos kyis gnod ces bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni bstan bcos nyid don 'gal ba brjod kyi skyes bu ni ma yin pa'i phyir gang la bstan bcos kyis gnod ces bya ba ma yin no //
translated: But here the treatise itself states a contradictory meaning, not a person. Therefore, it is not the case that ‚Äúone is undermined by the treatise.‚Äù

original: gang gis khrus las dag pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshig de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis khrus las dag pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshig de gang yin zhe na /
translated: By what words is purification by bathing undermined?

original: bshad pa / chos ma yin pa gang la chags pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / chos ma yin pa gang la chags pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is explained: Attachment and so on to what is not Dharma.

original: zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rtsa ba rgyu mtshan yod pa zhes bya ba de ltar ni bstan bcos thams cad las rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rtsa ba rgyu mtshan yod pa zhes bya ba de ltar ni bstan bcos thams cad las rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: All treatises are established in this way, that the roots of hatred, etc. are the causes of the afflictions.

original: gang la khrus kyis dag pa brjod pa de'i bar du yang 'di rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: gang la khrus kyis dag pa brjod pa de'i bar du yang 'di rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: Even in the treatises that declare purification through bathing, this is the way they are established.

original: 'di bstan bcos kyi don yin no //
analyzed: 'di bstan bcos kyi don yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the treatises.

original: thams cad las chos ma yin pa de ni chags pa la sogs pa'i rtsa ba can yin no zhes de skad dngos su brjod pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: thams cad las chos ma yin pa de ni chags pa la sogs pa'i rtsa ba can yin no zhes de skad dngos su brjod pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it stated explicitly that all non-Dharmas have attachment, etc. as their roots?

original: de ci ltar 'di ltar rnam par gzhag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar 'di ltar rnam par gzhag pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it established in this way?

original: gang gis khrus las dag par bshad pa'i bstan bcos de nyid kyis ma chags pa rnams dang / snang ba med pa rnams dang / ma rmongs pa rnams dang / sdig par mi 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gis khrus las dag par bshad pa'i bstan bcos de nyid kyis ma chags pa rnams dang / snang ba med pa rnams dang / ma rmongs pa rnams dang / sdig par mi 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: The very treatises that explain purification through bathing implicitly state that non-attachment, non-appearance, non-delusion, and non-sin

original: shugs kyis @46a * //
analyzed: shugs kyis @46a * //
translated: are the roots of all Dharmas.

original: chags pa la sogs pa sdig pa'i rgyur brjod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa sdig pa'i rgyur brjod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Attachment, etc. are stated to be the causes of sin,

original: dngos su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos su ni ma yin no //
translated: but not explicitly.

original: rnam bar gzhag ba des ni khrus la sogs pas sdig ba dag bar smra ba 'gog bar byed do //
analyzed: rnam bar gzhag ba des ni khrus la sogs pas sdig ba dag bar smra ba 'gog bar byed do //
translated: This establishes that bathing and so on do not purify sins.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu ma zad na de las byung ba'i 'bras bu mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma zad na de las byung ba'i 'bras bu mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the cause is not destroyed, the effect that arises from it cannot be averted.

original: gal te khrus la sogs pas chags pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu la gnod par byed pa yin na ni de'i 'bras bu sdig pa yang dag bar byed bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te khrus la sogs pas chags pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu la gnod par byed pa yin na ni de'i 'bras bu sdig pa yang dag bar byed bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If bathing and so on were to harm the cause, which is the nature of attachment and so on, then the effect of that, sin, would be purified.

original: rgyu la gnod bar byed ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu la gnod bar byed ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But it does not harm the cause,

original: khrus la sogs ba byas kyang nyams su myong ba'i chags ba la sogs pa mi ldog ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: khrus la sogs ba byas kyang nyams su myong ba'i chags ba la sogs pa mi ldog ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: because even though one bathes and so on, the attachment and so on that are experienced are not averted.

original: dpe bshad pa ni mngar ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dpe bshad pa ni mngar ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The example is stated in ‚ÄúIf one drinks something sweet . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: bad kan dang yon tan mtshungs pa'i mngar ba la sogs ba ni bad kan gyis skyed pa'i nad 'phel ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de dag nyid kyis zhi bar byed ba ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di la yang yin no //
analyzed: bad kan dang yon tan mtshungs pa'i mngar ba la sogs ba ni bad kan gyis skyed pa'i nad 'phel ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de dag nyid kyis zhi bar byed ba ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di la yang yin no //
translated: Sweetness and so on, which are similar to phlegm, are the cause for the increase of diseases generated by phlegm. Therefore, they are not the pacifiers of those diseases.

original: de'i phyir na khrus kyis dag par brjod pa ni don gyi chos ma yin pa chags pa la sogs pa'i rtsa ba can du brjod bas gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na khrus kyis dag par brjod pa ni don gyi chos ma yin pa chags pa la sogs pa'i rtsa ba can du brjod bas gnod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the statement that purification is through bathing is undermined by the fact that it is said to be rooted in attachment and so on, which are not the meaning of Dharma.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos nyid rang gi don 'gal ba brjod pa yin gyi skyes bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos nyid rang gi don 'gal ba brjod pa yin gyi skyes bu ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the treatise itself expresses a meaning that is contradictory to its own purpose, but not the person.

original: gang gi phyir bstan bcos las rab tu grags ba'i chos can gzung ba la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bstan bcos las rab tu grags ba'i chos can gzung ba la /
translated: Because the subject that is well known in the treatise is taken as the subject.

original: skyes bus  bstan bcos dang 'gal ba brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / 'di lta bu 'gal brjod par byed pa la bstan bcos gnod par byed pa ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir lung gi mthong ba rab tu grags pa'i don dbang bo las 'das pa dag la ni 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: skyes bus  bstan bcos dang 'gal ba brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / 'di lta bu 'gal brjod par byed pa la bstan bcos gnod par byed pa ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir lung gi mthong ba rab tu grags pa'i don dbang bo las 'das pa dag la ni 'gal ba ste /
translated: The person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.üîΩThe person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.üîΩThe person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.üîΩThe person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.üîΩThe person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.üîΩThe person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.üîΩThe person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.

original: tshig can tshul gnod pa brjod pa ston pa de ni phal cher te /üîΩlhag par sems pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshig can tshul gnod pa brjod pa ston pa de ni phal cher te / lhag par sems pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.üîΩThe person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.üîΩThe person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.üîΩThe person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.üîΩThe person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.üîΩThe person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.

original: tshig phan tshun 'gal ba bstan pas ni don brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: tshig phan tshun 'gal ba bstan pas ni don brjod pa yin te /
translated: The person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.

original: bstan bcos las ci ltar brjod pa de de ltar ma yin no zhes ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos las ci ltar brjod pa de de ltar ma yin no zhes ni mi smra'o //
translated: The person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.

original: 'on kyang bstan bcos 'di nyid smra'i zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang bstan bcos 'di nyid smra'i zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.üîΩThe person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.üîΩThe person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.üîΩThe person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.üîΩThe person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.üîΩThe person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.üîΩThe person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.

original: ci ltar skyes bu la bstan bcos kyis gnod pa yin /üîΩyang ci'i phyir de ltar sems par byed ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar skyes bu la bstan bcos kyis gnod pa yin / yang ci'i phyir de ltar sems par byed ce na /
translated: The person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.üîΩThe person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.

original: bstan bcos gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bstan bcos gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise.üîΩThe person who speaks in contradiction to the treatise is not contradicted by the treatise

original: mthong ba mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'i yul lo //üîΩrjes su dpag bar bya ba yang med bzhin du res 'ga' mthong ba'am /
analyzed: mthong ba mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'i yul lo // rjes su dpag bar bya ba yang med bzhin du res 'ga' mthong ba'am /
translated: The object of perception is direct perception and inference.

original: @46b mig bzhin du rten mthong ba'i phyir mthong bar brjod de /
analyzed: @46b mig bzhin du rten mthong ba'i phyir mthong bar brjod de /
translated: Even though there is nothing to be inferred, sometimes it is called perception because the basis of the eye is seen, like the eye.

original: mig rjes su dpag ba la ni chos can mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: mig rjes su dpag ba la ni chos can mthong ba yin no //
translated: In the inference of the eye, the subject is seen.

original: dngos bo'i stobs te tshad ma'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i tshang mar ma gnod pa dang / mi mthong ba'i yul shin tu dbang po las 'das pa dag la rang gi tshig gis ma gnod pa'i bstan bcos de gzung bar bya ba yin no zhes rtogs par bya ba'i don to zhes bya ba'i don ni tshig gi lhag ma ste /
analyzed: dngos bo'i stobs te tshad ma'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i tshang mar ma gnod pa dang / mi mthong ba'i yul shin tu dbang po las 'das pa dag la rang gi tshig gis ma gnod pa'i bstan bcos de gzung bar bya ba yin no zhes rtogs par bya ba'i don to zhes bya ba'i don ni tshig gi lhag ma ste /
translated: The meaning of the remainder of the sentence is that the treatise should be accepted as not contradicted by one's own words in matters that are beyond the senses, which are not seen, and which are based on the power of facts, the power of valid cognition.

original: don 'di rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sems par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: don 'di rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sems par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one should understand this meaning. The meaning is that one should think in order to understand this meaning.

original: gal te bstan bcos las grags pa'i chos can la /
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos las grags pa'i chos can la /
translated: If the subject is known from the treatise,

original: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba brjod na bstan bcos kyis gnod na /üîΩ'o na bstan bcos las rab tu grags pa ma yin pa'i chos can la /
analyzed: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba brjod na bstan bcos kyis gnod na / 'o na bstan bcos las rab tu grags pa ma yin pa'i chos can la /
translated: If you state a contradiction with the treatise, then the treatise contradicts you.

original: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba brjod pa la skyon ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba brjod pa la skyon ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: But what is the fault of stating a contradiction with the treatise with regard to a subject that is not well known in the treatise?

original: ci yang med de bstan bcos khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci yang med de bstan bcos khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no fault, because you do not accept the treatise.

original: 'on bstan bcos khas blangs pa de la ci ltar zhe na /üîΩde la mi brten pa bstan bcos la mi brten pa'i dngos po la ni /
analyzed: 'on bstan bcos khas blangs pa de la ci ltar zhe na / de la mi brten pa bstan bcos la mi brten pa'i dngos po la ni /
translated: But what if you do accept the treatise?

original: bstan bcos dang ldan pa des 'gal ba'i chos brjod kyang bstan bcos kyis gnod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos dang ldan pa des 'gal ba'i chos brjod kyang bstan bcos kyis gnod pa ma yin no //
translated: If you do not rely on the treatise, then even if you state a contradiction with the treatise with regard to a subject that is not well known in the treatise, the treatise does not contradict you.

original: 'on cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: gegs byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gegs byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: It becomes an obstacle.

original: 'di ltar dam bcas pa'i bstan bcos de yang de'i rang gi tshig nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dam bcas pa'i bstan bcos de yang de'i rang gi tshig nyid yin la /
translated: Because the treatise that you accept is the very words of the treatise itself.

original: 'di yang rang gi tshig yin pa'i phyir de dag ni gegs byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang rang gi tshig yin pa'i phyir de dag ni gegs byed pa yin no //
translated: And because these are its very words, they are an obstacle.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: bstan bcos dang tshig gnyi ga stobs te spungs mtshungs pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos dang tshig gnyi ga stobs te spungs mtshungs pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: because the treatise and the words are both equally powerful and are both equally a mass.

original: dpe bshad pa /
analyzed: dpe bshad pa /
translated: The example is explained:

original: dper na rang gi tshig gegs byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na rang gi tshig gegs byed pa yin gyi /
translated: For example, it is one‚Äôs own words that are contradicted,

original: gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos po ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos po ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: not the fact that there is something to be damaged and something that damages.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong bas grub ba'i chos can 'dzin ba'i dus na /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong bas grub ba'i chos can 'dzin ba'i dus na /
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time‚Äù means at the time of apprehending the subject that is established by experience.

original: smra ba po de'i rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin gyi bstan bcos kyis gnod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: smra ba po de'i rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin gyi bstan bcos kyis gnod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The speaker‚Äôs own words are contradicted, but the treatise does not contradict it.

original: bstan bcos ni khas blangs pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos ni khas blangs pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'dra'o //
translated: The treatise is like one‚Äôs own words because it is accepted.

original: gang du chos can bstan bcos las rab tu grub pa der ni gdon mi za bar bstan bcos nyid tshad mar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang du chos can bstan bcos las rab tu grub pa der ni gdon mi za bar bstan bcos nyid tshad mar bya ba yin te /
translated: Where the subject is well established from the treatise, there the treatise itself is undoubtedly to be taken as valid.

original: des na bstan bcos gnod par byed ba yin no //
analyzed: des na bstan bcos gnod par byed ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the treatise is what does the damaging.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe bye brag ba sgra nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin no zhes brjod pa de'i tshe 'di'i bstan bcos las rab tu grags pa'i nam mkha'i yon @47a * //
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe bye brag ba sgra nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin no zhes brjod pa de'i tshe 'di'i bstan bcos las rab tu grags pa'i nam mkha'i yon @47a * //
translated: Well then, when Vaibhasikas say that sound is not a quality of space, at that time, according to their treatises, it is well known that space is not a quality of the elements.üîΩ

original: tan nyid rang nyid kyis brjod pa'i nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin pa nyid kyi gegs byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tan nyid rang nyid kyis brjod pa'i nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin pa nyid kyi gegs byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Well, when the Vaise~ika says that sound is not a quality of space, then at that time, the fact that sound is a quality of space, which is well known in his own treatises, would be contradicted by his own statement that sound is not a quality of space.

original: byas pa'i gtan tshigs kyis grub pa'i nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin ba nyid bstan bcos las rab tu grags bas ci ltar gegs byed par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: byas pa'i gtan tshigs kyis grub pa'i nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin ba nyid bstan bcos las rab tu grags bas ci ltar gegs byed par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could the fact that sound is not a quality of space, which is established by the reason of being produced, contradict what is well known in the treatises?

original: de dag las gang la tshad ma yod pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: de dag las gang la tshad ma yod pa zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúamong them, which has a valid cognition?‚Äù

original: tshad ma med pa'i dam bcas pa tsam dag ni phan tshun gegs byed par brjod do //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa'i dam bcas pa tsam dag ni phan tshun gegs byed par brjod do //
translated: He says that mere assertions without valid cognitions contradict each other.

original: gal te gcig la yang tshad ma yod na ni de nyid ni gnod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te gcig la yang tshad ma yod na ni de nyid ni gnod par byed pa yin no //
translated: If one of them has a valid cognition, then that alone is the refutation.

original: de lta ma yin zhes bya ba ni gal te tshad ma med pa dag gegs ma yin pa dang / tshad ma can tshad ma med pa la gnod par byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta ma yin zhes bya ba ni gal te tshad ma med pa dag gegs ma yin pa dang / tshad ma can tshad ma med pa la gnod par byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: If it is not so, then if the valid cognitions do not exist, the non-valid cognitions are not negated, and if the valid cognitions exist, the non-valid cognitions are not negated.

original: 'on kyang bstan bcos nyid gnod par byed 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on kyang bstan bcos nyid gnod par byed 'dod na /
translated: If you wish to negate the treatises,

original: de'i tshe rang gi tshig tshad ma med pa dang / rjes su dpag pa dang ldan ba don ci lta ba bzhin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rang gi tshig tshad ma med pa dang / rjes su dpag pa dang ldan ba don ci lta ba bzhin te /
translated: then your words are valid cognitions, and you have inferences, and you are just as you claim to be.

original: dngos po las ma 'das par 'jug pa'i rang gi tshig tshad ma dang ldan ba gang yin pa de la rigs pa med pa'i dam bca' ba lung gi ngo bos ci ltar gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po las ma 'das par 'jug pa'i rang gi tshig tshad ma dang ldan ba gang yin pa de la rigs pa med pa'i dam bca' ba lung gi ngo bos ci ltar gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: How can the essence of scripture negate a position that is not unreasonable, when it is a position that is consistent with valid cognitions and does not go beyond the way things are?

original: mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: It cannot.

original: rigs pa med pa zhes bya ba ci ltar brjod de gang gi phyir lung yang tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rigs pa med pa zhes bya ba ci ltar brjod de gang gi phyir lung yang tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Why do you say that it is unreasonable? Because scripture is valid cognition.

original: lung rnams tshad ma yin pa yang bkag zin to zhes smos te /
analyzed: lung rnams tshad ma yin pa yang bkag zin to zhes smos te /
translated: We have already refuted the idea that scripture is valid cognition.

original: le'u gnyis par lung rnams rang bzhin ma byas pa dang / don skyes bus ma byas pa dang / yid ches pa'i tshig nyid kyis tshad ma yin pa bkag zin to //
analyzed: le'u gnyis par lung rnams rang bzhin ma byas pa dang / don skyes bus ma byas pa dang / yid ches pa'i tshig nyid kyis tshad ma yin pa bkag zin to //
translated: unfabricated, by virtue of the fact that their meaning is not fabricated by persons, and by virtue of the fact that they are trustworthy words.üîΩSince the treatises do not contradict scripture with regard to non-dependently arisen entities, there is no fault in the treatises contradicting scripture.

original: gang gi phyir bstan bcos las mi brten pa'i dngos po la lung dang 'gal ba brjod pa la lung gis gnod pa med pa de'i phyir lung tshad mar khas blangs nas dpyod pa gang dag yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bstan bcos las mi brten pa'i dngos po la lung dang 'gal ba brjod pa la lung gis gnod pa med pa de'i phyir lung tshad mar khas blangs nas dpyod pa gang dag yin pa ste /
translated: Therefore, those who analyze things on the basis of accepting scripture as valid cognition,üîΩfor example, those who analyze the subject in terms of the treatises,

original: dper na chos la sogs pa lta bur gang dag gis chos can bstan bcos las rab tu grags pa'i dpyod ba de dag la bstan bcos kyis gnod pa'i skyon 'dir 'gyur gyi gzhan du chos can bstan bcos las rab tu grags pa ma yin pa'i dpyod pa laüîΩni ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na chos la sogs pa lta bur gang dag gis chos can bstan bcos las rab tu grags pa'i dpyod ba de dag la bstan bcos kyis gnod pa'i skyon 'dir 'gyur gyi gzhan du chos can bstan bcos las rab tu grags pa ma yin pa'i dpyod pa laüîΩni ma yin no //
translated: like the dharmas, will be at fault in that they will be contradicted by the treatises. But those who do not analyze the subject in terms of the treatises will not be at fault.

original: gang gi phyir dpyod ba gang du bstan bcos la gdon mi za bar brten dgos pa de kho na bstan bcos gnod par byed pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pa las phyi rol du gyur pa ma yin yang khas blangs pa ste bstan bcos
analyzed: gang gi phyir dpyod ba gang du bstan bcos la gdon mi za bar brten dgos pa de kho na bstan bcos gnod par byed pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pa las phyi rol du gyur pa ma yin yang khas blangs pa ste bstan bcos
translated: Because it is only where one must rely on the treatise that analysis is required, and only that treatise is harmful. Therefore, even though it is not external to inference, it is accepted, that is, it is a treatise,üîΩ

original: rjes su dpag pa las logs shig tu byas so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las logs shig tu byas so //
translated: Because it is only where analysis is taught that one must rely on the treatise without doubt, and it is only there that the treatise is harmful, therefore, although the thesis is not outside of inference, it is set forth separately from inference, that is, the treatise is set forth separately from inference.

original: ci'i don du zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i don du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yul gyi @47b dbye ba ste tha dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: yul gyi @47b dbye ba ste tha dad pa nyid do //
translated: Because of the difference in objects.

original: rjes su dpag pa dang bstan bcos kyi gnod pa ni yul tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang bstan bcos kyi gnod pa ni yul tha dad pa yin te /
translated: The harm of inference and the harm of the treatise are different objects.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni thams cad du gnod par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni thams cad du gnod par byed pa yin la /
translated: Inference is harmful in all cases,

original: bstan bcos la brten pa'i chos can la gnod par byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: bstan bcos la brten pa'i chos can la gnod par byed pa yin pas /
translated: but the harm of the treatise is harmful to the subject that is based on the treatise.

original: yul gyi dbye ba 'di bstan pa'i phyir logs shig tu byas so //
analyzed: yul gyi dbye ba 'di bstan pa'i phyir logs shig tu byas so //
translated: Therefore, in order to teach this difference in objects, it is set forth separately.

original: logs shig tu ma byas na ni ji ltar rjes su dpag pa'i yul thams cad la gnod par byed pa de bzhin du bstan bcos kyang yin par dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: logs shig tu ma byas na ni ji ltar rjes su dpag pa'i yul thams cad la gnod par byed pa de bzhin du bstan bcos kyang yin par dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then just as it contradicts all objects of inference, so too it would contradict the treatise.

original: ci ltar phyi rol du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ltar phyi rol du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: How is it not external?

original: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa ni tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa ni tshad ma yin la /
translated: Because inference is a means of valid cognition,

original: lung ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: lung ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but scripture is not.

original: gnod par byed par khas blangs pas so //
analyzed: gnod par byed par khas blangs pas so //
translated: Because it is accepted as contradictory.

original: gang gi phyir lung ni gnod byed du khas blangs pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lung ni gnod byed du khas blangs pa yin la /
translated: Because scripture is accepted as contradictory,

original: gnod par byed pa yang tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa yang tshad ma yin no //
translated: and what is contradictory is a means of valid cognition.

original: tshad ma yang mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma yang mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yin te /
translated: And because it is not direct perception, it is inference.

original: des na gnod par byed pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir bstan bcos rjes su dpag pa yin no //üîΩde lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni yul gyi dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir ma yin na ni /
analyzed: des na gnod par byed pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir bstan bcos rjes su dpag pa yin no // de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni yul gyi dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir ma yin na ni /
translated: Therefore, because it is accepted as contradictory, the treatise is inference.üîΩIf it were not so,

original: 'di rjes su dpag pa'i dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di rjes su dpag pa'i dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir yin par 'gyur la /
translated: if it were not for the purpose of teaching the division of objects, then it would be for the purpose of teaching the division of inference.

original: de lta na yang 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa'i rab tu dbye ba gzhan yang brjod par byas pas ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa'i rab tu dbye ba gzhan yang brjod par byas pas ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if we were to discuss the other types of inference based on effect, nature, and non-apprehension, it would be excessive.

original: ci ste dbye ba gzhan yod kyang ma brjod na /
analyzed: ci ste dbye ba gzhan yod kyang ma brjod na /
translated: If we do not discuss the other types of inference,

original: bstan bcos logs shin tu byas pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos logs shin tu byas pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the composition of the treatise would be meaningless.

original: 'di ltar bstan bcos ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin no zhes brjod zin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar bstan bcos ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin no zhes brjod zin to //
translated: For it has been said that the treatise is an inference based on effect.

original: gal te logs su byas pa gdon mi za bar rgyu mtshan ltos pa yin na'o //
analyzed: gal te logs su byas pa gdon mi za bar rgyu mtshan ltos pa yin na'o //
translated: If it were necessary to state the reason for the composition of the treatise separately,

original: rang gi tshig bstan bcos las logs shig tu byas pa la rgyu mtshan ci yod ce na /
analyzed: rang gi tshig bstan bcos las logs shig tu byas pa la rgyu mtshan ci yod ce na /
translated: what would be the reason for composing the treatise separately from the words?

original: tshig tsam brjod ba ste gang zhig tshad ma dang bral ba'i tshig tsam brjod pa gang yin pa de'o //
analyzed: tshig tsam brjod ba ste gang zhig tshad ma dang bral ba'i tshig tsam brjod pa gang yin pa de'o //
translated: The words are stated separately because they are mere words, that is, mere words devoid of valid cognition.üîΩThe reason is that they are a hindrance, but not a refutation.

original: de la gegs byed pa yin gyi gnod par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di rgyu mtshan yin te /
analyzed: de la gegs byed pa yin gyi gnod par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di rgyu mtshan yin te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: 'di rtogs par bya ba'i phyir logs shig tu byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di rtogs par bya ba'i phyir logs shig tu byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is set forth separately in order to understand this.

original: gal te tshad ma ma yin pa'i tshig gegs byed pa yin gyi gnod par byed pa ma yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma ma yin pa'i tshig gegs byed pa yin gyi gnod par byed pa ma yin na ni /
translated: If the words of a non-valid cognition are an obstruction but not a refutation,

original: gang gi phyir tshad ma ma yin pa nyid ni bstan bcos la yang mtshungs pa yin pa de'i phyir bstan bcos dang 'gal ba der yang gags @48a * //üîΩbyed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshad ma ma yin pa nyid ni bstan bcos la yang mtshungs pa yin pa de'i phyir bstan bcos dang 'gal ba der yang gags @48a * // byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: then since non-validity is the same in treatises, therefore, even when it contradicts a treatise, it is an obstruction there,

original: gnod par byed pa nyid ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa nyid ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but it is not a refutation.

original: bzlog pa'i phyir gzhi yod pa la zhes smos so //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i phyir gzhi yod pa la zhes smos so //
translated: In order to reverse that, it says, ‚Äúwhen the basis exists.‚Äù

original: khyad par can gyi chos dag gi gzhi chos can gcig yod na phan tshun gegs su 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi chos dag gi gzhi chos can gcig yod na phan tshun gegs su 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: When there is one basis, or subject, of distinctive attributes, they mutually obstruct each other,

original: chos la brten pa zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: chos la brten pa zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: because they are explained as ‚Äúdependent on attributes.‚Äù

original: dper brjod pa ni nyams su myong bas grub pa'i chos can tshig gcig la brjod pa'i gnas skabs la brten pa'i tshig tshad ma nyid dang / rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i brjod par bya ba tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: dper brjod pa ni nyams su myong bas grub pa'i chos can tshig gcig la brjod pa'i gnas skabs la brten pa'i tshig tshad ma nyid dang / rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i brjod par bya ba tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The example is the non-authoritativeness of the expressed meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúThe valid cognition of a word based on the occasion of expression of a single word is a phenomenon established by experience, and inference is not authoritative.‚Äù

original: tshad ma can ma yin pa 'di gnyis kyi phan tshun gegs byed pa nyid chos la brten pa yin pa'am /
analyzed: tshad ma can ma yin pa 'di gnyis kyi phan tshun gegs byed pa nyid chos la brten pa yin pa'am /
translated: The mutual obstruction of these two non-authoritative ones is based on a phenomenon.

original: mngon sum gyis grub pa'i bud med la bu skyed pa dang / cig shos kyis chos de dag gi phan tshun gegs byed pa chos la brten pa yin ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis grub pa'i bud med la bu skyed pa dang / cig shos kyis chos de dag gi phan tshun gegs byed pa chos la brten pa yin ba bzhin no //
translated: Or, like the production of a son by a woman established by direct perception, and the mutual obstruction of those phenomena based on a phenomenon by the other.

original: chos can grub pa chos gang rung cig yod par 'gyur dgos pa dang / 'gal ba gnyis gcig la ldan pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir na 'dod pa gcig gis gnyis bgegs byed pa yin te /
analyzed: chos can grub pa chos gang rung cig yod par 'gyur dgos pa dang / 'gal ba gnyis gcig la ldan pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir na 'dod pa gcig gis gnyis bgegs byed pa yin te /
translated: Because the establishment of a phenomenon must be based on a single phenomenon, and because two contradictory [phenomena] do not exist in one [thing], one assertion obstructs the other.

original: des na gegs byed pa ni chos la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gegs byed pa ni chos la brten pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, obstruction is based on a phenomenon.

original: dpyod pa gang du chos can nyid ma grub ba der ni gang la ste /
analyzed: dpyod pa gang du chos can nyid ma grub ba der ni gang la ste /
translated: When the subject itself is not established, then with respect to what,

original: gzhi gang zhig tu khas blangs pa'i chos gang zhig chos gzhan gang gis gegs bya ste /
analyzed: gzhi gang zhig tu khas blangs pa'i chos gang zhig chos gzhan gang gis gegs bya ste /
translated: that is, with respect to what basis, can any phenomenon that is accepted be obstructed by any other phenomenon?

original: gegs byed bdag gi gzhi med par 'gyur na gegs byed pa'i skabs nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gegs byed bdag gi gzhi med par 'gyur na gegs byed pa'i skabs nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the basis of the obstruction were nonexistent, then there would be no occasion for obstruction.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar chos can ma grub na gegs byed pa med pa des na gegs byed pa'i rten chos khas len pas ni chos can rnam par 'jog par byed pa yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar chos can ma grub na gegs byed pa med pa des na gegs byed pa'i rten chos khas len pas ni chos can rnam par 'jog par byed pa yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa yin la /
translated: Since the subject is not established in that way, there is no obstruction. Therefore, by accepting the phenomenon that is the basis of obstruction, one accepts that the subject exists.

original: de rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir yang bstan bcos tshad mar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir yang bstan bcos tshad mar byed pa yin no //
translated: And in order to establish that, one accepts the validity of the treatise.

original: de las bshad ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi don yod par khas len pas ni /
analyzed: de las bshad ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi don yod par khas len pas ni /
translated: By accepting the existence of the meaning of the definition of the phenomenon that is explained in that treatise,

original: bstan bcos brjod par bya ba'i don med na mi 'byung ba'i don gyis 'bras bur khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos brjod par bya ba'i don med na mi 'byung ba'i don gyis 'bras bur khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: one accepts that the treatise is the effect of the meaning that is to be expressed, since the treatise is produced in dependence on that meaning.

original: des na tshad ma yin pa'i phyir de ni bden pa sgrub bar byed pa ma yin pa la gnod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na tshad ma yin pa'i phyir de ni bden pa sgrub bar byed pa ma yin pa la gnod par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is a valid means of knowledge, it is not a refutation of the establishment of truth.

original: de ni bstan bcos rang gi tshig dang mtshungs par bya ba'i phyir skabs rtsom par byed pa ni bstan bcos tshad ma ma yin na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni bstan bcos rang gi tshig dang mtshungs par bya ba'i phyir skabs rtsom par byed pa ni bstan bcos tshad ma ma yin na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to make the context correspond to the words of the treatise, he says, ‚ÄúIf the treatise is not a valid means of knowledge.‚Äù

original: bstan bcos tshad ma can ma yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos tshad ma can ma yin te /
translated: The treatise is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: tshad ma @48b nyid ma yin na ci ltar chos can yod par rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma @48b nyid ma yin na ci ltar chos can yod par rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is not a valid means of knowledge, how can the existence of the subject be understood?

original: tshad mar don med na mi 'byung ba nyid du khas blangs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mar don med na mi 'byung ba nyid du khas blangs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is accepted that it is not a valid means of knowledge unless it is non-errone with respect to its object.

original: gal te de lta na ni rang gi khas blangs ba nyid chos can yod par rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin gyi bstan bcos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni rang gi khas blangs ba nyid chos can yod par rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin gyi bstan bcos ni ma yin no //
translated: If that is so, then your own acceptance establishes the existence of the subject, not the treatise.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: tshad mar byed pa ste /
analyzed: tshad mar byed pa ste /
translated: Because it is a valid means of knowledge.

original: gang gi phyir bstan bcos tshad mar khas len bar byed ba de'i phyir de nyid chos can rnam bar 'jog bar byed pa yin la //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bstan bcos tshad mar khas len bar byed ba de'i phyir de nyid chos can rnam bar 'jog bar byed pa yin la //
translated: Because you accept the validity of treatises, you posit them as subjects.

original: chos gzhan yang tshad mar byed pa nyid kyis 'jog par byed cing /
analyzed: chos gzhan yang tshad mar byed pa nyid kyis 'jog par byed cing /
translated: And you posit other phenomena by accepting their validity.

original: yang dus phyis de nyid zlog bar byed do //
analyzed: yang dus phyis de nyid zlog bar byed do //
translated: And later you refute them.

original: de'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba las tha mi dad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba las tha mi dad do //
translated: Therefore, you are not different from someone who contradicts his own words.

original: ci ltar rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba khas blangs pa'i tshad mas byas pa de bzhin du bstan bcos dang 'gal ba yang yin pas tha mi dad do //
analyzed: ci ltar rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba khas blangs pa'i tshad mas byas pa de bzhin du bstan bcos dang 'gal ba yang yin pas tha mi dad do //
translated: Just as you accept that you contradict your own words by the valid knowledge you yourself accept, you also contradict your treatises. Therefore, you are not different.

original: des na ji ltar rang gi tshig dang 'gal na gegs byed pa de bzhin du bstan bcos dang 'gal na yang yin te /
analyzed: des na ji ltar rang gi tshig dang 'gal na gegs byed pa de bzhin du bstan bcos dang 'gal na yang yin te /
translated: Therefore, just as you are blocked when you contradict your own words, you are also blocked when you contradict your treatises.

original: stobs mtshungs pa dag gnod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: stobs mtshungs pa dag gnod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that equal strength contradicts.

original: gal te gnyi ga gegs byed pa yin gyi gnod par byed pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te gnyi ga gegs byed pa yin gyi gnod par byed pa ma yin na /
translated: If both are blocking but not contradicting,

original: da 'di dag la dbye ba ci yod de /
analyzed: da 'di dag la dbye ba ci yod de /
translated: what is the difference between them?

original: gnyi ga yang gegs byed pa yin bas khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang gegs byed pa yin bas khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Since both are hindrances, there is no difference between them.

original: 'di dag la khyad par yod par su zhig smra /
analyzed: 'di dag la khyad par yod par su zhig smra /
translated: Who says there is no difference between them?

original: gal te khyad par med na ci ltar bstan bcos las rang gi tshig logs su byas she na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par med na ci ltar bstan bcos las rang gi tshig logs su byas she na /
translated: If there is no difference, why does the treatise distinguish them?

original: ngag gi dbye bas de ltar logs shig tu brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngag gi dbye bas de ltar logs shig tu brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are distinguished as separate by the division of speech.

original: ngag tha dad pa dag la ni bstan bcos dang 'gal ba yin la /
analyzed: ngag tha dad pa dag la ni bstan bcos dang 'gal ba yin la /
translated: If the speech is different, it contradicts the treatise.

original: ngag gcig la ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no zhes gang smras pa ni /
analyzed: ngag gcig la ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no zhes gang smras pa ni /
translated: If the speech is the same, it contradicts one‚Äôs own words.

original: gang gi tshe ngag snga mas gzhag pa'i don ngag phyi ma'i don gyis zlog par byed pa de'i tshe ni khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ngag snga mas gzhag pa'i don ngag phyi ma'i don gyis zlog par byed pa de'i tshe ni khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: When the meaning established by the former speech is refuted by the meaning of the latter speech, it contradicts one‚Äôs own assertion.

original: 'di skad ces nga'i ma gang yin pa de ni mo gsham yin no zhes brjod pa ni sngar gyi mtshan nyid kyis ngag phyis kyi mtshan gzhi'i ngag gis nyams par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad ces nga'i ma gang yin pa de ni mo gsham yin no zhes brjod pa ni sngar gyi mtshan nyid kyis ngag phyis kyi mtshan gzhi'i ngag gis nyams par byas pa yin no //
translated: For example, when one says, ‚ÄúMy mother is a barren woman,‚Äù the former statement is undermined by the meaning of the latter statement.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu ni khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu ni khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: This is a contradiction of what you have accepted.

original: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon gyis kyang sngar khas blangs pa dang zhes sngar gyi sgra gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon gyis kyang sngar khas blangs pa dang zhes sngar gyi sgra gsungs so //
translated: That is why the master [BhƒÅviveka] said ‚Äúpreviously accepted‚Äù with the word ‚Äúpreviously.‚Äù

original: ngag gis dbye ba med kyang brjod pa'i ngag de nyid kyis rang gi don sel bar ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin te /üîΩdper na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin @49a * //
analyzed: ngag gis dbye ba med kyang brjod pa'i ngag de nyid kyis rang gi don sel bar ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin te / dper na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin @49a * //
translated: Even though there is no difference in the verbal expression, the statement of the meaning of that expression contradicts itself.

original: no zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: no zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like saying ‚Äúinference is not a valid form of cognition.‚Äù

original: ngag de brjod pa na shugs kyis rang gi don la mi 'khrul bar bstan ba yin la /
analyzed: ngag de brjod pa na shugs kyis rang gi don la mi 'khrul bar bstan ba yin la /
translated: When that statement is made, it implicitly teaches that it is nonerroneous with regard to its own object.

original: de 'dra ba yang smra ba bo'i nga rgyal gyis rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de 'dra ba yang smra ba bo'i nga rgyal gyis rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma yin no //
translated: And it is also a valid form of inference due to the pride of the speaker.

original: des na brjod ba'i shugs kyis 'ongs pa'i tshad ma nyid du khas blangs pas ni rang gi brjod bya tshad ma ma yin pa 'gal bar byed do //
analyzed: des na brjod ba'i shugs kyis 'ongs pa'i tshad ma nyid du khas blangs pas ni rang gi brjod bya tshad ma ma yin pa 'gal bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, by accepting that it is a valid form of cognition that is implied by the force of the statement, you contradict your own statement that it is not a valid form of cognition.

original: tshig brjod bar 'dod ba'i 'bras bu yin ba'i phyir dngos po tshad ma ma yin nam /
analyzed: tshig brjod bar 'dod ba'i 'bras bu yin ba'i phyir dngos po tshad ma ma yin nam /
translated: Is not a thing a valid cognition because it is the result of the desire to express?

original: ci ltar de gegs byed ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar de gegs byed ba yin zhe na /
translated: How does it obstruct?

original: bden te / 'on kyang brjod pa'i shugs kyis 'ongs pa 'di'i tshad ma ni 'dod pa'i yul can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bden te / 'on kyang brjod pa'i shugs kyis 'ongs pa 'di'i tshad ma ni 'dod pa'i yul can ni ma yin te /
translated: It is true, but the valid cognition that comes about through the force of expression does not have a desired object.

original: 'on kyang phyi rol gyi don gyi yul can yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyi rol gyi don gyi yul can yin no //
translated: However, it has an external object.

original: 'di ltar bsam ba la tshad ma ma yin yang spyi'i don rtogs bar bya ba'i phyir ngag brjod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam ba la tshad ma ma yin yang spyi'i don rtogs bar bya ba'i phyir ngag brjod la /
translated: Thus, although it is not a valid cognition with respect to thought, speech is expressed in order to make known a general object.

original: spyi'i don la tshad mar bstan par mi 'dod na ni smra bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi'i don la tshad mar bstan par mi 'dod na ni smra bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one did not assert that it is a valid cognition with respect to a general object, one would not speak.

original: brjod pa'i shugs kyis 'ongs pa gang yin pa nyid ni 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: brjod pa'i shugs kyis 'ongs pa gang yin pa nyid ni 'dod pa yin la /
translated: That which comes about through the force of expression is desired.

original: gzhan ni bkag pa'i phyir 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni bkag pa'i phyir 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is not is not desired because it is refuted.

original: brjod pa'i dus na 'dod pa gang yin pa des brjod par bya ba'i gegs byas na rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa'i dus na 'dod pa gang yin pa des brjod par bya ba'i gegs byas na rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: If that which is desired at the time of expression obstructs the object of expression, it contradicts one‚Äôs own words.

original: 'dod ba gcig dang 'dod ba gzhan 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod ba gcig dang 'dod ba gzhan 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one desire is contradictory to another desire.

original: de'i tshig rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba ni gegs su 'gyur ba kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshig rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba ni gegs su 'gyur ba kho na yin gyi /
translated: The statement of the opponent contradicts his own words, and is therefore a fallacy.

original: phyi rol gyi yul can gyi tshad mar 'dod bas gnod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul can gyi tshad mar 'dod bas gnod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not a fallacy in the sense of being contradicted by a valid cognition that has an external object as its object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bdag gam gzhan yang rung don ji lta ba bzhin mthong bas dag 'jug ba ni yid ches pas yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bdag gam gzhan yang rung don ji lta ba bzhin mthong bas dag 'jug ba ni yid ches pas yin la /
translated: Therefore, when one engages in an action, either oneself or through the words of another, one does so with confidence, because one sees that the action is in accordance with fact.

original: de'i tshig ni don gyi 'bras bu yin no zhes khas blangs par rab tu grags pa phyi rol gyi 'bras bu nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: de'i tshig ni don gyi 'bras bu yin no zhes khas blangs par rab tu grags pa phyi rol gyi 'bras bu nyid du brjod do //
translated: The statement of the opponent is the result of the fact that the action is in accordance with fact.

original: bsam pa'i 'bras bu nyid ni tshig thams cad la yod pas khyad par don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam pa'i 'bras bu nyid ni tshig thams cad la yod pas khyad par don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the result of the intention is present in all statements, the distinction is meaningless.

original: gegs byed pa ni yang cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gegs byed pa ni yang cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is the point of the fallacy?

original: tshig don la nges ba nyid yin na ni rang gi don gyis don gzhan gyi gegs byed par 'gyur na /
analyzed: tshig don la nges ba nyid yin na ni rang gi don gyis don gzhan gyi gegs byed par 'gyur na /
translated: If the statement is certain with regard to the fact, then the statement itself would be a fallacy with regard to another fact.

original: tshad ma ma yin ba ni don the tshom za ba yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin ba ni don the tshom za ba yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: A nonvalid cognition is one that is uncertain about its object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir te tshad ma ma yin ba nyid kyi phyir stobs mtshungs ba yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir te tshad ma ma yin ba nyid kyi phyir stobs mtshungs ba yin la /
translated: Because of that, i.e., because it is a nonvalid cognition, it is equal in strength.

original: stobs mtshungs bas gegs byed ba yin no //
analyzed: stobs mtshungs bas gegs byed ba yin no //
translated: And because it is equal in strength, it is an obstruction.

original: 'gal bdag gcig la mi srid pa'i phyir dang / rnam ba gnyi gas stong ba yang mi @49b rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gal bdag gcig la mi srid pa'i phyir dang / rnam ba gnyi gas stong ba yang mi @49b rung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is impossible for two contradictory cognitions to exist in one person, and because it is impossible for there to be a cognition that is empty of both aspects.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa gnyi ga'i don la the tshom za ba yin la /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa gnyi ga'i don la the tshom za ba yin la /
translated: A nonvalid cognition is one that is uncertain about the object of both.

original: the tshom za ba'i phyir ni phan tshun gegs su 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i phyir ni phan tshun gegs su 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: And because it is uncertain, it is mutually obstructive.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ga las she na /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ga las she na /
translated: Why is it because it is a nonvalid cognition?

original: bshad pa / gang gi phyir gal te ngag gnyis po de la gcig tshad ma yin na de gnyi ga grub pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bshad pa / gang gi phyir gal te ngag gnyis po de la gcig tshad ma yin na de gnyi ga grub pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: It is said: Because if one of those two statements were a valid cognition, then both would be established.

original: gang gis kyang gang la gegs byed par ni mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir ni tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gis kyang gang la gegs byed par ni mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir ni tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: And because it is impossible for either of them to be an obstruction, therefore it is a nonvalid cognition.

original: gang du gnyi ga yod med the tshom za ba der gegs su 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gang du gnyi ga yod med the tshom za ba der gegs su 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Where there is doubt as to whether either exists or does not exist, there is an obstruction.

original: de ni the tshom gyi 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni the tshom gyi 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the result of doubt.

original: 'dir ni gnyi ga yod pa dang med par nges pa yin te //
analyzed: 'dir ni gnyi ga yod pa dang med par nges pa yin te //
translated: Here, there is certainty as to whether either exists or does not exist.

original: des na gegs ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gegs ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no obstruction.

original: gang las gegs ma yin par 'gyur ba gnyi ga grub pa nyid ga las she na /
analyzed: gang las gegs ma yin par 'gyur ba gnyi ga grub pa nyid ga las she na /
translated: From what is there non-obstruction? From the establishment of both.

original: bshad pa / tshad ma'i tshig gis tshad ma ma yin pa la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / tshad ma'i tshig gis tshad ma ma yin pa la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In response, it is said: Because a statement of valid cognition contradicts invalid cognition.

original: gang du gang zhig gnod par byas pa dang grub pa gang yin pa gnyi ga yang de la yod pa dang med par nges pa'i phyir gang las gegs su 'gyur /
analyzed: gang du gang zhig gnod par byas pa dang grub pa gang yin pa gnyi ga yang de la yod pa dang med par nges pa'i phyir gang las gegs su 'gyur /
translated: Where there is contradiction and where there is establishment, both are ascertained as either existent or non-existent there. From what is there obstruction?

original: gal te tshad mas tshad ma ma yin pa la gnod na //
analyzed: gal te tshad mas tshad ma ma yin pa la gnod na //
translated: If valid cognition contradicts invalid cognition,

original: 'o na ni bstan bcos gegs byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni bstan bcos gegs byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then the treatise would not be obstructive,

original: 'on kyang gnod par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang gnod par byed pa nyid do //
translated: but rather it would be contradictory.

original: 'di ltar rgol ba des khas blangs pa'i phyir bstan bcos kyis grub pa dang / nyams su myong bas grub pa'i dngos po thams cad la bstan bcos tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgol ba des khas blangs pa'i phyir bstan bcos kyis grub pa dang / nyams su myong bas grub pa'i dngos po thams cad la bstan bcos tshad ma yin te /
translated: Because the opponent accepts this, all things that are established by treatises and established by experience are valid cognitions.

original: de nyid kyis na de ni thams cad du gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na de ni thams cad du gnod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is contradictory to say that it is invalid in all cases.

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i mtshan ma yang tshad ma'o zhes bya bar shes pas gnod pa byed pa yin la /
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i mtshan ma yang tshad ma'o zhes bya bar shes pas gnod pa byed pa yin la /
translated: Since it is known that the sign that engages by the power of the thing is a valid cognition, it is contradictory.

original: bstan bcos kyang tshad mar khas blangs pa yin pas ci ltar gnod par byed pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos kyang tshad mar khas blangs pa yin pas ci ltar gnod par byed pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Since the treatise is accepted as a valid cognition, how is it not contradictory?

original: khas blangs par khyad par med kyang ci ltar tshig gcig ni tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa yang yin la gzhan ni tshad ma ma yin /
analyzed: khas blangs par khyad par med kyang ci ltar tshig gcig ni tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa yang yin la gzhan ni tshad ma ma yin /
translated: Although there is no difference in their acceptance, one is a valid cognition and the other is not, so one is contradictory and the other is not.

original: khas blangs bas byas pa tshad ma nyid yin na gnyi ga yang khas blangs par khyad par med pas tshad mar khyad par med pa'i phyir gnyi ga la yang gnod par byed ba nyid do //
analyzed: khas blangs bas byas pa tshad ma nyid yin na gnyi ga yang khas blangs par khyad par med pas tshad mar khyad par med pa'i phyir gnyi ga la yang gnod par byed ba nyid do //
translated: If it were valid cognition because of acceptance, then since there is no difference between the two in terms of acceptance, there would be no difference in terms of their validity, and thus both would be invalidated.

original: yul gcig la ni gnyi ga gnod par byed par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: yul gcig la ni gnyi ga gnod par byed par mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable that both invalidate a single object,

original: gnod par byed pa ni yod pa yin la /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa ni yod pa yin la /
translated: because that which invalidates exists,

original: gnod par bya ba ni med pa yin na /üîΩgcig ni cig car yod pa dang med par @50a * //
analyzed: gnod par bya ba ni med pa yin na / gcig ni cig car yod pa dang med par @50a * //
translated: and that which is invalidated does not exist.

original: 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba yin no //
translated: It is contradictory for one thing to both exist and not exist simultaneously.

original: des na gegs byed pa nyid du 'thad do //
analyzed: des na gegs byed pa nyid du 'thad do //
translated: Therefore it is tenable that it is an obstruction.

original: gzhan yang khas blangs pas gnod pa byed pa nyid du smra ba na /
analyzed: gzhan yang khas blangs pas gnod pa byed pa nyid du smra ba na /
translated: Moreover, when you assert that it invalidates by acceptance,

original: bstan bcos 'di'i tshad ma nyid skyes bu'i 'dod pas byas pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos 'di'i tshad ma nyid skyes bu'i 'dod pas byas pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: then the validity of this treatise is completely created by the desire of the person,

original: sngar khyod mi 'dod kyang da ltar 'dod pas rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar khyod mi 'dod kyang da ltar 'dod pas rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because although you did not assert it previously, you assert it now.

original: gal te bstan bcos dang rang gi tshig la the tshom gyi 'bras bu can gegs byed pa yod pa de ltar na yang dam bca' ba'i skyon ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni gal te zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos dang rang gi tshig la the tshom gyi 'bras bu can gegs byed pa yod pa de ltar na yang dam bca' ba'i skyon ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni gal te zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If there is a contradiction between the treatise and one‚Äôs own words, and if there is an obstacle that is the result of doubt, even so, it is not a fault of the thesis. This is demonstrated by the phrase ‚Äúeven if there were.

original: rang gi tshig dang bstan bcos ngang 'gal ba gang yin pa de dag yod do zhe na yang ;
analyzed: rang gi tshig dang bstan bcos ngang 'gal ba gang yin pa de dag yod do zhe na yang ;
translated: ‚Äù If there were a contradiction between one‚Äôs own words and the treatise,

original: gags byed pa'i skyon du 'gyur na 'gyur la rag ste /
analyzed: gags byed pa'i skyon du 'gyur na 'gyur la rag ste /
translated: then there would be the fault of an obstacle.

original: de lta na yang ci ltar phyogs kyi skyon yin te ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta na yang ci ltar phyogs kyi skyon yin te ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Even so, how could it be a fault of the thesis? It could not!

original: ci ltar zhe na /üîΩgang gi phyir gegs byed pa de las ni bsgrub par bya ba la the tshom du 'gyur ba kho nar zad kyi sel bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na / gang gi phyir gegs byed pa de las ni bsgrub par bya ba la the tshom du 'gyur ba kho nar zad kyi sel bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: How could it not?üîΩBecause from that obstacle, there would be only doubt about the probandum, but there would be no elimination of the probandum.

original: the tshom de ni kha na ma tho ba bsal ba med par bstan pa la yang yod pa'i phyir mtshungs pa yin pa de'i phyir phyogs kyi skyon ma yin no //
analyzed: the tshom de ni kha na ma tho ba bsal ba med par bstan pa la yang yod pa'i phyir mtshungs pa yin pa de'i phyir phyogs kyi skyon ma yin no //
translated: Since that doubt would exist even in the teaching that does not eliminate the fault, it is the same. Therefore it is not a fault of the thesis.

original: the tshom ni phyogs kyi yon tan yin gyi skyon ni ma yin te /
analyzed: the tshom ni phyogs kyi yon tan yin gyi skyon ni ma yin te /
translated: Doubt is a fault of a reason, not a fault of a position,

original: the tshom za ba'i yul la gtan tshigs kyi byed pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i yul la gtan tshigs kyi byed pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the activity of a reason engages an object about which there is doubt.

original: gags byed pa the tshom gyi 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir phyogs kyi skyon du smra /
analyzed: gags byed pa the tshom gyi 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir phyogs kyi skyon du smra /
translated: We say that it is a fault of a position because it is the result of an obstruction.

original: smra ba po de'i tshig las nges par mi skyed pa'i rgyu'i phyir tshig de skyon chags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: smra ba po de'i tshig las nges par mi skyed pa'i rgyu'i phyir tshig de skyon chags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The words of that speaker are not a faulty reason because they are not a cause of the non-generation of ascertainment.

original: gal te tshig gang las de'i don la nges pa mi skyed pas tshig de skyon can du 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: gal te tshig gang las de'i don la nges pa mi skyed pas tshig de skyon can du 'gyur ba ni /
translated: If the words of a reason are faulty because they do not generate ascertainment of that meaning,

original: the tshom za bas phyogs ma yin par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: the tshom za bas phyogs ma yin par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: then because of doubt, they would not be a position.

original: de ltar ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not like that.

original: 'o na ci ltar tshig skyon can du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar tshig skyon can du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well then, how are the words faulty?

original: bsgrub bya 'am gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: bsgrub bya 'am gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: It is because they do not generate ascertainment of the probandum or something else.

original: dngos po gang zhig dam bca' ba la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i ngag gi cha cung zad pa de dag las cha ci cam dang tshad ci tsam zhig bsgrub bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig dam bca' ba la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i ngag gi cha cung zad pa de dag las cha ci cam dang tshad ci tsam zhig bsgrub bya ste /
translated: What is the extent of the object to be established from those few parts of speech that establish a thesis, etc.?

original: yan lag gzhan gyis brjod par bya ba'i don dang 'brel bar rung bar bstan par bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yan lag gzhan gyis brjod par bya ba'i don dang 'brel bar rung bar bstan par bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is to be shown to be connected with the meaning to be expressed by the other parts.

original: tshig de tsam gyis don de bsgrub par mi nus pa'i phyir smra ba po'i tshig gi skyon yin no //
analyzed: tshig de tsam gyis don de bsgrub par mi nus pa'i phyir smra ba po'i tshig gi skyon yin no //
translated: Because that meaning cannot be established by those words alone, it is a fault of the speaker's words.

original: dam bca' ba'i tshig gis don ci lta bu zhig bsgrub par bya ba yin pa dang / ci ltar nam bsgrubs par 'gyur te @50b gnye ga bsten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i tshig gis don ci lta bu zhig bsgrub par bya ba yin pa dang / ci ltar nam bsgrubs par 'gyur te @50b gnye ga bsten pa'i phyir /
translated: What kind of meaning is to be established by the words of the thesis, and how is it to be established? Because it is to be shown,

original: dam bca' ba'i tshig gis ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i tshig gis ni zhes smos so //
translated: it says by the words of the thesis.

original: rang gi bsam pa ni yul can bsams bas yul don bstan pa'i phyir rang gi bsams pa'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi bsam pa ni yul can bsams bas yul don bstan pa'i phyir rang gi bsams pa'i don to //
translated: Our own thought is that the object is shown by the thought of the subject, so it is the meaning of our own thought.

original: dam bca' ba'i tshig gis ni de srid par bstan par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i tshig gis ni de srid par bstan par bya ba yin na /
translated: If the meaning is to be shown by the words of the thesis,

original: bstan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bstan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not a teaching,

original: gang gi phyir dam bca' ba'i don de ni ci ltar tshad mas gnod par 'gyur na mi 'thad pa de bzhin du chos can gcig la 'gal ba nye bar sdud na yang srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dam bca' ba'i don de ni ci ltar tshad mas gnod par 'gyur na mi 'thad pa de bzhin du chos can gcig la 'gal ba nye bar sdud na yang srid pa ma yin no //
translated: because the meaning of the thesis is not established by valid cognition, and it is not possible for two contradictory meanings to be combined in a single subject.

original: chos can la ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i don gnyis srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos can la ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i don gnyis srid pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible for a single subject to have two contradictory meanings.

original: de'i phyir dam bca' ba'i tshig gis mi srid pa'i don gyis sgrub par byed pa'i phyir na tshig skyon chags pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dam bca' ba'i tshig gis mi srid pa'i don gyis sgrub par byed pa'i phyir na tshig skyon chags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the words of the thesis do not establish a possible meaning, the words are faulty.

original: gal te smra ba bo'i skyon yin pa de lta na yang don gyi dngos po bde ba ster bar mi byed pa nyid ni de la the tshom za ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te smra ba bo'i skyon yin pa de lta na yang don gyi dngos po bde ba ster bar mi byed pa nyid ni de la the tshom za ba yin te /
translated: If the fault is in the words, then even though the meaning is not clear, one should doubt whether it is a thing that grants happiness.

original: des na de ni bsgrub bya nyid du ni 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: des na de ni bsgrub bya nyid du ni 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is contradictory to say that it is the thesis.üîΩIn response, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / gzhan gyi don gyis rjes su dpag pa ni tshig gi skyon yon gtsor byed pa yin ba ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / gzhan gyi don gyis rjes su dpag pa ni tshig gi skyon yon gtsor byed pa yin ba ste /
translated: Inference for the sake of others emphasizes the faults and good qualities of the words.

original: skabs su byas nas brtag par bya ba yin pas ni sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i don la ltos nas sgra'i skyon yon brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: skabs su byas nas brtag par bya ba yin pas ni sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i don la ltos nas sgra'i skyon yon brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: But when one is speaking in a certain context, one should examine the faults and good qualities of the words in terms of their expression of the meaning.

original: don gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: But not in terms of the meaning,

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa don de tsam gyi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa don de tsam gyi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because the meaning is not the mere thing that is expressed.

original: gal te don skyon med kyang phyin ci log tu brjod par bya ba'i ngo bos skyon can yin pa'i phyir de yang skyon can du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te don skyon med kyang phyin ci log tu brjod par bya ba'i ngo bos skyon can yin pa'i phyir de yang skyon can du 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the meaning is faultless, but the expression is faulty because it is expressed in a distorted form, then that expression is faulty.

original: dngos po'i gnas lugs la skyon med pas skyon med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i gnas lugs la skyon med pas skyon med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not faultless because the reality of things is faultless.

original: ci'i phyir tshig gi skyon yin gyi dbang du byas she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshig gi skyon yin gyi dbang du byas she na /
translated: Why is it a fault of the words and not a fault of the meaning?

original: don gyi phyin ci log brjod pas smra ba po la klan kar 'gyur ba'i phyir te skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi phyin ci log brjod pas smra ba po la klan kar 'gyur ba'i phyir te skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the speaker is faulted for expressing the meaning in a distorted way.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni skyes bu'i spobs pa rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni skyes bu'i spobs pa rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: In an inference for the sake of others, one understands the speaker‚Äôs confidence.

original: dngos po tsam ni ma yin pas skyon can brjod na /
analyzed: dngos po tsam ni ma yin pas skyon can brjod na /
translated: But it is not just the thing itself, so if you say it is faulty,

original: skyes bu la klan kar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu la klan kar 'gyur ro //
translated: you are quibbling with the person.

original: de lta na yang rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya bya ba dang / de bzhin du chos ni 'phos nas bde ba ster bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i chos gcig gi don des brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de lta na yang rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya bya ba dang / de bzhin du chos ni 'phos nas bde ba ster bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i chos gcig gi don des brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: In the same way, is it not the case that the meaning of a single word, such as ‚Äúinferential cognition‚Äù or ‚Äúa phenomenon,‚Äù is not expressed?

original: de ci ltar mi srid pa'i don brjod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar mi srid pa'i don brjod pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the meaning of that is not possible?

original: shugs kyis te tshig rjod par byed pa na /
analyzed: shugs kyis te tshig rjod par byed pa na /
