translated: It is by implication, when the word is uttered.

original: brjod pa'i shugs nyid kyis de don med na mi 'byung ba'i @51a * //
analyzed: brjod pa'i shugs nyid kyis de don med na mi 'byung ba'i @51a * //
translated: By the force of the expression itself, it is taught that the meaning of that is a valid cognition that does not occur without it.

original: tshad ma nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes mang du bshad zin to //üîΩde bzhin du chos bde ba ster bar byed pa ma yin no zhes chos can du byed pas bstan bcos tshad mar 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes mang du bshad zin to // de bzhin du chos bde ba ster bar byed pa ma yin no zhes chos can du byed pas bstan bcos tshad mar 'dod pa yin te /
translated: This has been explained many times.üîΩIn the same way, by positing the subject, ‚ÄúA phenomenon does not bestow happiness,‚Äù it is asserted that the treatise is valid.

original: des na chos kyi sgra'i shugs kyis de la bde ba ster bar byed ba nyid kyang brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na chos kyi sgra'i shugs kyis de la bde ba ster bar byed ba nyid kyang brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, by the force of the word ‚Äúphenomenon,‚Äù it also expresses that it bestows happiness.

original: des na the tshom za bas tshig skyon can du 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na the tshom za bas tshig skyon can du 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is not that the words are faulty because of doubt,

original: 'on kyang gcig la bsgrub bar mi nus pa 'gal ba'i chos gnyis dang ldan pa brjod pa las yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gcig la bsgrub bar mi nus pa 'gal ba'i chos gnyis dang ldan pa brjod pa las yin no //
translated: but rather, it is because of stating two contradictory properties that cannot be established with respect to one subject.

original: des na dam bca' ba'i don 'di ni smra ba bo'i skyon gyis skyon can du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: des na dam bca' ba'i don 'di ni smra ba bo'i skyon gyis skyon can du gyur pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the thesis is faulty because of the fault of the proponent.

original: gal te gegs tsam zhig byed pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba dag la bye brag ci yang med na /
analyzed: gal te gegs tsam zhig byed pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba dag la bye brag ci yang med na /
translated: If there is no difference at all in the case of contradiction of one‚Äôs own words and accepting something, because they merely create an obstacle,

original: 'o na sngar khas blangs pa'i lung de dang 'gal ba'i yul la bye brag ci yang med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'o na sngar khas blangs pa'i lung de dang 'gal ba'i yul la bye brag ci yang med par 'gyur la /
translated: then there would be no difference at all in the case of contradicting a scripture that one previously accepted.

original: yul la bye brag med pa'i phyir logs shig tu byed par mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni skyon yin no //
analyzed: yul la bye brag med pa'i phyir logs shig tu byed par mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni skyon yin no //
translated: And because there is no difference with respect to the object, it is not correct to treat them separately. This is the fault.

original: kha cig yul gyi bye brag 'chad pa ni gang gi phyir gzhung lugs 'ga' zhig la ma brten par chos can gang la dpyod pa mi 'jug pa'i gzhung lugs de ni med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kha cig yul gyi bye brag 'chad pa ni gang gi phyir gzhung lugs 'ga' zhig la ma brten par chos can gang la dpyod pa mi 'jug pa'i gzhung lugs de ni med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Some explain that the specific object is the subject of the syllogism, because without relying on some scriptural tradition, analysis does not engage the subject.

original: der brten bar bya ba kho na yin pa des na gzhung lugs 'di'i gags byed pa'i yul ni chos can de nyid yin la /
analyzed: der brten bar bya ba kho na yin pa des na gzhung lugs 'di'i gags byed pa'i yul ni chos can de nyid yin la /
translated: Since that scriptural tradition is the basis of the analysis, the specific object is the subject of the syllogism.

original: rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba brjod pa ni thams cad du srid pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba brjod pa ni thams cad du srid pa'o //
translated: The contradiction of one‚Äôs own words is possible in all cases.

original: tshig gi don byed na mi 'byung bas byas pa'i tshad mar 'dod pa gang yin pa ni tshig brjod pa'i skabs nyid las 'ongs pa yin pas des gnod pa'i brjod par bya ba'i don ni thams cad du yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: tshig gi don byed na mi 'byung bas byas pa'i tshad mar 'dod pa gang yin pa ni tshig brjod pa'i skabs nyid las 'ongs pa yin pas des gnod pa'i brjod par bya ba'i don ni thams cad du yin no zhe'o //
translated: Since the meaning of the words is not produced, it is asserted that the valid knowledge that produces it comes from the mere occasion of the expression of the words. Therefore, the meaning of the expression that is undermined by that is in all cases.

original: khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba 'di la yang gzhan gzhung lugs la gdon mi za bar brten pa gang yin pa de ni 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba 'di la yang gzhan gzhung lugs la gdon mi za bar brten pa gang yin pa de ni 'ga' yang med de /
translated: This contradiction of what is accepted is also like that, because there is no doubt that one relies on another‚Äôs scriptural tradition.

original: gang gi phyir rgol ba de nyid kyi don de gzhan gzhung lugs byed ba'i kha nas rang nyid kyis rnam par bzhag nas yang dag gzhan gyis 'gog par byed pa de'i phyir na yul gyi dbye ba snga ma nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgol ba de nyid kyi don de gzhan gzhung lugs byed ba'i kha nas rang nyid kyis rnam par bzhag nas yang dag gzhan gyis 'gog par byed pa de'i phyir na yul gyi dbye ba snga ma nyid yin te /
translated: Because the opponent himself, having posited the meaning of his own thesis, refutes it with another argument, therefore the division of the object is the former one.

original: gang gi tshe ngag snga mas khas blangs pa phyi mas 'gal bar byed pa'i tshe ni khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ngag snga mas khas blangs pa phyi mas 'gal bar byed pa'i tshe ni khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yin la /
translated: When the latter statement contradicts the former statement, which was accepted, then there is contradiction with what was accepted.

original: ngag gcig nyid la ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: ngag gcig nyid la ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: When there is contradiction with a single statement, then there is contradiction with one's own words.

original: khas blangs pa 'bras bu'i rtags bshad nas /
analyzed: khas blangs pa 'bras bu'i rtags bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the reason of the result of what was accepted,

original: @51b grags pa bshad pa'i phyir grags pa yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: @51b grags pa bshad pa'i phyir grags pa yang zhes smos so //
translated: in order to explain the reason of what is renowned, he says, what is renowned...

original: grags pa ni tha snyad kyi yul can gyi rtogs ba ste /
analyzed: grags pa ni tha snyad kyi yul can gyi rtogs ba ste /
translated: What is renowned is the realization of the object of convention.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa gting tshugs pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa gting tshugs pa yin la /
translated: It is a deep-seated conceptual consciousness.

original: de ni rang dang 'gal ba'i don la gnod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rang dang 'gal ba'i don la gnod par byed pa yin no //
translated: And that is what invalidates the object that contradicts itself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid ces bya ba gang yin pa de ni brjod par bya ba'i don rnams la dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid ces bya ba gang yin pa de ni brjod par bya ba'i don rnams la dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is called ‚Äúthe state of being expressible by the word desire‚Äù cannot be denied in regard to the objects of expression.

original: de nyid gang las she na /
analyzed: de nyid gang las she na /
translated: From what is that so?

original: gang gi phyir 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid ni skyes bu'i 'dod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid ni skyes bu'i 'dod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba yin te /
translated: Because the state of being expressible by the word desire is related to the mere desire of a person.

original: de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ro //
translated: That is why.

original: gal te 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid dgag par mi nus pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid dgag par mi nus pa yin na /
translated: If the state of being expressible by the word desire cannot be denied,

original: 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba de nyid gnod par byed par 'gyur gyi grags pa'i go ci ltar gnod par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba de nyid gnod par byed par 'gyur gyi grags pa'i go ci ltar gnod par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: then that very state of being expressible by the word desire is the refutation. How is the well-known one the refutation?

original: bshad pa / tha snyad du byas pa'i tha snyad ni rtog pa ste rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid do //
analyzed: bshad pa / tha snyad du byas pa'i tha snyad ni rtog pa ste rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid do //
translated: It is said: The conventional that is made is a conception, the mere object of conception.

original: grags pa'i rang bzhin rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyi tha snyad de las skyes pa'i chos 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos de ni grags pa las skyes pa'i phyir grags pa'i sgras brjod de /
analyzed: grags pa'i rang bzhin rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyi tha snyad de las skyes pa'i chos 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos de ni grags pa las skyes pa'i phyir grags pa'i sgras brjod de /
translated: That property is expressed by the word ‚Äúdesired‚Äù because it arises from renown.

original: grags pa tsam gyis grub pa'i don gang yin pa de 'dir gnod par byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grags pa tsam gyis grub pa'i don gang yin pa de 'dir gnod par byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning that is established by mere renown is what is refuted here.

original: chos de nyid ni grags pa las grub pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos de nyid ni grags pa las grub pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: That very property is established by renown.

original: la lar rab tu grub pa'i sgras brjod de /
analyzed: la lar rab tu grub pa'i sgras brjod de /
translated: Therefore, in some cases, it is expressed by the word ‚Äúestablished.‚Äù

original: grub pas ma bsal ba zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: grub pas ma bsal ba zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚Äúnot refuted by establishment.‚Äù

original: ci ste 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid ci ltar na don thams cad la dgag par mi nus she na /
analyzed: ci ste 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid ci ltar na don thams cad la dgag par mi nus she na /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúHow is it that the mere property of being the object of expression by the word ‚Äòdesired‚Äô cannot refute all objects?‚Äù

original: 'dod pa tsam dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so ;
analyzed: 'dod pa tsam dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so ;
translated: [The root text] states, ‚Äúmere desire,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir thams cad ni byas pa dang ma byas pa brdar btags pa dang ma btags pa'i sgra rnams kyi brjod par bya ba nus pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad ni byas pa dang ma byas pa brdar btags pa dang ma btags pa'i sgra rnams kyi brjod par bya ba nus pa yin no //
translated: Because all are the referents of words, whether they are made or not, whether they are conventional or not.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa la snang ba'i ngo bos yin gyi dngos bos gzung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa la snang ba'i ngo bos yin gyi dngos bos gzung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: By nature means by the nature that appears to conceptual consciousnesses, not by the nature that is apprehended by the sense consciousnesses.

original: dngos po la mi ltos pa'i 'dod pa ni 'dod pa tsam ste /
analyzed: dngos po la mi ltos pa'i 'dod pa ni 'dod pa tsam ste /
translated: The assertion that does not depend on things is mere assertion.

original: sgra rnams ni rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi don la 'dod pa tsam des 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra rnams ni rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi don la 'dod pa tsam des 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Words engage their referents by mere assertion, by the nature that appears to conceptual consciousnesses.

original: des na dngos po rnams ni rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa'i rang bzhin gyi mthar thug pa'i sgrar rung ba yin no //
analyzed: des na dngos po rnams ni rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa'i rang bzhin gyi mthar thug pa'i sgrar rung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, things are suitable as words that ultimately have a nature that exists in conceptual consciousnesses.üîΩWords are made for things

original: byung ba sgra la brdar byas @52a * //
analyzed: byung ba sgra la brdar byas @52a * //
translated: that have arisen.

original: pa dper na zla ba'i sgra la zla ba lta bu dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba sgra la brdar ma byas pa dper na zla ba'i sgra la bum pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: pa dper na zla ba'i sgra la zla ba lta bu dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba sgra la brdar ma byas pa dper na zla ba'i sgra la bum pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúmoon‚Äù is a convention for a pot, etc.

original: sgrar rung ba nyid des so //
analyzed: sgrar rung ba nyid des so //
translated: It is because of the suitability for expression.

original: don tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚Äú Associated with mere object‚Äù means

original: 'dod pas sprul ba'i rung ba nyid ci ltar don tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pas sprul ba'i rung ba nyid ci ltar don tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is the suitability for expression of the desire-realm emanation associated with mere object?

original: brjod pa phyi rol gyi don ni don tsam ma yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa phyi rol gyi don ni don tsam ma yin te /
translated: It is said: External objects are not mere objects.

original: 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyi don yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyi don yin no //
translated: However, they are objects of conceptual consciousness.

original: sgrar rung ba de ni brjod par bya ba yin gyi phyi rol ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrar rung ba de ni brjod par bya ba yin gyi phyi rol ni ma yin no //
translated: That suitability for expression is the object of expression, not the external object.

original: des na rung ba nyid de 'dod pas sprul ba yin yang rnam bar rtogs la gnas pa'i don tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rung ba nyid de 'dod pas sprul ba yin yang rnam bar rtogs la gnas pa'i don tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though that suitability is an emanation of desire, it is associated with mere object that is the basis of conceptual consciousness.

original: des na rung ba nyid de 'gog pa 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don nam don de nyid smra ba po'i skyes bu la gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rung ba nyid de 'gog pa 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don nam don de nyid smra ba po'i skyes bu la gnod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the characteristic of being inexpressible, which is the object of the negation of being suitable, is that the person who is the speaker is harmed by that object.

original: de la tshad ma'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la tshad ma'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of valid cognition is as follows.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul gyi don gang yin pa de ni brdar byas pa'i sgras brjod par nus pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul gyi don gang yin pa de ni brdar byas pa'i sgras brjod par nus pa yin te /
translated: The object that is the object of a conceptual consciousness can be expressed by a term that has been conventionally adopted.

original: dper na rnam par rtog pa'i yul yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don la shing gi sgras brjod par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na rnam par rtog pa'i yul yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don la shing gi sgras brjod par nus pa yin no //
translated: For example, the object that possesses branches and so on, which is the object of a conceptual consciousness, can be expressed by the term tree.

original: de bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyang rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir sgra thams cad kyis brjod par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyang rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir sgra thams cad kyis brjod par nus pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, all things are objects of conceptual consciousnesses, and therefore all terms can express them.

original: dngos po la sgra don gyi 'brel pa yod na sgras brjod par mi nus par 'gyur ba yin na de yang bkag zin to //
analyzed: dngos po la sgra don gyi 'brel pa yod na sgras brjod par mi nus par 'gyur ba yin na de yang bkag zin to //
translated: If a thing had a relation with the meaning of a term, it would not be possible for a term to express it, but that has already been refuted.

original: lhag ma shes pa'i bdag nyid la gnas pa'i don gang zhig sgra dang 'brel bar mi nus she na /
analyzed: lhag ma shes pa'i bdag nyid la gnas pa'i don gang zhig sgra dang 'brel bar mi nus she na /
translated: What is the meaning of the remainder that is not able to be connected with a word?

original: gang zhig sgra'i rnam pa dang lhan cig shes pa gcig la mi 'dre'o //
analyzed: gang zhig sgra'i rnam pa dang lhan cig shes pa gcig la mi 'dre'o //
translated: That which is not mixed with the form of a word in a single cognition.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa ni don ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir de la gnas pa'i don brjod pa'i rnam pa dang 'drer rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa ni don ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir de la gnas pa'i don brjod pa'i rnam pa dang 'drer rung ba nyid do //
translated: Because a conceptual cognition is uncertain with regard to its object, the meaning that is present in it is suitable to be mixed with the form of a word.

original: de'i phyir brjod par mi nus pa nyid ni /üîΩbrjod pa'i rnam pa dang 'drer mi rung bas khyab la /
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par mi nus pa nyid ni / brjod pa'i rnam pa dang 'drer mi rung bas khyab la /
translated: Therefore, the inability to be expressedüîΩis pervaded by the unsuitability of being mixed with the form of a word.

original: brjod pa'i rnam pa dang 'drer rung ba nyid ni khyab par byed pa ngang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa'i rnam pa dang 'drer rung ba nyid ni khyab par byed pa ngang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: The suitability of being mixed with the form of a word is the pervader that is incompatible with the pervaded.

original: des kyang rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul nyid la khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: des kyang rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul nyid la khyab pa yin te /
translated: That also pervades the object of a conceptual cognition.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul nyid ni de'i khyab par byed pa dang 'gal bas khyab pa'i phyir de dang yang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul nyid ni de'i khyab par byed pa dang 'gal bas khyab pa'i phyir de dang yang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, in that way, the object of a conceptual cognition is pervaded by the pervader that is incompatible with it.

original: des na de dang 'gal ba nus pa nyid kyis khyab @52b pa yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: des na de dang 'gal ba nus pa nyid kyis khyab @52b pa yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: Therefore, since it is pervaded by the opposite of that, it is a reason based on the nature of things.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul gyi don nyid 'gro ba'i lugs dang / grags pa tha snyad du brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul gyi don nyid 'gro ba'i lugs dang / grags pa tha snyad du brjod pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the object of a conceptual consciousness is the way of the world, and it is expressed conventionally in terms of what is renowned.

original: de yang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: And that is a reason based on the nature of things.

original: grags ba des bsgrub pa gang yin pa tha snyad de las skyes pa 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid ces bya ba ni 'gal zla 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba ma yin pa la gnod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: grags ba des bsgrub pa gang yin pa tha snyad de las skyes pa 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid ces bya ba ni 'gal zla 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba ma yin pa la gnod par byed pa yin no //
translated: Whatever is established by that renown is a convention. That which is produced from that is asserted to be the object expressed by a word. That is the refutation of the opposite of that, which is not the object expressed by a word.

original: thams cad rnam par rtog pa'i gzung ba'i mtshan nyid grags pa las sgra thams cad kyis brjod bar bya bar slob dpon bzhed pa yin no zhes 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad rnam par rtog pa'i gzung ba'i mtshan nyid grags pa las sgra thams cad kyis brjod bar bya bar slob dpon bzhed pa yin no zhes 'chad pa ni /
translated: The master accepts that all things are the objects of conceptual consciousnesses and are characterized by renown, and that all words express them.

original: de rung ba'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de rung ba'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is explained in the line ‚Äúby the power of their suitability.‚Äù

original: don tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba sgrar rung ba nyid de'i stobs kyis te /
analyzed: don tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba sgrar rung ba nyid de'i stobs kyis te /
translated: It is suitable to be related to mere meaning, because of the power of that.

original: gang gi phyir 'dod pas sbyar ba'i don tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba yin pa des na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod pas sbyar ba'i don tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba yin pa des na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúbecause of that‚Äù is that it is related to mere meaning that is applied by desire.

original: sgra mtha' dag ni de nyid la 'brel ba yin te /
analyzed: sgra mtha' dag ni de nyid la 'brel ba yin te /
translated: All words are related to that,

original: rjod par byed pa'i ngo bor sbyar zhing bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa'i ngo bor sbyar zhing bkod pa yin no //
translated: because they are applied and arranged in the nature of the expression.

original: don 'ga' zhig la sgra 'ga' zhig kho na 'brel bar mthong ba ma yin nam de ci ltar thams cad 'brel pa yin zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: don 'ga' zhig la sgra 'ga' zhig kho na 'brel bar mthong ba ma yin nam de ci ltar thams cad 'brel pa yin zhes brjod ce na /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it seen that some words are related to some meanings? How can it be said that all are related?

original: dngos su na zhes smos te /
analyzed: dngos su na zhes smos te /
translated: The word ‚Äúactually‚Äù is stated.

original: 'jig rten na ma byas kyang tshogs ba tshang bas thogs pa med pa la /
analyzed: 'jig rten na ma byas kyang tshogs ba tshang bas thogs pa med pa la /
translated: In the world, when the assembly of conditions is complete, even without being made, there is no obstruction.

original: dngos su na byas pa yin no zhes brjod pas 'dir yang dngos po dang sgra rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa ni rung ba yin pa'i phyir sbyor ba'i tshogs pa tshang ba na dngos su na ste /
analyzed: dngos su na byas pa yin no zhes brjod pas 'dir yang dngos po dang sgra rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa ni rung ba yin pa'i phyir sbyor ba'i tshogs pa tshang ba na dngos su na ste /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúActually, it is made.‚Äù In the same way, here, because it is suitable for things and words to abide in conceptual thought, when the assembly of conditions of application is complete, it is actually the case that all words are related to all things.

original: rang bzhin nyid du na ma grub par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid du na ma grub par brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is said that it is not established as a nature.

original: gang gi phyir dngos su na sgra thams cad de la 'brel pa yin pa de'i phyir de la sgra thams cad kyi brjod bya nyid du grags pa med kyang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos su na sgra thams cad de la 'brel pa yin pa de'i phyir de la sgra thams cad kyi brjod bya nyid du grags pa med kyang /
translated: Because in reality all sounds are related to it, therefore, even though it is not known as the object of expression of all sounds,

original: thams cad thams cad la dogs pa yin pas na /
analyzed: thams cad thams cad la dogs pa yin pas na /
translated: since everything is suspected in everything,

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos de kho na nyid du na de grub par bshad de /
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos de kho na nyid du na de grub par bshad de /
translated: master DignƒÅga explained that it is established in reality.

original: gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: With whatever and so forth.

original: yang gi sgra ni de yang phyogs ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni de yang phyogs ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The word also means that is not the position.

original: bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa gang la gtan tshigs thams cad thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa gang la gtan tshigs thams cad thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med par 'gyur la /
translated: In any teaching of the probandum, since all reasons are not shared, there would be no inference.

original: sgra las byung ba'i grags pas don bsal ba de ni phyogs ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i grags pas don bsal ba de ni phyogs ma yin no //
translated: The elimination of the object by the renown of what arises from sound is not the position.

original: sgra las byung ba ni 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi don te /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba ni 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi don te /
translated: What arises from sound is the object characterized by being expressed by the sound of desire.

original: sgra nyid kyis 'ga' zhig tu @53a * //
analyzed: sgra nyid kyis 'ga' zhig tu @53a * //
translated: By the word itself, in some cases.üîΩ

original: ma gyur kyang 'dod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir rab tu grub pa yin no //
analyzed: ma gyur kyang 'dod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir rab tu grub pa yin no //
translated: Even though it is not so in some cases, it is well established because it is related to mere desire.

original: 'di nyid 'dir sgra thams cad kyis brjod par bya ba'i khungs yin gyi lhag ma ni zhar la brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'dir sgra thams cad kyis brjod par bya ba'i khungs yin gyi lhag ma ni zhar la brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is the source of the expression of all words here. The rest is a digression.

original: gang gi phyir 'dod pa'i sgra brjod par bya ba nyid thams cad la grub bar bzhed pa de nyid kyi phyir 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid kyis gnod pa'i gtan tshigs ni thun mong ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod pa'i sgra brjod par bya ba nyid thams cad la grub bar bzhed pa de nyid kyi phyir 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid kyis gnod pa'i gtan tshigs ni thun mong ma yin no //
translated: For the very reason that the expression of desired words is accepted as established for all, the reason of the expression of desired words is not uncommon.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang la yang zla ba ma yin par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la yang zla ba ma yin par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because non-moon is not established for anything.

original: gang la yod pa nyid zla ba ma yin pa dang rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i don ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la yod pa nyid zla ba ma yin pa dang rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i don ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no meaning at all that would be existent and not concomitant with non-moon.

original: des na mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa med pas thun mong ma yin pa yin gyi ma nges pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa med pas thun mong ma yin pa yin gyi ma nges pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is not applied to the similar class, it is not common, but it is not uncertain.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa'i yod pa nyid ni 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa'i yod pa nyid ni 'gal ba yin te /
translated: Thus, the existence of a conceptual construction is contradictory,

original: yod pa thams cad zla ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa thams cad zla ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all existence is the same.

original: ci ste gang zhig sgra las byung ba'i grags pa dang 'gal bas bsal ba de yang phyogs ma yin no zhes brjod par bya ba las ci'i phyir na gang la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med pa zhes de skad brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci ste gang zhig sgra las byung ba'i grags pa dang 'gal bas bsal ba de yang phyogs ma yin no zhes brjod par bya ba las ci'i phyir na gang la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med pa zhes de skad brjod ce na /
translated: But if you say that it is not a logical possibility to refute that which is contradicted by what is well known from verbal testimony, then why do you say that it is not an inference because it is not common?

original: gzhung 'di'i dgos pa bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhung 'di'i dgos pa bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the purpose of this treatise, he says,

original: de skad du brjod pa ni de dgag par mi nus pa nyid dam zhes smos so //
analyzed: de skad du brjod pa ni de dgag par mi nus pa nyid dam zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is said that it is not possible to refute that.‚Äù

original: sgra las byung ba'i grags pa'i chos ni rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dgag par mi nus so zhes sgra las byung ba'i grags pa de dang de 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir de ltar de lta bu'i gzhung brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i grags pa'i chos ni rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dgag par mi nus so zhes sgra las byung ba'i grags pa de dang de 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir de ltar de lta bu'i gzhung brjod pa yin no //
translated: The Dharma of the world is not refuted because it is not inferred, and so the text is stated in this way in order to show that the Dharma of the world is just like that.

original: dgos pa gzhan bshad pa ni /
analyzed: dgos pa gzhan bshad pa ni /
translated: The other purpose is stated:

original: zla bo'i tshad ma med pas nges par bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zla bo'i tshad ma med pas nges par bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because it is definitely taught without a valid cognition that contradicts it.

original: 'di la kha cig na re zla bo'i tshad ma med pas zla ba nyid nges par bshad pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di la kha cig na re zla bo'i tshad ma med pas zla ba nyid nges par bshad pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Here, some say that the moon itself is definitely taught without a valid cognition that contradicts it.

original: 'di la dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Here, this should be analyzed:

original: gal te zla bo'i tshad ma med pas zla ba nyid nges pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te zla bo'i tshad ma med pas zla ba nyid nges pa yin na /
translated: If the moon itself is definitely taught without a valid cognition that contradicts it,

original: gang la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med la zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'dis 'chad par 'gyur ba tshad ma nges par brjod pa'i phyir don gyis go bas 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med par ston pa yin no zhes bya ba da ltaüîΩbur 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can med par ston par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med la zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'dis 'chad par 'gyur ba tshad ma nges par brjod pa'i phyir don gyis go bas 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med par ston pa yin no zhes bya ba da lta bur 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can med par ston par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: This passage from the Pramanavarttika, ‚Äúbecause it is not shared,‚Äù which will be explained later, shows that there is no non-erroneous contradiction by implication, by the force of what is being said, in the sense that it is a definitive statement of valid cognition.üîΩThis is the position of the present author.

original: de lta na ni gang la rjes su @53b dpag pa med la zhes bya bas de ltar 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa med pa bstan pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta na ni gang la rjes su @53b dpag pa med la zhes bya bas de ltar 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa med pa bstan pa ma yin gyi /
translated: In that case, the passage, ‚Äúbecause it is not shared,‚Äù does not show that there is no non-erroneous contradiction.

original: 'on kyang dngos su brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos su brjod pa nyid do //
translated: Rather, it is a direct statement.

original: bstan pa'i don ni shugs kyis smras ba la brjod do //
analyzed: bstan pa'i don ni shugs kyis smras ba la brjod do //
translated: The meaning of the passage is that the statement is made by implication.

original: ci ste zla ba nyid du rjes su dpog pa la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can med par dngos su brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: ci ste zla ba nyid du rjes su dpog pa la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can med par dngos su brjod pa yin la /
translated: If it is a direct statement that there is no non-erroneous contradiction in the inference of moonness,üîΩthen the passage, ‚Äúbecause it is not shared,‚Äù is a direct statement that there is no non-erroneous contradiction in the inference of moonness.

original: des ni rjes su dpag pa gzhan la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can med par bstan pa yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa yin na /
analyzed: des ni rjes su dpag pa gzhan la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can med par bstan pa yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa yin na /
translated: If you think that this shows that there is no other inference that is nonerroneously opposed to it,

original: de lta na ni 'o na zla bo'i tshad ma med pas nges pa nyid du rjes su dpag pa gzhan la sbyar bar bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na zla bo'i tshad ma med pas nges pa nyid du rjes su dpag pa gzhan la sbyar bar bya ba yin gyi /
translated: then it would follow that it is to be applied to another inference, because there is no valid cognition that contradicts it.

original: zla ba nyid du rjes su dpog pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: zla ba nyid du rjes su dpog pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not to be applied to the inference of the moon,

original: gang gi phyir thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di'i don ni gnyi gar yang brjod pa'i phyir na phyogs 'di skabs su bab pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di'i don ni gnyi gar yang brjod pa'i phyir na phyogs 'di skabs su bab pa yin no //
translated: because the meaning of ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù is stated in both cases, since it is not shared. Therefore this position is appropriate.

original: ci ste yang 'di dang 'chad par 'gyur ba yang sgra las byung ba'i grags pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyis brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di yin na /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'di dang 'chad par 'gyur ba yang sgra las byung ba'i grags pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyis brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di yin na /
translated: But if this and what will be said later is stated by this very expression ‚Äúknown from the scriptures,‚Äù then this is the position.

original: de la yang gang la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med la zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'di nyid kyi sgras brjod par bya ba nyid rjes su dpog pa la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med par brjod pas /
analyzed: de la yang gang la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med la zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'di nyid kyi sgras brjod par bya ba nyid rjes su dpog pa la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med par brjod pas /
translated: In response to that, the text ‚Äúbecause there is no inference that is not common‚Äù indicates that there is no unmistaken inference that is the object of expression of this text.

original: dper na sgras brjod par bya ba nyid rjes su dpog pa'i gnyen po med na 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na sgras brjod par bya ba nyid rjes su dpog pa'i gnyen po med na 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as the object of expression is inferred in the absence of an antidote to inference,üîΩ  in the same way, there is also another inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa gzhan yang yin no zhes rjes su dpag pa gzhan la yang bstan pa'i phyir sgra las byung ba'i grags pa smos pas byas pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gzhan yang yin no zhes rjes su dpag pa gzhan la yang bstan pa'i phyir sgra las byung ba'i grags pa smos pas byas pa ci zhig yod /
translated: In order to demonstrate another inference, what is the point of mentioning ‚Äúthe renown that arises from words‚Äù?

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshad mas nges par brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs bas 'chad par 'gyur ba ni sgra las byung ba'i grags pa dang zhes bya ba 'dis brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshad mas nges par brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs bas 'chad par 'gyur ba ni sgra las byung ba'i grags pa dang zhes bya ba 'dis brjod pa yin la /
translated: For that very reason, the explanation by ‚Äúbecause it is ascertained by valid knowledge‚Äù and so on is stated by ‚Äúthe renown that arises from words.‚Äù

original: zla bo'i tshad ma med pas nges pa ni gang la rjes su dpag pa med pa zhes bya ba 'dis bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zla bo'i tshad ma med pas nges pa ni gang la rjes su dpag pa med pa zhes bya ba 'dis bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause there is no valid cognition of an object that is similar to it, it is certain that there is no inference.‚Äù This position is also illogical.

original: gang gi phyir 'chad par 'gyur ba ni zla bo'i tshad ma med pas nges par brjod pa zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'di nyid kyis spros pa yin par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'chad par 'gyur ba ni zla bo'i tshad ma med pas nges par brjod pa zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'di nyid kyis spros pa yin par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the text itself, ‚ÄúBecause there is no valid cognition of an object that is similar to it, it is certain that there is no inference,‚Äù appears to be an elaboration.

original: gzhan yang gang la rjes su dpag pa med ba zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi sgras brjod par bya ba rjes su dpag pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang la rjes su dpag pa med ba zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi sgras brjod par bya ba rjes su dpag pa la /
translated: Moreover, by the mere statement ‚Äúbecause there is no inference,‚Äù the existence of an inference that is the object of expression is stated.

original: 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med par smras pa na rjes su dpag pa gzhan la med pa yang bstan pa kho na yin @54a * //
analyzed: 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med par smras pa na rjes su dpag pa gzhan la med pa yang bstan pa kho na yin @54a * //
translated: When it is said that there is no nonerroneous contradiction, it is also shown that there is no other inference.

original: pas sgra las byung ba'i grags pa smos pas sgras brjod par bya ba rjes su dpog pa'am /
analyzed: pas sgra las byung ba'i grags pa smos pas sgras brjod par bya ba rjes su dpog pa'am /
translated: Therefore, because the expression ‚Äúthat which is to be expressed by a word‚Äù is mentioned, it is not the case that it is to be inferred that it is the object of expression of a word,

original: gzhan la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med par bstan par bya ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med par bstan par bya ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: or that it is to be shown that there is no nonerroneous contradiction in another.

original: phyogs 'di gsum car la yang mjug sdud pa'i gzhung /
analyzed: phyogs 'di gsum car la yang mjug sdud pa'i gzhung /
translated: The following passage summarizes the three positions:

original: de'i phyir de ltar tshad ma dag gnod par byed par brjod pa na de las nges par brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ci ltar grags /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar tshad ma dag gnod par byed par brjod pa na de las nges par brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ci ltar grags /
translated: How can it be said that when a valid cognition is said to invalidate, it is said to ascertain the opposite of that?

original: gang la tshad ma gnod par byed pa yin par brjod ce na /
analyzed: gang la tshad ma gnod par byed pa yin par brjod ce na /
translated: With regard to what is it said that a valid cognition invalidates?

original: kha cig na re sgra mnyan par bya ba ma yin pa dang / sgra rtag pa zhes bya ba 'di la'o zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re sgra mnyan par bya ba ma yin pa dang / sgra rtag pa zhes bya ba 'di la'o zhe'o //
translated: Some say: It is said that sound is not to be heard and that sound is permanent.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: gang la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the context is ‚Äúbecause it is not shared.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag ni sgra las byung ba'i grags pas bsal ba zhes sgra las byung ba'i grags pa gnod par byed par brjod pas mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa la yang brjod par 'gyur ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni sgra las byung ba'i grags pas bsal ba zhes sgra las byung ba'i grags pa gnod par byed par brjod pas mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa la yang brjod par 'gyur ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is said that a valid cognition invalidates what is refuted by commonly held knowledge, and it is said that a valid cognition invalidates what is refuted by direct perception and inference.

original: gal te de lta yin na 'di dang chad mas nges par brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dir yang don 'di nyid yin sgra las byung ba'i grags pa gnod par byed par brjod pas tshad ma nges par brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na 'di dang chad mas nges par brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dir yang don 'di nyid yin sgra las byung ba'i grags pa gnod par byed par brjod pas tshad ma nges par brjod pa yin la /
translated: In the same way, in the case of ‚Äúbecause it is ascertained by a valid cognition that is not contradicted,‚Äù the meaning is the same, but the words ‚Äúbecause it is ascertained by a valid cognition that is not contradicted‚Äù indicate that the valid cognition is not contradicted by other forms of valid cognition.

original: nges pa'i phyir zla bo'i tshad ma med pa yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i phyir zla bo'i tshad ma med pa yin no //
translated: And because it is ascertained, there is no valid cognition that contradicts it.üîΩIn the same way, in the case of ‚Äúbecause it is ascertained by a valid cognition that is not contradicted,‚Äù the meaning is the same, but the words ‚Äúbecause it is ascertained by a valid cognition that is not contradicted‚Äù indicate that the valid cognition is not contradicted by other forms of valid cognition.üîΩAnd because it is ascertained, there is no valid cognition that contradicts it.

original: de ltar yin dang phyogs ltar snang ba la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnod par byed pa brjod pas kyang nges par brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yin dang phyogs ltar snang ba la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnod par byed pa brjod pas kyang nges par brjod pa yin te /
translated: In the same way, in the case of ‚Äúbecause it is ascertained by a valid cognition that is not contradicted,‚Äù the meaning is the same, but the words ‚Äúbecause it is ascertained by a valid cognition that is not contradicted‚Äù indicate that the valid cognition is not contradicted by other forms of valid cognition.

original: des na 'di la khyad par du 'phags pa ci zhig yod ce na /üîΩgang zhig 'dis nges par zla bo'i tshad ma med par bstan par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: des na 'di la khyad par du 'phags pa ci zhig yod ce na / gang zhig 'dis nges par zla bo'i tshad ma med par bstan par 'gyur gyi /
translated: And because it is ascertained, there is no valid cognition that contradicts it.üîΩIn the same way, in the case of ‚Äúbecause it is ascertained by a valid cognition that is not contradicted,‚Äù the meaning is the same, but the words ‚Äúbecause it is ascertained by a valid cognition that is not contradicted‚Äù indicate that the valid cognition is not contradicted by other forms of valid cognition.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis ma yin te /
translated: And because it is ascertained, there is no valid cognition that contradicts it.üîΩIn the same way, in the case of ‚Äúbecause it is ascertained by a valid cognition that is not contradicted,‚Äù the meaning is the same, but the words ‚Äúbecause it is ascertained by a valid cognition that is not contradicted‚Äù indicate that the valid cognition is not contradicted by other forms of valid cognition.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: And because it is ascertained, there is no valid cognition that contradicts it.

original: 'di la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: In the same way, in the case of ‚Äúbecause it is ascertained by a valid cognition that is not contradicted,‚Äù the meaning is the same, but the

original: gang la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med pa zhes bya ba de skad du brjod pa'i gzhung ni zla bo'i tshad ma med pas tshad mas nges par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med pa zhes bya ba de skad du brjod pa'i gzhung ni zla bo'i tshad ma med pas tshad mas nges par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not shared, it is called ‚Äúnon-inferential.‚Äù The text that expresses this is taught by a valid cognition that is ascertained by the absence of a valid cognition that contradicts it.

original: 'dis ni rjes su dpag pa yongs su spangs nas sgra las byung ba'i grags ba gnod par byed par brjod pas na /üîΩgal te rjes su dpag pa yin na sgra las byung ba'i grags pa'i gnod par byed par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni rjes su dpag pa yongs su spangs nas sgra las byung ba'i grags ba gnod par byed par brjod pas na / gal te rjes su dpag pa yin na sgra las byung ba'i grags pa'i gnod par byed par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is because, having completely abandoned inference, it expresses the contradiction of what is well-known from scripture.üîΩIf it were an inference, it would be a contradiction of what is well-known from scripture.

original: gnod par byed pa sgra las byung ba'i grags pa'i yang gnod par byed par brjod pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nges par byed pa yin @54b par smras par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa sgra las byung ba'i grags pa'i yang gnod par byed par brjod pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nges par byed pa yin @54b par smras par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because it expresses the contradiction of what is well-known from scripture, it would be an inference that ascertains.

original: gnod par byed pa tsam du brjod pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa tsam du brjod pas ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not expressed as merely a contradiction.

original: yid ches pa'i tshig kyang gnod par byed pa tsam du brjod kyang /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i tshig kyang gnod par byed pa tsam du brjod kyang /
translated: Even though the words of a trustworthy person are expressed as merely a contradiction,

original: de nges par byed pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nges par byed pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: they are not ascertainment itself.

original: de ni the tshom gyi 'bras bu can gegs byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni the tshom gyi 'bras bu can gegs byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the result of doubt, it is an obstruction.

original: de bzhin du rjes su dpag ba phyogs ltar snang ba la gnod pa byed par brjod kyang nges par byed pa ma yin par dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su dpag ba phyogs ltar snang ba la gnod pa byed par brjod kyang nges par byed pa ma yin par dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, even though it is said that inference is obstructed by a semblance of the position, it is not certain.

original: 'di ni sgra las byung ba'i grags pa dang / de dang 'dra ba yid ches pa'i tshigs la sogs pa gnod par byed pa'i yang gnod par byed par brjod pa'i phyir nges par byed pa nyid du brjod par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sgra las byung ba'i grags pa dang / de dang 'dra ba yid ches pa'i tshigs la sogs pa gnod par byed pa'i yang gnod par byed par brjod pa'i phyir nges par byed pa nyid du brjod par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: This is said to be certain because it is said that it is obstructed by the authority of scripture and by the words of a trustworthy person, which are similar to it.

original: de lta yin dang tshad mar khyad par med pas mngon sum yang gnod par byed pa yin pa des na nges par byed par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang tshad mar khyad par med pas mngon sum yang gnod par byed pa yin pa des na nges par byed par brjod pa yin no //
translated: If that were so, then because there would be no difference in validity, direct perception would also be obstructed, and therefore it would be said to be certain.

original: 'on kyang rung ba nyid dgag pa la byed pa med pa'i phyir mngon sum dogs par ma byas pa yin gyi spangs ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rung ba nyid dgag pa la byed pa med pa'i phyir mngon sum dogs par ma byas pa yin gyi spangs ba ni ma yin no //
translated: However, because it does not function to negate what is possible, direct perception is not suspected, but it is not abandoned.

original: zla bo'i tshad ma yod na ni nges pa srid pa ma yin no zhes de ltar don gyi shugs kyis rjes su dpag pa sgra las byung ba'i grags pa'i gnod par byed par ston pas ni /
analyzed: zla bo'i tshad ma yod na ni nges pa srid pa ma yin no zhes de ltar don gyi shugs kyis rjes su dpag pa sgra las byung ba'i grags pa'i gnod par byed par ston pas ni /
translated: If there were a valid cognition of the opposite, then it would be possible to ascertain it.üîΩThus, by the force of the meaning, it shows that the statement is undermined by the commonly recognized inference from a sound reason.

original: zla bo'i tshad ma med pas tshad mas nges par brjod par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: zla bo'i tshad ma med pas tshad mas nges par brjod par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be seen that the statement is ascertained by a valid cognition because there is no valid cognition of the opposite.

original: de lta yin dang gzhung gi tshogs phyi ma rnams 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang gzhung gi tshogs phyi ma rnams 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then the later collections of scriptures become tenable.

original: 'o na rnam 'grel las /
analyzed: 'o na rnam 'grel las /
translated: Well then, why does the Pramii(laviirttikam) say:üîΩBecause fame is an inference,

original: grags pa rjes dpog phyir de ltar //
analyzed: grags pa rjes dpog phyir de ltar //
translated: it is like that.

original: rjes su dpag pas grub pa la //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas grub pa la //
translated: With respect to what is established by inference,

original: 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can //
analyzed: 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can //
translated: it is the nonerroneous contradiction

original: med par ston par byed pa yin //
analyzed: med par ston par byed pa yin //
translated: that teaches nonexistence.

original: zhes bshad pa ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa ci ltar zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: 'di la yang don 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di la yang don 'di nyid yin no //
translated: In this case, it has just this meaning.üîΩBecause fame is an inference,

original: gang gi phyir grags pa yang rjes su dpag pa yin pa de'i phyir na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir grags pa yang rjes su dpag pa yin pa de'i phyir na /
translated: therefore,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba rjes su dpag pa grags pa'i gnod bar byas par dogs par byas pas ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba rjes su dpag pa grags pa'i gnod bar byas par dogs par byas pas ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med par bshad pa yin no //
translated: The commentary explains that there is no nonerroneous contradiction.

original: 'grel pa ni slob dpon gyi dgongs pa las 'das par rnam par nges pa'i gzhung 'di nyid las rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'grel pa ni slob dpon gyi dgongs pa las 'das par rnam par nges pa'i gzhung 'di nyid las rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The commentary is certain that it is the master‚Äôs intention.

original: 'grel pa slob dpon dang mi mthun pa ni le'u gnyis par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'grel pa slob dpon dang mi mthun pa ni le'u gnyis par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The commentary that does not agree with the master is presented in chapter 2.

original: re zhig dgag par mi nus pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir de zhes smos te /
analyzed: re zhig dgag par mi nus pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir de zhes smos te /
translated: In order to show that it is impossible to refute the existence of the object of the sense faculties, the text says ‚Äúthat‚Äù .

original: rung ba nyid 'gog pa ni rjes su dpag pa las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rung ba nyid 'gog pa ni rjes su dpag pa las 'gyur ro //
translated: The refutation of the possibility of the object of the sense faculties is an inference.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mngon sum gyis ni @55a * //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni @55a * //
translated: Because direct perception

original: rung ba nyid 'gog pa mi nges pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rung ba nyid 'gog pa mi nges pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: cannot refute the possibility of the object of the sense faculties.

original: bum ba la sogs pa mngon sum gyis rtogs bar bya ba ni /
analyzed: bum ba la sogs pa mngon sum gyis rtogs bar bya ba ni /
translated: The object of the sense faculties, such as a pot, is to be understood by direct perception.

original: sa phyogs 'ba' zhig nges pa'i shugs kyis med bar nges par mi dmigs pas tha snyad du bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sa phyogs 'ba' zhig nges pa'i shugs kyis med bar nges par mi dmigs pas tha snyad du bya ba yin no //
translated: The mere place is ascertained by the force of the direct perception. The nonexistence of the pot is ascertained by the nonapprehension of the pot.

original: sgrar rung ba nyid ni rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sgrar rung ba nyid ni rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa yin gyi /
translated: The suitability of sound is established as the nature of the appearance in conceptual thought.

original: dbang pos rtogs par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang pos rtogs par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not to be understood by the sense faculties.

original: des na mngon sum ma yin pa sgra'i rung ba nyid 'gog pa ni mngon sum ma yin te /
analyzed: des na mngon sum ma yin pa sgra'i rung ba nyid 'gog pa ni mngon sum ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the refutation of the suitability of sound, which is not a direct perception, is not a direct perception.

original: 'on kyang rjes su dpag pa las yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rjes su dpag pa las yin no //
translated: But it is from inference.

original: gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir na de yang mi srid pas na 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid ni dgag par mi nus so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir na de yang mi srid pas na 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid ni dgag par mi nus so //
translated: Since it is impossible because of the non-commonality of the reason, the mere suitability of being expressed by the sound of the desire is not refuted.

original: yod pa gcig pu thun mong ma yin par bshad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yod pa gcig pu thun mong ma yin par bshad pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it explained that the mere existence is not common?

original: gtan tshigs thams cad ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs thams cad ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: All reasons are not.

original: bshad pa / bsgrub par bya ba gang la yod pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i bsgrub par bya ba de la gtan tshigs thams cad thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / bsgrub par bya ba gang la yod pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i bsgrub par bya ba de la gtan tshigs thams cad thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is said: For any probandum, if the mere existence does not pervade the probandum, then all reasons are not common to it.

original: yod pa nyid de thams cad khyab pa yin yang bsgrub bya dang rjes su 'gro ba med pa des na gzhan gtan tshigs gang zhig bsgrub bya dang rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni yod pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs dper brjod pa'i 'bras bu yin
analyzed: yod pa nyid de thams cad khyab pa yin yang bsgrub bya dang rjes su 'gro ba med pa des na gzhan gtan tshigs gang zhig bsgrub bya dang rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni yod pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs dper brjod pa'i 'bras bu yin
translated: Although existence pervades everything, it does not pervade the probandum. Therefore, what other reason could there be that would pervade the probandum? This is the result of the example of the reason, ‚Äúbecause it exists.‚Äù

original: no // de lta ma yin na ci ltar sgra ma nyan par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: no // de lta ma yin na ci ltar sgra ma nyan par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, how could it be that sound is not audible?

original: bum pa rtag pa'o zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'dir yang ri bong can zla ba ma yin no zhes gtan tshigs med pa kho nar phyogs ltar snang ba nyid dper brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bum pa rtag pa'o zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'dir yang ri bong can zla ba ma yin no zhes gtan tshigs med pa kho nar phyogs ltar snang ba nyid dper brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as in the statement, ‚ÄúThe pot is permanent,‚Äù so too here, the horn of a rabbit is not the moon. The example would be just a semblance of a reason, since it would be devoid of a reason.

original: de'i phyir thams cad thun mong ma yin par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad thun mong ma yin par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is accepted that the reason is not common to all.

original: de ltar na gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir dgag par mi nus pa nyid du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir dgag par mi nus pa nyid du bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is explained that it cannot be refuted because there is no refutation.

original: ci ltar gnod par byed pa yod na 'di la 'di med do zhes rang bzhin 'gog pa de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa med na 'di la ma grub pa'o zhes grub pa 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: ci ltar gnod par byed pa yod na 'di la 'di med do zhes rang bzhin 'gog pa de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa med na 'di la ma grub pa'o zhes grub pa 'gog par byed do //
translated: Just as when there is an object of negation, one negates intrinsic reality by saying, ‚ÄúThis does not exist in that,‚Äù so too when there is no object of affirmation, one negates establishment by saying, ‚ÄúThis is not established in that.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the master says that sound is not capable of refuting because it is a well-known term that affirms.

original: de'i phyir sgra rab tu grags pa'i tshig gis slob dpon sgrub par byed pa yod pa'i phyir yang dgag par mi nus pa nyid du gsungs pa yin no zhes ston pa ni sgra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra rab tu grags pa'i tshig gis slob dpon sgrub par byed pa yod pa'i phyir yang dgag par mi nus pa nyid du gsungs pa yin no zhes ston pa ni sgra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of the term ‚Äúsound-based‚Äù is as follows:

original: sgra las 'ongs pa'i sgrub pa ni sgra las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: sgra las 'ongs pa'i sgrub pa ni sgra las byung ba yin te /
translated: Sound-based is that which arises from sound.üîΩSince it arises from sound, it is established for everyone.

original: de ni sgra las byung ba'i phyir na thams cad la grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de ni sgra las byung ba'i phyir na thams cad la grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the term ‚Äúestablished by sound‚Äù is as follows:

original: sgras grub @55b pa dag ni ma grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sgras grub @55b pa dag ni ma grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Those established by sound are not non-established.

original: ma grub pa ma yin no zhes bya bas ni rab tu grub ba nyid brjod do //
analyzed: ma grub pa ma yin no zhes bya bas ni rab tu grub ba nyid brjod do //
translated: ‚ÄúNot non-established‚Äù expresses perfect establishment.

original: sgras grub ba dag ces bya ba ni sgra las byung ba dag go //
analyzed: sgras grub ba dag ces bya ba ni sgra las byung ba dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúEstablished by sound‚Äù means arising from sound.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gang gi phyir brda las brjod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir na brda la brten pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir brda las brjod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir na brda la brten pa yin la /
translated: Because since it is that which expresses by means of a sign, it is dependent on a sign.

original: brda yang dngos po la mi ltos pa'i phyir 'dod pa tsam la rag las pa yin no //
analyzed: brda yang dngos po la mi ltos pa'i phyir 'dod pa tsam la rag las pa yin no //
translated: And since a sign does not depend on an entity, it is dependent on mere desire.

original: des na de'i phyir ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i phyir ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that it is not established.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: sgras brjod par bya ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi chos ni 'dod pa la rag las pa'i brdar byas pa yin pas na /
analyzed: sgras brjod par bya ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi chos ni 'dod pa la rag las pa'i brdar byas pa yin pas na /
translated: The phenomenon that has the characteristic of being expressed by a word is designated by a sign that is dependent on desire.

original: 'dod pas byas pa'i rang bzhin gyi mthar thug pa'i phyir tha snyad du ma byas kyang thams cad la rab tu grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pas byas pa'i rang bzhin gyi mthar thug pa'i phyir tha snyad du ma byas kyang thams cad la rab tu grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is ultimately created by desire, it is fully established for all even if it is not conventionally designated.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gang zhig rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa de ni 'dod pa la rag las pa'i brda'i rgyu mtshan can gyi sgras brjod par nus pa ma yin no zhes sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir na slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gang zhig rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa de ni 'dod pa la rag las pa'i brda'i rgyu mtshan can gyi sgras brjod par nus pa ma yin no zhes sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir na slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos
translated: Therefore, since the master DignƒÅga taught a valid cognition that proves that ‚Äúwhatever is based on conceptuality cannot be expressed by a term that is a linguistic sign based on desire,‚Äù

original: sgra las byung ba'i grags pa dang zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i grags pa dang zhes bshad do //
translated: he explained that ‚Äúit is renowned from a term.‚Äù

original: gal te sgrub par byed pa ston par mi 'dod na ni /
analyzed: gal te sgrub par byed pa ston par mi 'dod na ni /
translated: If you do not assert that it is taught by a proof,

original: sgras brjod par bya ba nyid dang zhes de skad brjod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgras brjod par bya ba nyid dang zhes de skad brjod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then you should not say, ‚ÄúIt is to be expressed by a term.‚Äù

original: sgrub par byed pa bstan pas ni dgag par mi nus par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa bstan pas ni dgag par mi nus par brjod pa yin no //
translated: By teaching a proof, you are saying that it cannot be refuted.

original: da ni zla bo'i tshad ma med pas nges par bstan pa zhes bya ba de bshad pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni zla bo'i tshad ma med pas nges par bstan pa zhes bya ba de bshad pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Now, in order to explain ‚Äúit is taught by the absence of a rival valid cognition,‚Äù he says:

original: sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis tshad mas nges par brjod pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i yul tshad mas grub pa'i tshul gsum pa la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis tshad mas nges par brjod pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i yul tshad mas grub pa'i tshul gsum pa la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med par ston pa yin no //
translated: The response to that is: because it is ascertained by a valid cognition, as explained above, it shows that the object of inference is established by a valid cognition, and that there is no contradiction in the three modes.

original: don gyis go bas zhes bya ba ni shugs kyis so //
analyzed: don gyis go bas zhes bya ba ni shugs kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy implication‚Äù means by force.

original: gal te nges pa yang yin la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can yang yin par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te nges pa yang yin la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can yang yin par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If it is ascertained, then wouldn‚Äôt it also be a contradiction in the three modes?

original: rjes su dpag pas nges par brjod pa'i phyir 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med do zhes bya ba 'di gang las she na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas nges par brjod pa'i phyir 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med do zhes bya ba 'di gang las she na /
translated: How do you know that ‚Äúbecause it is ascertained by inference, there is no contradiction in the three modes‚Äù?

original: bshad pa / gegs yod par dogs pa gang dag yin pa rnams ni'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / gegs yod par dogs pa gang dag yin pa rnams ni'o //
translated: The response to that is: because of the possibility of an obstruction.

original: zla bo'i tshad ma srid na ni des bsgrub pa 'gal ba'i don gyi rjes su dpag pas grub pa thams cad la gegs byed bar dogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: zla bo'i tshad ma srid na ni des bsgrub pa 'gal ba'i don gyi rjes su dpag pas grub pa thams cad la gegs byed bar dogs par 'gyur la /
translated: If there is a possibility of a rival valid cognition, then it is possible that it will obstruct the establishment of all inferences that have a contradictory object.

original: gegs yod par dogs pa rnams la yang the tshom za la /
analyzed: gegs yod par dogs pa rnams la yang the tshom za la /
translated: And for those who doubt the possibility of an obstruction, there is doubt.

original: the tshom za bas mi 'grub po //
analyzed: the tshom za bas mi 'grub po //
translated: And because of doubt, there is no establishment.

original: mi 'grub pa'i phyir na mi nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'grub pa'i phyir na mi nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not established, because it is not ascertained.

original: des @56a * //
analyzed: des @56a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: na ste / gtan tshigs de'i phyir tshad mas nges bar brjod pa'i phyir 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med pa yin no //
analyzed: na ste / gtan tshigs de'i phyir tshad mas nges bar brjod pa'i phyir 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med pa yin no //
translated: because of that reason, because of the statement of ascertainment by valid cognition, there is no contradiction that is non-mistaken.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Inference is of two types:

original: gnyen po dang bcas pa dang / cig shos ma yin nam /
analyzed: gnyen po dang bcas pa dang / cig shos ma yin nam /
translated: that which has an antidote and that which is not the other.

original: de la gnyen po med pa'i rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa de las nges par 'byung ba yin na /
analyzed: de la gnyen po med pa'i rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa de las nges par 'byung ba yin na /
translated: If the ascertainment from that inference which does not have an antidote

original: de ci ltar na tshad mas nges par brjod pa'i phyir 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med ces brjod ce na /
analyzed: de ci ltar na tshad mas nges par brjod pa'i phyir 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med ces brjod ce na /
translated: is like that, then how can it be said that because of the statement of ascertainment by valid cognition, there is no contradiction that is non-mistaken?

original: smras pa / mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa gcig la gnyen po 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can srid pa yin na thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i skyes bu tsam gyis rjes su dpag pa gzhan la 'gal pa mi 'khrul pa can de med ba gang yin
analyzed: smras pa / mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa gcig la gnyen po 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can srid pa yin na thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i skyes bu tsam gyis rjes su dpag pa gzhan la 'gal pa mi 'khrul pa can de med ba gang yin
translated: It is said: If it is possible for a single inference that possesses the characteristics to have an antidote that is non-mistaken, then for all other inferences by a mere person who is not omniscient, that which is non-existent is the contradiction that is non-mistaken.

original: pa de mi nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa de mi nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is not ascertained,

original: des na ste /
analyzed: des na ste /
translated: Therefore,

original: gtan tshigs de'i phyir tshad mas nges par zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //üîΩgang la zla bo'i tshad ma yod pa de snang ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir tshad mas nges par zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no // gang la zla bo'i tshad ma yod pa de snang ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: for that reason, it is said, ‚Äúbecause of the ascertainment by a valid cognition.‚ÄùüîΩIs that which has a valid cognition as its counterpart not an appearance?

original: gzhan nam ngal dus gzhan du snang bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de da lta nyid ci ste mi snang /
analyzed: gzhan nam ngal dus gzhan du snang bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de da lta nyid ci ste mi snang /
translated: If it appears at another time, why does it not appear now?

original: mi snang ba'i phyir 'o na 'gal ba 'khrul pa can med pa yin no zhes bya ba zlos ba'i phyir yun ring por zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mi snang ba'i phyir 'o na 'gal ba 'khrul pa can med pa yin no zhes bya ba zlos ba'i phyir yun ring por zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Because it does not appear, it is said, ‚Äúfor a long time‚Äù and so on, in order to avoid the error of contradiction.

original: ma mthong ba'i don gang dag yin pa de rnams la yang phyis dus gzhan du ma mthong ba de la snang ba skye ba yin la /
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i don gang dag yin pa de rnams la yang phyis dus gzhan du ma mthong ba de la snang ba skye ba yin la /
translated: With regard to those objects that are not seen, later at another time, the appearance of that which is not seen arises.

original: skyes bu yang so sor shes rab kyi khyad par dang ldan pa mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu yang so sor shes rab kyi khyad par dang ldan pa mthong ba yin te /
translated: And the person is seen to possess the particular wisdom.

original: de'i phyir da ltar nga las mi snang ba gang yin pa de ni med pa nyid do zhes de ltar brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir da ltar nga las mi snang ba gang yin pa de ni med pa nyid do zhes de ltar brjod par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to say, ‚ÄúThat which does not appear to me now does not exist.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir gnyen po med ba'i rjes su dpag pa nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyen po med ba'i rjes su dpag pa nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no inference without a counter-correlate.

original: de'i phyir na chad mar nges bar brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir na chad mar nges bar brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnas so //
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚Äúbecause it is expressed with certainty‚Äù and so on is tenable.

original: rjes su dpag pas nges par brjod pas /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas nges par brjod pas /
translated: Because it is expressed with certainty by inference,üîΩthis shows that there is no non-erroneous ascertainment of the object of inference.

original: rjes su dpag ba'i yul la dga' ba mi 'khrul pa can med par bstan pa 'dis ni mngon sum las kyang nges par brjod pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med bar bstan pa 'dis ni mngon sum las mngon sum dang
analyzed: rjes su dpag ba'i yul la dga' ba mi 'khrul pa can med par bstan pa 'dis ni mngon sum las kyang nges par brjod pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med bar bstan pa 'dis ni mngon sum las mngon sum dang
translated: This shows that there is no non-erroneous contradiction of perception in the object of inference by the mere fact that it is the cause of ascertainment from perception and inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa dag nges pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can med par ston par byed par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dag nges pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can med par ston par byed par bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is explained that this shows that there is no non-erroneous contradiction of inference in the object of inference by the mere fact that it is the cause of ascertainment from perception and inference.

original: ci ltar mngon sum las nges @56b pa brjod pas rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med par brjod bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ltar mngon sum las nges @56b pa brjod pas rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med par brjod bar 'gyur te /
translated: How is it that the expression of certainty from perception shows the absence of non-erroneous contradiction of inference in the object of inference?

original: mngon sum nyid gnyen po med par brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid gnyen po med par brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhe na /
translated: If you say that direct perception is not refuted, then it is only a mere assertion.

original: gnyi ga yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang zhes smos so //
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúBoth are equal.‚Äù

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis tshad mar khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis tshad mar khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference between the two, direct perception and inference, in terms of their validity.

original: tshad mar khyad par med na gal te rjes su dpag pa la gnyen po yod na mngon sum la yang yod par 'gyur zhes gang bshad pa ni /
analyzed: tshad mar khyad par med na gal te rjes su dpag pa la gnyen po yod na mngon sum la yang yod par 'gyur zhes gang bshad pa ni /
translated: If there is no difference in terms of their validity, then if inference is refuted, direct perception would also be refuted.

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ni don med na mi 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ni don med na mi 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The definition of valid cognition is that it does not occur without an object,

original: tshad ma rnams kyi ni mi slu ba ni de las yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma rnams kyi ni mi slu ba ni de las yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the non-deceptiveness of valid cognitions is due to that.

original: de dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa gcig la gnyen po yod pa'i phyir mngon sum yang de ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa gcig la gnyen po yod pa'i phyir mngon sum yang de ltar 'gyur te /
translated: If inference, which possesses that, is refuted, then direct perception would also be like that,

original: gnyen po dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyen po dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would possess a refutation.

original: de'i phyir nges par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir nges par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would not be a definite determiner.

original: 'di snyam du gnyi ga la tshad ma'i mtshan nyid khyad par med kyang gang gis gnyen po med pa'i phyir de nges par byed pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i khyad par gzhan yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gnyi ga la tshad ma'i mtshan nyid khyad par med kyang gang gis gnyen po med pa'i phyir de nges par byed pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i khyad par gzhan yod do zhe na /
translated: If you think that although there is no difference in the definition of valid cognition, there is another difference that makes it a determiner because it is without a counteragent,

original: gang zhig ces smos so //
analyzed: gang zhig ces smos so //
translated: then it is said, ‚ÄúWhat is that?‚Äù

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid las tha dad pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de ni nges par zhes bya ba mtha' gcig tu sgrub par byed pa nyid rnam par 'jog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid las tha dad pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de ni nges par zhes bya ba mtha' gcig tu sgrub par byed pa nyid rnam par 'jog pa ma yin no //
translated: That difference which is distinct from the definition of valid cognition is not posited as a determiner that is established as one-sided.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir zhes smos te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause of that.‚Äù

original: gcig tu nges par bsgrub pa'i khyad par de las rjes su dpag par phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gcig tu nges par bsgrub pa'i khyad par de las rjes su dpag par phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of that difference that is established as one-sided, it is not inference because it is external.

original: nges pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi khyad bar gyis stong pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro //
