analyzed: nges pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi khyad bar gyis stong pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is empty of the difference that is the reason for determination, it would not be valid cognition.

original: gang gi phyir gcig tu nges pa sgrub par byed pa khyad par tshad ma'i mtshan nyid de las tha dad pa gzhan med pa de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i yul la gnyen po srid na mngon sum la yang de bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gcig tu nges pa sgrub par byed pa khyad par tshad ma'i mtshan nyid de las tha dad pa gzhan med pa de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i yul la gnyen po srid na mngon sum la yang de bzlog par dka'o //
translated: Because the definition of a valid cognition that ascertains a single object is not different from that, therefore, if it is possible that there is an antidote to the object of inference, it is difficult to reverse it even in the case of direct perception.

original: de nas mngon sum nges pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir yang rjes su dpag pa'i yul 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med par rtogs so //
analyzed: de nas mngon sum nges pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir yang rjes su dpag pa'i yul 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med par rtogs so //
translated: And then, because direct perception is the cause of ascertainment, one understands that there is no non-mistaken contradiction of the object of inference.

original: brjod par 'dod ba'i grangs gcig pa can ni gcig pu gnyis su med pa nyid de /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod ba'i grangs gcig pa can ni gcig pu gnyis su med pa nyid de /
translated: The one that is the object of the desire to say is the one that is not two.

original: des na gtan tshigs ni gnyen po med pa yin no zhes gang smras ba ni /
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs ni gnyen po med pa yin no zhes gang smras ba ni /
translated: Therefore, the reason is that there is no antidote.

original: 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs ma bstan pa gang yin pa'i gtan tshigs de tsam ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gran zla'i gtan tshigs ma bstan pa gang yin pa'i gtan tshigs de tsam ma yin te /
translated: That is not the mere reason that does not teach a rival reason.

original: de'i phyir la lar 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can srid pa yin na /üîΩkhyad par med pa'i phyir rjes su @57a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir la lar 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can srid pa yin na / khyad par med pa'i phyir rjes su @57a * //
translated: Therefore, if it is possible that there is a non-mistaken contradiction in some cases,

original: dpag pa thams cad la dogs la /
analyzed: dpag pa thams cad la dogs la /
translated: because there is no distinction, it is doubted in all inferences.

original: de lta yin dang tshad mar khyad par med pa'i phyir mngon sum la yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de lta yin dang tshad mar khyad par med pa'i phyir mngon sum la yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nyes pa med do //
translated: If that were so, then there would be no difference between valid cognitions, and so there would be the fault that even direct perception would be a valid cognition.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa ni rjes su dpag pa'i rtags yin la /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa ni rjes su dpag pa'i rtags yin la /
translated: The number one that is intended to be expressed is the reason for inference.

original: tshul gsum tsam dang ldan pa ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can yin te /
analyzed: tshul gsum tsam dang ldan pa ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can yin te /
translated: The mere possession of the three modes is the nonerroneous contradictory object.

original: des na khyad par yod pa'i phyir thams cad du 'gal zla dogs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na khyad par yod pa'i phyir thams cad du 'gal zla dogs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, because there is a difference, there is no fault of the contradiction of everything.

original: de lta na 'o na brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can te /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can te /
translated: If that is so, then the number one that is intended to be expressed is the reason for inference.

original: ci gnyen po med pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci gnyen po med pa yin nam /
translated: Is it without a counterpart?

original: 'on te gnyen po ma mthong ba yin /
analyzed: 'on te gnyen po ma mthong ba yin /
translated: Or is it that the counterpart is not seen?

original: gnyi ga ltar na yang mtshan nyid de nges dgos so //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar na yang mtshan nyid de nges dgos so //
translated: In either case, that definition must be ascertained.

original: de la dang po ni nges par mi nus so zhes gang bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de la dang po ni nges par mi nus so zhes gang bshad pa ni /
translated: In that regard, it was explained that the first is not able to ascertain.

original: 'di 'dra ba'i don nges pa'i yul la srid pa yod dam zhes bya rog gi dri ba sbyar ba ni med do zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i don nges pa'i yul la srid pa yod dam zhes bya rog gi dri ba sbyar ba ni med do zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúIs it possible for an object like that to be ascertained?‚Äù it is said that it is not possible.

original: gang la nges pa med pa de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang la nges pa med pa de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like to be uncertain?

original: rjes su dpag pa 'di la 'gran zla med do zhes de 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa 'di la 'gran zla med do zhes de 'dra ba'o //
translated: It is like this: ‚ÄúThere is no rival to this inference.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir 'di la nges pa med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di la nges pa med ce na /
translated: Why is it uncertain?

original: rtags gang la tshul gsum pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid khyad par med pa de la mthong ba'i gnyen po ni tshul gsum pa gzhan la med pa gang yin pa de nges par byed mi nus ba'i phyir ro zhes le'u gnyis bar bshad zin to //
analyzed: rtags gang la tshul gsum pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid khyad par med pa de la mthong ba'i gnyen po ni tshul gsum pa gzhan la med pa gang yin pa de nges par byed mi nus ba'i phyir ro zhes le'u gnyis bar bshad zin to //
translated: Because the reason, which is called ‚Äúhaving the three modes,‚Äù cannot be ascertained if there is no other instance of the three modes.

original: de'i phyir gnyen por med pa nyid ni ma nges so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyen por med pa nyid ni ma nges so //
translated: Therefore, the absence of a rival is uncertain.

original: 'on te brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa nyid gnyen po ma mthong ba yin na /
analyzed: 'on te brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa nyid gnyen po ma mthong ba yin na /
translated: But if the rival is the nonperception of the one that is desired,

original: de yang gal te mtshan nyid des nus pa yin yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes gang bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de yang gal te mtshan nyid des nus pa yin yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes gang bshad pa ni /
translated: then that is also not possible, as it has been explained that if it is possible by means of that characteristic, it is not correct.

original: skyes bu'i spobs pa zhes bya pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i spobs pa zhes bya pa yin no //
translated: This is called ‚Äúthe confidence of a person.‚Äù

original: ci srid skyes bu la gnyen po mi snang ba de srid du tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: ci srid skyes bu la gnyen po mi snang ba de srid du tshad ma yin la /
translated: As long as a rival is not perceived by a person, it is valid knowledge.

original: gnyen po mthong na ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes mtshan nyid bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: gnyen po mthong na ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes mtshan nyid bya bar mi nus so //
translated: But it cannot be said that a means of valid knowledge is not a means of valid knowledge if it is seen to have a counter-example.

original: de lta na ni skyes bu'i spobs pa'i dbang gis tshad ma'i mtshan nyid brjod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta na ni skyes bu'i spobs pa'i dbang gis tshad ma'i mtshan nyid brjod par 'gyur na /
translated: If that were so, then the definition of a means of valid knowledge would be stated by the power of a person's eloquence.

original: skyes bu'i spobs pa'i dbang gis tshad ma'i mtshan nyid brjod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i spobs pa'i dbang gis tshad ma'i mtshan nyid brjod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But the definition of a means of valid knowledge is not stated by the power of a person's eloquence.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: dngos po gnas pas yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gnas pas yin no //
translated: It is by the stability of the thing.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de tshad ma'i mtshan nyid du brjod kyi /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de tshad ma'i mtshan nyid du brjod kyi /
translated: The nature of the thing is stated as the definition of a means of valid knowledge.

original: spobs pa la snang ba'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: spobs pa la snang ba'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature that appears to eloquence.

original: dngos po la gnas pa'i gnyen po med pa'i tshad ma de yang @57b de ltar zhes bya ba tshul gsum dang ldan pa la yang gnyen po mthong ba'i phyir nges par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la gnas pa'i gnyen po med pa'i tshad ma de yang @57b de ltar zhes bya ba tshul gsum dang ldan pa la yang gnyen po mthong ba'i phyir nges par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: And that means of valid knowledge which is stable with regard to the thing, even though it has a counter-example, is not able to be ascertained by seeing the counter-example, because it has the three modes.

original: des na zhes bya ba rgyu de'i phyir the tshom za ba de ni zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid brjod bar 'dod pa'i grangs gcig ba gang la yod ba ste /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba rgyu de'i phyir the tshom za ba de ni zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid brjod bar 'dod pa'i grangs gcig ba gang la yod ba ste /
translated: Therefore, because of that reason, that which has doubt about the one who is the topic of the statement of the definition of the reason is

original: gtan tshigs de ni gtan tshigs kyi tha snyad du mi rung ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de ni gtan tshigs kyi tha snyad du mi rung ste /
translated: that reason is not suitable to be called a reason.

original: dper na phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa'i tshul dag la the tshom za ba'i gtan tshigs la /
analyzed: dper na phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa'i tshul dag la the tshom za ba'i gtan tshigs la /
translated: For example, in regard to a reason about which one has doubt as to whether it has the mode of the property of the subject, etc.,

original: gtan tshigs zhes tha snyad gdags bar mi nus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs zhes tha snyad gdags bar mi nus pa bzhin no //
translated: one cannot designate it as a reason.

original: rtags ni rang gi bsgrub bar bya ba la mi 'khrul pa nges par rtogs par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rtags ni rang gi bsgrub bar bya ba la mi 'khrul pa nges par rtogs par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: A reason is that which causes ascertainment of non-erroneous understanding of one‚Äôs probandum.

original: sgron ma bzhin du rung ba tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgron ma bzhin du rung ba tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that which is merely suitable, like a lamp.

original: mi 'khrul bar nges pa yang mtshan nyid nges pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: mi 'khrul bar nges pa yang mtshan nyid nges pa kho na yin no //
translated: And ascertainment of non-erroneous understanding is only ascertainment of the definition.

original: mtshan nyid de dag la gcig ma nges na yang rtags de mi 'khrul bar ma nges pas go bar byed pa tha snyad mi bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de dag la gcig ma nges na yang rtags de mi 'khrul bar ma nges pas go bar byed pa tha snyad mi bya'o //
translated: If one of those definitions is not ascertained, then because that reason is not ascertained to be non-erroneous, one does not designate it as a reason.

original: gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid tshul gsum brjod pa na der shes pa yang gzung ba nyid de /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid tshul gsum brjod pa na der shes pa yang gzung ba nyid de /
translated: When the trimodal logical mark is stated, the cognition of that is also apprehended,

original: gang gi phyir shes par byed pa'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes par byed pa'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is in terms of the cognition that the logical mark is a means of knowing.

original: brjod pa gang zhig gnyi ga la nges pa zhes brjod pas ni shes pa gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa gang zhig gnyi ga la nges pa zhes brjod pas ni shes pa gzung ba yin no //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe expression of the trimodal logical mark is ascertained for both parties‚Äù means that the cognition is apprehended.

original: de'i phyir yang mtshan nyid la the tshom za ba ni gtan tshigs kyi tha snyad du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang mtshan nyid la the tshom za ba ni gtan tshigs kyi tha snyad du mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, when there is doubt about the definition, it is not suitable to use the term ‚Äúlogical mark.‚Äù

original: kho bo cag 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
analyzed: kho bo cag 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
translated: It is not only we who say this,

original: slob dpon yang tha snyad du mi rung bar bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon yang tha snyad du mi rung bar bzhed pa yin no //
translated: but the master DignƒÅga also asserts that it is not suitable conventionally.

original: des na ngas par mi nus pa brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can nyid ni slob dpon yang mtshan nyid du bzhed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin no //
analyzed: des na ngas par mi nus pa brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa can nyid ni slob dpon yang mtshan nyid du bzhed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin no //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe master also does not assert the one that is desired to be expressed as a definition‚Äù is that the one that is not able to be expressed as the number one is not asserted by the master as a definition.

original: gal te nges par mi nus na khyed kyis rjes su dpag pa la yang gnyen po med par ji ltar nges she na /
analyzed: gal te nges par mi nus na khyed kyis rjes su dpag pa la yang gnyen po med par ji ltar nges she na /
translated: If it is not able to be ascertained, then how is it ascertained that your inference also has no antidote?

original: bshad pa / kho bo cag gis ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rjes su dpag pa'i yul nyid la de nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i zla bo gang yin pa de mi srid pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med do ;
analyzed: bshad pa / kho bo cag gis ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rjes su dpag pa'i yul nyid la de nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i zla bo gang yin pa de mi srid pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med do ;
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: Since it is impossible for something that has the characteristics of the object of an inference that has the characteristics as we have explained to have an opposite, there is no nonerroneous contradiction in an inference.

original: 'di ltar de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag gis 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig la mi 'khrul pa can yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag gis 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig la mi 'khrul pa can yin te /
translated: Thus, identity and origination are nonerroneous with regard to some things.

original: de lta ma yin na mi 'khrul bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mi 'khrul bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were not so, it would be illogical for them to be nonerroneous.

original: don gcig la ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gnyis yod pa ma yin no //üîΩdes na chos can gcig la phan @58a * //
analyzed: don gcig la ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gnyis yod pa ma yin no // des na chos can gcig la phan @58a * //
translated: Two mutually exclusive natures cannot exist in one object.

original: tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin la mi 'khrul ba'i chos gnyis shin tu srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin la mi 'khrul ba'i chos gnyis shin tu srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is utterly impossible for two mutually exclusive natures to be nonerroneous with regard to one and the same basis.

original: des na tshad mas grub pa'i rjes su dpag pa la tshad ma can ma yin pa'i 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can mi srid do //
analyzed: des na tshad mas grub pa'i rjes su dpag pa la tshad ma can ma yin pa'i 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can mi srid do //
translated: Thus, it is impossible for a nonauthoritative person to nonerroneously contradict an inference that is established by a valid means of knowledge.

original: ma grub pa la sogs pa ni tshad mas srid pa yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa la sogs pa ni tshad mas srid pa yin no //
translated: Non-establishment and so on are possible by means of valid cognition.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa nyid slob dpon gyis bshad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i grangs gcig pa nyid slob dpon gyis bshad pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the number one that is intended to be expressed explained by the master?

original: de ci ltar brjod par 'dod ba'i grangs gcig pa nyid nges par mi nus pa'i phyir mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: de ci ltar brjod par 'dod ba'i grangs gcig pa nyid nges par mi nus pa'i phyir mi 'dod ce na /
translated: How is it that one cannot ascertain the number one that is intended to be expressed?

original: bshad pa / bden te /
analyzed: bshad pa / bden te /
translated: Reply: That is true.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul 'di la mi 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul 'di la mi 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: But we do not accept inference as a means of valid cognition in this case.

original: 'o na 'di'i yul gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'di'i yul gang zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is the object of this?

original: 'di'i yul ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di'i yul ni zhes smos so //
translated: The object of this is . . .

original: dkyus ma nyid mjug bsdu ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: dkyus ma nyid mjug bsdu ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to summarize the main point, it is said:

original: gang gi phyir 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med par gang las kyang nges pa ma yin pa de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba bshad ma thag ba'i tshul gyis mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dag brjod pa na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can med par gang las kyang nges pa ma yin pa de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba bshad ma thag ba'i tshul gyis mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dag brjod pa na /
translated: Because there is no non-erroneous contradiction anywhere, there is no ascertainment from that. Therefore, in the way just explained, when the valid cognitions of direct perception and inference are stated,

original: de las te tshad ma dag gis nges par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de las te tshad ma dag gis nges par brjod pa yin no //
translated: then ascertainment is expressed by those valid cognitions.

original: nges pa'i don ni gzhan gyis gnod par byed pa yin no /
analyzed: nges pa'i don ni gzhan gyis gnod par byed pa yin no /
translated: The definitive meaning is that which is contradicted by another.

original: don de'i nges bar byed pa yang gnod par byed bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: don de'i nges bar byed pa yang gnod par byed bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: And that which makes the meaning definitive is also said to be the contradiction.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma dag gnod par byed par brjod pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma dag gnod par byed par brjod pa na /
translated: Therefore, when valid cognitions are said to be contradictory,

original: gnod par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan nges pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan nges pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: the definite reason for the contradiction is being stated.

original: 'di la gnod par brjod pa'i tshul ni sngar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la gnod par brjod pa'i tshul ni sngar brjod pa yin no //
translated: The way of stating the contradiction here was stated earlier.

original: nges par brjod pa des na gnyen po dang lhan cig 'jug pa gang yin pa de srid pa sel bar byed de /
analyzed: nges par brjod pa des na gnyen po dang lhan cig 'jug pa gang yin pa de srid pa sel bar byed de /
translated: By that definitive statement, whatever is engaged together with the antidote eliminates existence.

original: gnyen po dang bcas pa ni nges pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyen po dang bcas pa ni nges pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: That which is together with the antidote is not the cause of definitiveness.

original: gnyen po med pa de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i yul la gnyen po med par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyen po med pa de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i yul la gnyen po med par ston pa yin no //
translated: Because of the absence of the antidote, it is shown that there is no antidote in the domain of inference.

original: 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can mi srid par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can mi srid par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it be impossible for there to be a non-erroneous contradiction?

original: gla te mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag gis ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gla te mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag gis ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not by seeing or not seeing that there is concomitance and reverse concomitance.

original: 'on kyang de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag gis yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag gis yin no //
translated: But it is by virtue of being of the same nature as that and by virtue of arising from that.

original: 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can mi srid pas na /üîΩslob dpon rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa ni /
analyzed: 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can mi srid pas na / slob dpon rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa ni /
translated: Because it is impossible for a nonerroneous contradiction to exist.üîΩThe master [Dharmakƒ´rti] asserts that the ascertainment of the forward and reverse pervasion

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin par bzhed pa yin no zhes bya ba yang don gyis brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin par bzhed pa yin no zhes bya ba yang don gyis brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: is based on the reason of being of the same nature as that and arising from that.

original: de ltar gang la thun mong ma yin pa'i rjes su dpag pa med la @58b zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'di'i don bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar gang la thun mong ma yin pa'i rjes su dpag pa med la @58b zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'di'i don bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the meaning of the passage, ‚Äúwhere there is no uncommon inference,‚Äù

original: gzhan du bshad par bya ba'i phyir yang na zhes smos so //üîΩgang du pha rol gyis 'gal ba'i don dam bcas ba na gtan tshigs thams cad thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan du bshad par bya ba'i phyir yang na zhes smos so // gang du pha rol gyis 'gal ba'i don dam bcas ba na gtan tshigs thams cad thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: he says ‚Äúor‚Äù in order to explain something else.üîΩWhen the opponent asserts a contradictory meaning, all reasons are not uncommon because

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir zlog par byed pa cig shos la phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa na /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir zlog par byed pa cig shos la phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa na /
translated: there is no forward pervasion. When there is no inference that proves the opposite,

original: tshad ma med par de ci ltar zlog par byed ce na /
analyzed: tshad ma med par de ci ltar zlog par byed ce na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúHow can you refute that without a valid cognition?‚Äù

original: bshad pa / sgra las byung ba'i grags pas bsal ba yin gyi rjes su dpag bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / sgra las byung ba'i grags pas bsal ba yin gyi rjes su dpag bas ni ma yin no //
translated: We respond: We refute that by the force of what is commonly acknowledged, not by inference.

original: de ltar gang la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med la zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'dis /
analyzed: de ltar gang la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med la zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'dis /
translated: Thus, this passage, ‚ÄúBecause there is no inference with respect to that,‚Äù

original: 'jig rten gyi 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid du brjod pa la rjes su dpag pa med par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid du brjod pa la rjes su dpag pa med par bshad pa yin no //
translated: explains that the expression of the object of desire by the term ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is not by inference.

original: 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba la rjes su dpag pa med pas cir 'gyur zhe na /üîΩrjes su dpag pa med par brjod pa 'dis ni rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba'i don gzhan yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba la rjes su dpag pa med pas cir 'gyur zhe na / rjes su dpag pa med par brjod pa 'dis ni rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba'i don gzhan yin la /
translated: If the expression of the object of desire is not by inference, what is the problem?

original: grags pas rtogs par bya ba'i yul yang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: grags pas rtogs par bya ba'i yul yang gzhan yin no //
translated: This statement that it is not by inference explains that the object that is understood by inference is different from the object that is understood by what is commonly acknowledged.

original: de skad brjod pas kyang ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de skad brjod pas kyang ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What is the point of saying that?

original: bshad pa / de skad brjod pa des na dngos po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa de las grags pa yul tha dad pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i dbang gis 'jug pa ma yin no zhes shugs kyis brjod pa
analyzed: bshad pa / de skad brjod pa des na dngos po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa de las grags pa yul tha dad pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po'i dbang gis 'jug pa ma yin no zhes shugs kyis brjod pa
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: Since you say that, then the inference that conforms with the existence or nonexistence of things does not engage its object by the power of things because it is renowned to have a different object.

original: yin no // rjes su dpag pa ni dngos po la 'jug pa'i phyir dang / grags pa'i rtags ni sgro btags kyi rang bzhin gyi don la 'jug pa'i phyir dngos po la mi ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: yin no // rjes su dpag pa ni dngos po la 'jug pa'i phyir dang / grags pa'i rtags ni sgro btags kyi rang bzhin gyi don la 'jug pa'i phyir dngos po la mi ltos pa yin no //
translated: Since inference engages its object by the power of things, and since the evidence of renown engages a superimposed object, it does not rely on things.

original: ci ltar na rjes su dpag pa med ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar na rjes su dpag pa med ce na /
translated: How is it that there is no inference?

original: ri bong can zla bar mi 'dod pa des zhes smos so //
analyzed: ri bong can zla bar mi 'dod pa des zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe one who does not assert that the rabbit-bearer is the moon.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir ri bod can zla ba ste zla ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid du shin tu grags pa yang bsnyon pa ni grags pa 'ga' la yang mi bsnyon pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ri bod can zla ba ste zla ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid du shin tu grags pa yang bsnyon pa ni grags pa 'ga' la yang mi bsnyon pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the rabbit-bearer, that is, the moon, is renowned as the referent of the word ‚Äúmoon,‚Äù it is not the case that renown is never refuted.

original: 'di ltar ri bong can zla ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba dngos po ma yin pa spong ba ni khyad par med pa'i phyir dngos po pa sgras brjod par bya ba gzhan gyi grags pa thams cad spong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar ri bong can zla ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba dngos po ma yin pa spong ba ni khyad par med pa'i phyir dngos po pa sgras brjod par bya ba gzhan gyi grags pa thams cad spong ba yin no //
translated: Thus, since the exclusion of the non-entity that is the referent of the word ‚Äúmoon‚Äù is not distinguished, all other entities that are the referents of the word are excluded.

original: des na dngos po pa'i grags pa thams cad spong ba la dngos po pa'i zla ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba dang ldan pa'i chos gang du yang sgrub pa med do //
analyzed: des na dngos po pa'i grags pa thams cad spong ba la dngos po pa'i zla ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba dang ldan pa'i chos gang du yang sgrub pa med do //
translated: Therefore, in the exclusion of all entities that are the referents of the word, there is no establishment of any property that is the referent of the word ‚Äúmoon‚Äù as an entity.

original: @59a * // de'i phyir dngos po pa'i zla ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid la rjes su dpag pa dpe med pa yin no //
analyzed: @59a * // de'i phyir dngos po pa'i zla ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid la rjes su dpag pa dpe med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the inference of the referent of the word ‚Äúmoon‚Äù as an entity is without an example.

original: des na rtags thun mong ma yin par bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na rtags thun mong ma yin par bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, it is said that the reason is not commonly established.

original: gal te grags pas grub bzla ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid 'ga' zhig la bsnyen pa de la yang zla ba gnyis pa med pa'i phyir rtags thun mong ma yin pa nyid ma yin nam /

analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i grags pa'i chos gnod par byed pa yin na /
translated: language,üîΩthen what is the point of explaining that there is no inference that establishes

analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis brjod par bya ba bsgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa med par bshad pa 'dis ci bya zhe na /

translated: ‚ÄúüîΩThis‚Äù refers to the fact that when the object of expression is not an existentüîΩentity because there is no inference, then the words are in accordance with

analyzed: gang la rgyu mtshan te dgos pa yod pa de ni rgyu mtshan gyi sgra'o //

translated: The meaning that is expressed by those words, or the ultimate meaning that is expressed by the words, is not refuted. It is said that it cannot be refuted by what is commonly held.

original: gang gi phyir brda las byung ba'i grags pas gnod pa yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir brda las byung ba'i grags pas gnod pa yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because it is refuted by what is commonly held that arises from linguistic signs,

original: yul gyi khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir grags pa rjes su dpag pa las phyi rol du gyur pa ma yin yang tha dad du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: yul gyi khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir grags pa rjes su dpag pa las phyi rol du gyur pa ma yin yang tha dad du byas pa yin no //
translated: in order to indicate the difference in their objects, even though it is not external to inference, it is treated as if it were different.

original: grags pa'i yul ni brda las byung ba'i don yin la /
analyzed: grags pa'i yul ni brda las byung ba'i don yin la /
translated: The object of what is commonly held is the meaning that arises from linguistic signs.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni dngos po yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni yul gyi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni dngos po yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni yul gyi dbye ba'o //
translated: The object of inference is a thing. This is the difference in their objects.

original: ci ltar phyi rol du gyur pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar phyi rol du gyur pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not external?

original: snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba smos te ci ltar sngar yid ches pa'i tshig gnod par byed pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa las phyi rol du gyur pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba smos te ci ltar sngar yid ches pa'i tshig gnod par byed pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa las phyi rol du gyur pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: The phrase ‚Äújust like before‚Äù means that just as a statement that is accepted as authoritative does not become external to inference, because it is accepted as authoritative,

original: grags pa gnod par byed par yang 'dod la /
analyzed: grags pa gnod par byed par yang 'dod la /
translated: so too, what is renowned is accepted as authoritative.

original: mngon sum yang ma yin pa de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum yang ma yin pa de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid yin te /
translated: And because it is not direct perception, it is inference.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa gnod par byed bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa gnod par byed bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that an invalid is authoritative.

original: de ltar 'gro la grags pa rang bzhin rtags zhes bya ba de bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'gro la grags pa rang bzhin rtags zhes bya ba de bshad nas /
translated: Having explained that what is renowned to the world is a reason that is nature,

original: mngon sum gyi gnod pa smras pa ;üîΩmngon sum dang 'gal bar rab tu grags pa'i yul yang sgra gang la rang bzhin sna tshogs te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi gnod pa smras pa ; mngon sum dang 'gal bar rab tu grags pa'i yul yang sgra gang la rang bzhin sna tshogs te /
translated: he states the contradiction with direct perception:üîΩ‚ÄúThe subject is a sound that is renowned to contradict direct perception.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas byas pa ldog pa la ltos pa'i chos du ma yod pa'i sgra de'i rang bzhin de dag las /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pas byas pa ldog pa la ltos pa'i chos du ma yod pa'i sgra de'i rang bzhin de dag las /
translated: The nature of that sound is various, because it is produced by conceptual consciousness. It has many properties that depend on cessation.

original: rang bzhin gang zhig nyan pa'i shes pa la gnyis su med par @61a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang zhig nyan pa'i shes pa la gnyis su med par @61a * //
translated: That nature which is nondual in the auditory consciousness,

original: te ; gnyis kyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: te ; gnyis kyis stong pa'o //
translated: which is empty of duality.

original: gang gis gcig ni spyi yin la gzhan ni bsal ba yin par brtags nas spyi'i rang bzhin bkag na yang mngon sum gyis gnod bar dogs pa /
analyzed: gang gis gcig ni spyi yin la gzhan ni bsal ba yin par brtags nas spyi'i rang bzhin bkag na yang mngon sum gyis gnod bar dogs pa /
translated: Since one is imagined to be the universal and the other the particular, even if the nature of the universal is refuted, there is the fear of contradiction by perception.

original: de la rang bzhin gnyis ni med do //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gnyis ni med do //
translated: In that regard, there are no two natures.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gsal ba de la 'brel ba can gzhan de nyid med pas so //
analyzed: gsal ba de la 'brel ba can gzhan de nyid med pas so //
translated: Because there is no other that is related to that particular.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dres pa ste 'dren mar snang ba gang la yod pa'i blo de mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dres pa ste 'dren mar snang ba gang la yod pa'i blo de mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cognition that has a mixture, that is, an appearance of a mixture, does not see it.

original: bltar rung ba'i yod pa nyid ni der snang ba'i shes pa las yin la /
analyzed: bltar rung ba'i yod pa nyid ni der snang ba'i shes pa las yin la /
translated: The existence of what is suitable to be seen is from a cognition that appears as that.

original: du ma nyid kyang snang ba du ma las yin no //
analyzed: du ma nyid kyang snang ba du ma las yin no //
translated: And the multiplicity is from many appearances.

original: de'i phyir na 'di blta bar rung ba mi dmigs pa las gzhan yod pa nyid dam du ma nyid yin pa gsal bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na 'di blta bar rung ba mi dmigs pa las gzhan yod pa nyid dam du ma nyid yin pa gsal bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be clearly understood that the existence or multiplicity of that which is suitable to be seen is from the non-observation of that.

original: gang yang gnyis su med pa de nyid spong ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis 'gal ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gang yang gnyis su med pa de nyid spong ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis 'gal ba yin gyi /
translated: And that which is not dual is contradictory by the reason of the negation of that very thing.

original: gzhan bkag pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan bkag pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis 'gal ba yin no //
translated: It is not contradictory by the reason of the negation of another.

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni dper brjod do //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni dper brjod do //
translated: For example, is an example.

original: mnyan par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not to be heard.

original: mnyan par bya ba'i sgras ni nyan pas gzung ba'i rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa gnyis med pa spong ba yin no //
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba'i sgras ni nyan pas gzung ba'i rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa gnyis med pa spong ba yin no //
translated: By the word to be heard, the nature of being apprehended by hearing is excluded, which is the case of the non-existence of duality.

original: de'i phyir yang zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba can thams cad dang bral ba'i rang bzhin nyan pas gzung ba nyid spong ba la mngon sum gyis gnod pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di'i don du 'dir mtshan nyid kyi mdor mngon sum don dang zhes don gyi sgra
analyzed: de'i phyir yang zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba can thams cad dang bral ba'i rang bzhin nyan pas gzung ba nyid spong ba la mngon sum gyis gnod pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di'i don du 'dir mtshan nyid kyi mdor mngon sum don dang zhes don gyi sgra
translated: Therefore, is the meaning of this: The nature of being free from all relations, which is the very apprehension of hearing, is contradicted by perception. This is the meaning. Here, in the sutra on the characteristics, the word object is used in the word direct perception of objects.üîΩThe word object is used in the sutra on the characteristics.

original: smos so // yang ci ltar na rang bzhin de nyid la don gyi sgras brjod ce na /
analyzed: smos so // yang ci ltar na rang bzhin de nyid la don gyi sgras brjod ce na /
translated: Moreover, how is that very nature expressed by the word object?

original: bshad pa / dbang po'i shes pas gzung bar bya ba gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid sgra de las don te don dam pa yin la /
analyzed: bshad pa / dbang po'i shes pas gzung bar bya ba gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid sgra de las don te don dam pa yin la /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: The meaning, the ultimate, is that very nature that is not dual, which is the object of the sense consciousnesses.

original: rang bzhin lhag ma ni ldog ba'i rgyu mtshan can rtogs pa'i shes pas bkod pa spyi yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin lhag ma ni ldog ba'i rgyu mtshan can rtogs pa'i shes pas bkod pa spyi yin no //
translated: The remaining nature is the universal that is posited by the conceptual consciousness that has the reason for the exclusion.

original: gang gi phyir de ni dngos po med pa de'i phyir na dbang pos gzung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni dngos po med pa de'i phyir na dbang pos gzung ba ma yin no //
translated: Because that is a nonentity, it is not an object of the sense consciousnesses.

original: spyi'i rang bzhin rnams dbang po'i gzung ba ma yin ba des na de dag mngon sum ma yin bar grub ba'i rgyu'i phyir spang bar byas na yang gnod pa med do zhes bya ba'i dngos po 'di slob dpon gyis mnyan bya'i sgras bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i rang bzhin rnams dbang po'i gzung ba ma yin ba des na de dag mngon sum ma yin bar grub ba'i rgyu'i phyir spang bar byas na yang gnod pa med do zhes bya ba'i dngos po 'di slob dpon gyis mnyan bya'i sgras bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since the nature of universals is not an object of the sense consciousnesses, it is established that they are not direct perception. The master has stated this point in the words ‚Äúobject of hearing.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar sgra med do zhes de skad smras pa la yang mngon sum dang 'gal ba ni yod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra med do zhes de skad smras pa la yang mngon sum dang 'gal ba ni yod mod kyi /
translated: In the same way, when someone says, ‚ÄúThere is no sound,‚Äù that statement is indeed contradicted by direct perception.

original: 'on kyang sgra'i yul @61b 'gog pa la ni lam du ma yod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang sgra'i yul @61b 'gog pa la ni lam du ma yod de /
translated: However, there are many ways to refute the object of sound.

original: skad cig ma nyid dam khyab pa nyid dam rtag ba nyid du sgra yod ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid dam khyab pa nyid dam rtag ba nyid du sgra yod ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Sound does not exist as momentary, as pervasive, or as permanent.

original: de la mnyan bya'i sgra med na thams cad 'gog pa la mngon sum gyis gnod bar dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la mnyan bya'i sgra med na thams cad 'gog pa la mngon sum gyis gnod bar dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the sound that is heard did not exist, there would be the fear that the refutation of everything would be contradicted by perception.

original: mnyan bya'i sgras ni nyan pa'i gzung ba gang yin pa'i rang bzhin de nyid 'gog pa mngon sum gyis gnod kyi spyi'i chos 'gog pa la ni ma yin no zhes bstan bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnyan bya'i sgras ni nyan pa'i gzung ba gang yin pa'i rang bzhin de nyid 'gog pa mngon sum gyis gnod kyi spyi'i chos 'gog pa la ni ma yin no zhes bstan bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The sound that is heard refutes the very nature that is the object of hearing, but it does not refute the general property.

original: gal te mnyan bya'i sgra yang spyi brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mnyan bya'i sgra yang spyi brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the sound that is heard also said to be a universal?

original: de ci ltar 'dis dbang po'i spyod yul brjod bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar 'dis dbang po'i spyod yul brjod bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How then can it express the object of the sense faculties?

original: bshad pa / rnam kun te rnam pa thams cad kyi sgra'i thun mong ma yin pa'i rang bzhin de brjod bar bya ba'i dngos po ma yin pa de'i phyir mnyan bya'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: bshad pa / rnam kun te rnam pa thams cad kyi sgra'i thun mong ma yin pa'i rang bzhin de brjod bar bya ba'i dngos po ma yin pa de'i phyir mnyan bya'i sgras brjod do //
translated: We reply: In every way, the uncommon nature of sound is not the thing that is expressed. Therefore, the sound that is heard expresses that.

original: sgra'i sgra 'ba' zhig ni thams cad la dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra'i sgra 'ba' zhig ni thams cad la dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mere word sound is doubted in all cases.

original: mnyan bya'i sgra lhag pas ni shugs kyis khyad par rtogs par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: mnyan bya'i sgra lhag pas ni shugs kyis khyad par rtogs par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: But the word sound that is heard is understood by implication to be qualified.

original: de rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not because it has a particular object.

original: gal te de ltar na sgra rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis ci ste ma brjod ces dogs pa la /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na sgra rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis ci ste ma brjod ces dogs pa la /
translated: If that is so, why is it not stated with a qualification such as the sound that is its own characteristic?

original: mnyan bya'i sgra'i dogs pa bshad pa /
analyzed: mnyan bya'i sgra'i dogs pa bshad pa /
translated: The explanation of the doubt regarding the word that is heard.

original: sgra rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de grub pa ni nyan pa'i shes pa de la brtan nas yin te /
analyzed: sgra rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de grub pa ni nyan pa'i shes pa de la brtan nas yin te /
translated: The sound that is its own characteristic is established based on that auditory consciousness.

original: grub pa'i rgyu des na de'i zhes bya ba nyan pa'i tshad ma'i stobs kyis gnod pa'i rgyu'i phyir mnyan bya'i sgras dbang po'i yul bshad do //
analyzed: grub pa'i rgyu des na de'i zhes bya ba nyan pa'i tshad ma'i stobs kyis gnod pa'i rgyu'i phyir mnyan bya'i sgras dbang po'i yul bshad do //
translated: By that cause of establishment, it is said that that is negated by the power of the valid cognition of hearing. Therefore, the word that is heard explains the object of the sense faculty.

original: rab tu grub pa'i don gnod par byed pa yin la sgra yang nyan pa la grub pa yin te /
analyzed: rab tu grub pa'i don gnod par byed pa yin la sgra yang nyan pa la grub pa yin te /
translated: The object that is well-established is negated, and the sound is established for the hearer.

original: de'i phyir sgra grub pa'i rgyu rab tu bstan pa'i sgo nas gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ston pas mnyan bya'i sgra smos pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra grub pa'i rgyu rab tu bstan pa'i sgo nas gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ston pas mnyan bya'i sgra smos pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúheard‚Äù is mentioned in order to show the valid cognition that contradicts the reason for establishing the sound.

original: kha cig na re de la brten nas grub pas na /
analyzed: kha cig na re de la brten nas grub pas na /
translated: Some say: Because it is established in dependence on that,

original: de'i stobs kyis gnod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni gtan tshigs gnyis yin te gang gi phyir don 'di nyan pa'i stobs kyis grub pa yin pa'i phyir dang / gang gi phyir nyan pa'i stobs kyis 'gal ba la gnod pa yang yin pa de'i phyir mnyan bya'i sgras brjod ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis gnod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni gtan tshigs gnyis yin te gang gi phyir don 'di nyan pa'i stobs kyis grub pa yin pa'i phyir dang / gang gi phyir nyan pa'i stobs kyis 'gal ba la gnod pa yang yin pa de'i phyir mnyan bya'i sgras brjod ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: and because it contradicts by the power of that, these are the two reasons. Because this meaning is established by the power of hearing, and because it contradicts by the power of hearing, therefore it is expressed by the word ‚Äúheard.‚Äù

original: dam bcas pa'i don rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba la yang dper brjod pa ni bum pa rtag pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba la yang dper brjod pa ni bum pa rtag pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: An example of a thesis whose meaning contradicts inference is ‚ÄúThe pot is permanent.‚Äù

original: yang ci ltar @62a * //
analyzed: yang ci ltar @62a * //
translated: How is that?

original: 'jig pa'i bum pa mthong ba yang rtag par rlom zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i bum pa mthong ba yang rtag par rlom zhe na /
translated: One might think, ‚ÄúI see a destroyed pot and it is permanent.‚Äù

original: brdegs pa bzod par mthong ba dag la'o //
analyzed: brdegs pa bzod par mthong ba dag la'o //
translated: It is like seeing someone who endures being beaten.

original: gal te 'di ldog pa'i chos can yin na brdegs na ldog par 'gyur ba zhig na ldog par yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'di ldog pa'i chos can yin na brdegs na ldog par 'gyur ba zhig na ldog par yang ma yin te /
translated: If it were a phenomenon that ceased, it would cease when struck, but it does not cease.

original: des na bum pa gnas pa yin zhes 'khrul pas bum pa rtag pa'o zhes bya ba de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na bum pa gnas pa yin zhes 'khrul pas bum pa rtag pa'o zhes bya ba de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is mistaken to say that the vase endures, and it is also mistaken to say that the vase is permanent.

original: rtag pa de yang ci ltar sngar mthong ba'i bum pa phyis zhig pa na med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rtag pa de yang ci ltar sngar mthong ba'i bum pa phyis zhig pa na med pa de bzhin du /
translated: And if it is permanent, then just as it was seen before, it would not be nonexistent later when the vase is destroyed.

original: skye ba dang ldan pa dang stsogs pa smos pas byas pa dang yod pa'i phyir thams cad med bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa dang stsogs pa smos pas byas pa dang yod pa'i phyir thams cad med bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And because it is produced and exists, everything would be nonexistent, as stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúIf it is endowed with arising. . . .‚Äù

original: dpe yang dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe yang dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: To refute the example,

original: grangs can gyis smras pa /
analyzed: grangs can gyis smras pa /
translated: the SƒÅ·πÉkhya says:

original: gal te mi rtag pa'i bum pa ni 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa'i bum pa ni 'ga' yang med de /
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no impermanent vase at all.

original: zhig pa dang ma zhig pa'i bum pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: zhig pa dang ma zhig pa'i bum pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni rtag pa yin no //
translated: Whatever vase is destroyed or not destroyed, all of that is permanent.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba med par ldog pa yin na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba med par ldog pa yin na /
translated: Impermanence is the reversal of what is not a universal.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med par ldog pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med par ldog pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no reversal of what is not a universal at all.‚Äù

original: des na mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no such thing as impermanence.

original: 'o na bum pa 'gags pa la ji ltar zhe na der yang dmigs par bya ba'i bskal pa ste chod pa yin pa de'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na bum pa 'gags pa la ji ltar zhe na der yang dmigs par bya ba'i bskal pa ste chod pa yin pa de'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: But if the pot is destroyed, how can it be perceived? It is perceived because there is a gap in the perception of it.

original: mi rtag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not impermanent.

original: bltar rung ba'i gnas skabs btang nas /
analyzed: bltar rung ba'i gnas skabs btang nas /
translated: It is said that the pot abandons the state of being visible and

original: bltar mi rung pa'i gnas skabs len pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bltar mi rung pa'i gnas skabs len pa yin gyi /
translated: takes on the state of being invisible.

original: zhig ba'i bum pa gtan nas log pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: zhig ba'i bum pa gtan nas log pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not that the destroyed pot is completely gone.

original: de'i gnas skabs ma yin pa ni zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs ma yin pa ni zhes smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin a state other than that‚Äù means

original: sngar gyi bltar rung ba dang don bya ba sbyor bar rung ba'i gnas skabs gang la yod pa de nyid kyi dngos po yin la /
analyzed: sngar gyi bltar rung ba dang don bya ba sbyor bar rung ba'i gnas skabs gang la yod pa de nyid kyi dngos po yin la /
translated: that the entity is in the state in which it is visible and suitable to perform a function.

original: de ma yin pa ni de'i gnas skabs ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ma yin pa ni de'i gnas skabs ma yin pa'o //
translated: A state other than that is a state in which it is not.

original: gal te de'i gnas skabs ma yin pa ni gnas skabs gzhan yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te de'i gnas skabs ma yin pa ni gnas skabs gzhan yin gyi /
translated: If you say that a state other than that is a different state,

original: bum pa ni gnas pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa ni gnas pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: then the pot would remain.

original: de'i gnas skabs ni de nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs ni de nyid yin no //
translated: But that state is just that.

original: bum pa'i gnas pa ci 'dra ba dang ldan pa'i gnas skabs 'bras bu la nye bar sbyor ba de nyid bum pa yin te /
analyzed: bum pa'i gnas pa ci 'dra ba dang ldan pa'i gnas skabs 'bras bu la nye bar sbyor ba de nyid bum pa yin te /
translated: The state of the vase that possesses the abiding of the vase is the vase itself.

original: gnas skabs can mthong ba med pa don byed pa la nye bar sbyor ba med pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gnas skabs can mthong ba med pa don byed pa la nye bar sbyor ba med pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
translated: Since the state of the vase is seen, what use is there in positing another state that is not seen and is not connected to the performance of an action?

original: de'i gnas skabs de log la ma log pa zhes bya ba gzhan ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs de log la ma log pa zhes bya ba gzhan ci zhig yod /
translated: What other state is there that is called ‚Äúthe cessation of that state‚Äù?

original: des na de'i gnas skabs ma yin pa nyid mi rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i gnas skabs ma yin pa nyid mi rtag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which is not the state of the vase is impermanent.

original: de ni bum pa zhig pa la yod pas na /üîΩzhig pa'i phyir ram bskal pa'i @62b phyir zhes bya ba'i yu bu cag gi 'bras bu de'i gnas skabs ma yin pa la khyad par med ba des na rgyu mtshan yang khyad par med bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir zhig ba dang bskal pa'i sgra la mngon par zhen
analyzed: de ni bum pa zhig pa la yod pas na / zhig pa'i phyir ram bskal pa'i @62b phyir zhes bya ba'i yu bu cag gi 'bras bu de'i gnas skabs ma yin pa la khyad par med ba des na rgyu mtshan yang khyad par med bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir zhig ba dang bskal pa'i sgra la mngon par zhen
translated: Since that state exists in the disintegration of the vase,üîΩthere is no difference between the state of the vase and the state that is not the vase, whether it is called ‚Äúdisintegrated‚Äù or ‚Äúdestroyed.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, since there is no difference in the reason, we do not

original: ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ba ma yin no //
translated: depend on the words ‚Äúdisintegrated‚Äù or ‚Äúdestroyed.‚Äù

original: des na de ltar de'i gnas skabs bum pa yin pas na bskal pa'i sgras zhig pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de ltar de'i gnas skabs bum pa yin pas na bskal pa'i sgras zhig pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the state of that is a pot, the word ‚Äúdestroyed‚Äù expresses the state of having been destroyed.

original: dmigs par bya ba dbus kyi bum pa'i rang bzhin bum pa de nyid yang snga ma dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin gang la yod pa de'i ngo bor ma dmigs kyang snga ma dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs na yod do zhes smra ba ni tshig gi
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba dbus kyi bum pa'i rang bzhin bum pa de nyid yang snga ma dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin gang la yod pa de'i ngo bor ma dmigs kyang snga ma dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs na yod do zhes smra ba ni tshig gi
translated: The object of observation is the nature of the pot in the middle, and that pot itself is the nature of the state of the prior and subsequent. Although it is not observed in the entity of that, it is said to exist in the prior and subsequent states.

original: don rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa tha dad pa la gnod do //
analyzed: don rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa tha dad pa la gnod do //
translated: This contradicts the different presentations of the meanings of the words.

original: rang bzhin gang zhig rang bzhin gzhan gang la ma dmigs pa de de la med pa'i phyir rang bzhin tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang zhig rang bzhin gzhan gang la ma dmigs pa de de la med pa'i phyir rang bzhin tha dad pa yin na /
translated: If any nature is not observed in any other nature, then it does not exist in that, and they are different natures.

original: khyod kyis ni thams cad nyid kyi bdag nyid du smras pas gang zhig gang na ma dmigs pa de yang de la yod pa yin no //
analyzed: khyod kyis ni thams cad nyid kyi bdag nyid du smras pas gang zhig gang na ma dmigs pa de yang de la yod pa yin no //
translated: But you say that everything is the same nature, so whatever is not observed in whatever is also present in that.

original: des na tshig gi don rnam par gzhag pa la gnod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na tshig gi don rnam par gzhag pa la gnod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it does not contradict the presentation of the meanings of the words.

original: 'di snyam du nged cag ni tha dad pa'i rnam par gzhag pa mi 'dod pa nyid do snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du nged cag ni tha dad pa'i rnam par gzhag pa mi 'dod pa nyid do snyam na /
translated: But if you think, ‚ÄúWe do not assert that they are posited as different,‚ÄùüîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / de ltar yin na ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa dang sems pa yod pa dag tha dad par rnam par 'jog pa la gnod pa yod de /
analyzed: bshad pa / de ltar yin na ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa dang sems pa yod pa dag tha dad par rnam par 'jog pa la gnod pa yod de /
translated: If that were so, it would undermine the positing of sattva, rajas, and tamas and the existence of consciousness as different,

original: phan tshun rang bzhin tha dad par rnam par gzhag par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun rang bzhin tha dad par rnam par gzhag par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be tenable to posit them as having different natures.

original: ci ltar mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar mi rung zhe na /
translated: Why is it not tenable?

original: de la yang zhes smos te /
analyzed: de la yang zhes smos te /
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúIn that case . . .‚Äù

original: snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa dang / sems pa yod pa de la yang mi dmigs pa las ma gtogs pa'i tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa'i rten gzhan ni brtag par mi nus so ;
analyzed: snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa dang / sems pa yod pa de la yang mi dmigs pa las ma gtogs pa'i tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa'i rten gzhan ni brtag par mi nus so ;
translated: In that case, it is not possible to posit sattva, rajas, and tamas and the existence of consciousness as different from nonapprehension because it is not possible to conceive of any other basis for positing them as different.

original: grangs can yang chu don du gnyer ba me la rjes su rgyug pa ni ma yin pas na 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad pa'i tha snyad 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: grangs can yang chu don du gnyer ba me la rjes su rgyug pa ni ma yin pas na 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad pa'i tha snyad 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Since the SƒÅ·πÉkhya do not pursue fire in order to obtain water, they assert that they accept the conventions of the everyday world.

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi zho la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'di ni 'o ma la sogs pa'i rgyu dag la ma dmigs pa ni med la /
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi zho la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'di ni 'o ma la sogs pa'i rgyu dag la ma dmigs pa ni med la /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to say that this effect, such as curd, which has the nature of an object, does not exist in its cause, such as milk,

original: 'o ma yang zho la sogs pa de la med do zhes bya ba'i med pa'i tha snyad 'di ni rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o ma yang zho la sogs pa de la med do zhes bya ba'i med pa'i tha snyad 'di ni rigs pa yin te /
translated: and that milk does not exist in curd.

original: tshad mas rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad mas rtogs pa yin no //
translated: This is understood by means of a valid cognition.

original: gang zhig gang gi ngo bor ma dmigs pa de ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi ngo bor ma dmigs pa de ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is not perceived in the nature of something else is not the intrinsic nature of that other thing,

original: dper na bde ba sdug bsngal gyi ngo bor ma dmigs pa na de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa bzhin @63a * //
analyzed: dper na bde ba sdug bsngal gyi ngo bor ma dmigs pa na de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa bzhin @63a * //
translated: just as pleasure is not perceived in the nature of pain.

original: no ; de bzhin du 'o ma yang zho'i rang bzhin du ma dmigs te des na de'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: no ; de bzhin du 'o ma yang zho'i rang bzhin du ma dmigs te des na de'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, milk is not perceived in the nature of curd, therefore it is not its intrinsic nature.

original: de 'dra ba bltar rung ba'i yod ba nyid ni dmigs pas khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: de 'dra ba bltar rung ba'i yod ba nyid ni dmigs pas khyab pa yin te /
translated: Such existence, which is suitable to be seen, is pervaded by perception,

original: dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reason for perception is limited to that.

original: dmigs ba med pa'i phyir ni khyad par bya ba yang ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs ba med pa'i phyir ni khyad par bya ba yang ldog pa yin no //
translated: Because of the absence of perception, the distinction is also eliminated.

original: cig shos kyi rang bzhin dmigs pa ni de'i rang bzhin ma dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: cig shos kyi rang bzhin dmigs pa ni de'i rang bzhin ma dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The non-perception of the nature of the other is the perception of the nature of that.

original: de'i phyir dmigs par bya ba ma dmigs pa 'di lta bu'i rigs can gyi yul thams cad la sbyar bar blta'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs par bya ba ma dmigs pa 'di lta bu'i rigs can gyi yul thams cad la sbyar bar blta'o //
translated: Therefore, this non-perception of the object of perception should be seen as applicable to all cases of this type.

original: dmigs ba yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: dmigs ba yod pa nyid do //
translated: The existence of the object of perception.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rjes su dpag ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag ste /
translated: It is inferred.

original: mngon sum gcig pu ni dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gcig pu ni dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Perception alone is not the object of perception.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: mi nus ba las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi nus ba las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not arise from what is impossible.

original: 'ga' zhig las byung ba'i phyir na 'bras bu yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig las byung ba'i phyir na 'bras bu yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it arises from something, it has an existent effect, that is the meaning.

original: med pa skye na ni med par khyad par med pas thams cad las skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: med pa skye na ni med par khyad par med pas thams cad las skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: If the nonexistent were to arise, because there would be no difference between the nonexistent, everything would arise from everything.

original: 'ga' zhig las skye ba yang yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig las skye ba yang yin te /
translated: But it arises from something.

original: de'i phyir nus pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu nus pa'i rang bzhin du yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir nus pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu nus pa'i rang bzhin du yod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the effect, which has the nature of potentiality, exists from a potential cause.

original: skyed par byed pa nyid ni nges pas khyab po //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa nyid ni nges pas khyab po //
translated: The definition of being a producer is certain.

original: 'bras bu med na ni khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba nges pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu med na ni khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba nges pa med pa yin no //
translated: If there is no effect, then there is no certainty of the pervasion that is contradictory with the pervader.

original: des 'bras bu med pa la nges pa'i skyed par byed pa ldog pas 'bras bu'i bdag nyid khyab par 'gyur bas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so zhe na /
analyzed: des 'bras bu med pa la nges pa'i skyed par byed pa ldog pas 'bras bu'i bdag nyid khyab par 'gyur bas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so zhe na /
translated: Since the producer is ascertained to be without an effect, it is pervaded by the nature of an effect. Therefore, it is a reason of nature.

original: de 'dra ba snang ba'i dngos po yod pa ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: de 'dra ba snang ba'i dngos po yod pa ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: A thing that appears in that way does not exist as an object of inference.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad pa / gal te yod pa yin na ni bltar rung ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te yod pa yin na ni bltar rung ba nyid yin te /
translated: It is said: If it exists, then it is suitable to be seen.

original: dper na dbus kyi gnas skabs na de'i rang bzhin bltar rung ba yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dbus kyi gnas skabs na de'i rang bzhin bltar rung ba yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the nature of the middle that is suitable to be seen.

original: 'on te de'i bltar rung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin btang ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te de'i bltar rung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin btang ba yin gyi /
translated: But if the nature that is characterized by being suitable to be seen is relinquished,

original: dngos po gtan zhig pa'i ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po gtan zhig pa'i ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then the thing is not completely destroyed.

original: de lta na ni 'o na de'i mtshan nyid btang pa nyid 'jig pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na de'i mtshan nyid btang pa nyid 'jig pa yin la /
translated: If that is so, then the characteristic is relinquished and it is destroyed.

original: mtshan nyid gzhan dang ldan pa dang dngos po gzhan yin te pha rol nyid yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan dang ldan pa dang dngos po gzhan yin te pha rol nyid yin no //
translated: It has a different characteristic and is a different thing, because it is other.

original: tha dad pa ni 'gal ba'i chos kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni 'gal ba'i chos kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Difference is the nature of contradictory properties.

original: 'dir rang bzhin gcig nyid yod pa dang med pa'i 'gal ba yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rang bzhin gcig nyid yod pa dang med pa'i 'gal ba yod pa yin no //
translated: Here, the contradiction of existence and nonexistence is in the case of a single nature.

original: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa nyid tha dad pa yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa nyid tha dad pa yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained that having contradictory properties is difference.

original: nges pa skyed byed yin @63b par mthong ba'i phyir 'bras bu'i bdag nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nges pa skyed byed yin @63b par mthong ba'i phyir 'bras bu'i bdag nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the nature of the effect because it is seen to generate ascertainment,

original: bshad zin to zhe na /
analyzed: bshad zin to zhe na /
translated: we have already explained this.

original: bshad pa / 'bras bu rgyu de las skyes bas ni 'bras bu'i rgyu de 'bras bu de skyed pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / 'bras bu rgyu de las skyes bas ni 'bras bu'i rgyu de 'bras bu de skyed pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: We respond: The effect arises from the cause, and the cause of the effect is the nature of the cause of the effect.

original: 'di nyid de skyes par nus kyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes 'grub kyi /
analyzed: 'di nyid de skyes par nus kyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes 'grub kyi /
translated: This is established as the ability to produce that, but not another.

original: de'i ngo bor te 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bor te 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the nature of the effect.

original: gal te 'bras bu rgyu la med pa las skye ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu rgyu la med pa las skye ba yin no //
translated: If the effect arises from the cause, it arises from what does not exist in the cause.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir 'o ma las ri bong gi rva yang mi skye /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir 'o ma las ri bong gi rva yang mi skye /
translated: Why then does a rabbit‚Äôs horn not arise from milk?

original: de bzhin du skye ba'i chos can gyi myu gu ci'i phyir mi skye ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba'i chos can gyi myu gu ci'i phyir mi skye ste /
translated: And why does a sprout, which has the property of arising, not arise?

original: 'o ma la ni zho dang ri bong gi rva dang myu gu yang med ba yin te /
analyzed: 'o ma la ni zho dang ri bong gi rva dang myu gu yang med ba yin te /
translated: Milk does not have curd, a rabbit‚Äôs horn, or a sprout.

original: des na med do cog skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na med do cog skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, everything that does not exist would arise.

original: khyad par ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni med par khyad par med pa la myu gu dang ri bong gi rva dag las zho la khyad par cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni med par khyad par med pa la myu gu dang ri bong gi rva dag las zho la khyad par cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is the difference? There is no difference in the nonexistence of curd and a rabbit‚Äôs horn. There is not the slightest difference between a sprout and a rabbit‚Äôs horn.

original: dngos po ni dngos po las khyad par du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dngos po ni dngos po las khyad par du 'gyur gyi /
translated: An existent is different from an existent,

original: dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pa las ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pa las ma yin te /
translated: but a non-existent is not different from a non-existent.

original: khyad par ni ngo bo'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ni ngo bo'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because a difference has the nature of an entity.

original: de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin no //
translated: That is not so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rgyu'i rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of the cause is different.

original: med pa'i phyir 'bras bu phan tshun tha dad pa ma yin du zin kyang yod pa'i rgyu khyad par med par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir 'bras bu phan tshun tha dad pa ma yin du zin kyang yod pa'i rgyu khyad par med par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, even though the effects are not different from each other, how could the causes that exist be undifferentiated?

original: mdor gzhag ba'i ngag 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni ;
analyzed: mdor gzhag ba'i ngag 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni ;
translated: The following verse comments on this brief statement:

original: 'o ma zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'o ma zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúmilk‚Äù

original: 'bras bu de'i bdag nyid ma yin yang gang zhig zho skyed par byed kyi ri bong gi rva ni ma yin pa'i rang bzhin de nyid de la yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu de'i bdag nyid ma yin yang gang zhig zho skyed par byed kyi ri bong gi rva ni ma yin pa'i rang bzhin de nyid de la yod pa yin no //
translated: is the nature of that which produces curd, not the nature of a rabbit‚Äôs horns.

original: gal te 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin khyad par du 'gyur ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin khyad par du 'gyur ba ma yin na /
translated: If the nature of the effect were not differentiated,

original: 'o na de ga las yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de ga las yin zhe na /
translated: then from what would it arise?üîΩThe explanation is:

original: bshad pa ; rang gi rgyus skyed pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa ; rang gi rgyus skyed pa ste /
translated: It is produced by its own cause.

original: bskyed pa gang yin pa'i khyad par de nyid rang gi rgyus bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: bskyed pa gang yin pa'i khyad par de nyid rang gi rgyus bskyed pa yin no //
translated: That very differentiation which is produced is produced by its own cause.

original: gang la de 'dra ba'i rgyu med pa de ni rang bzhin de 'dra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la de 'dra ba'i rgyu med pa de ni rang bzhin de 'dra ba ma yin no //
translated: That which does not have such a cause does not have such a nature.

original: de ltar de rnam pa de ltar rgyu'i rang bzhin thog ma med do //
analyzed: de ltar de rnam pa de ltar rgyu'i rang bzhin thog ma med do //
translated: Thus, it has no such causal nature from the beginning.

original: sngon gyi tshig med pa brgyud pa rgyun chags pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi tshig med pa brgyud pa rgyun chags pa yin no //
translated: The lineage of the past words is uninterrupted.

original: de'i phyir de yang ga las zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa'i skabs med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang ga las zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa'i skabs med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no occasion for the dispute, ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: rgyu brgyud pa thog ma med pa de'i phyir ri bong gi rva skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva mi skye la /
analyzed: rgyu brgyud pa thog ma med pa de'i phyir ri bong gi rva skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva mi skye la /
translated: Since the beginningless causal lineage is the cause of the production of rabbit horns, rabbit horns do not arise because there is no cause that has the nature of producing rabbit horns.

original: zho skyed pa'i rang bzhin la ni rgyu yod pa'i phyir zho skye ba yin no //
analyzed: zho skyed pa'i rang bzhin la ni rgyu yod pa'i phyir zho skye ba yin no //
translated: Since there is a cause that has the nature of producing milk, milk arises.

original: des na de ltar 'gal ba'i rang bzhin @64a * //
analyzed: des na de ltar 'gal ba'i rang bzhin @64a * //
translated: Thus, the two incompatible natures

original: gnyis rgyu gcig las skye ba 'am /
analyzed: gnyis rgyu gcig las skye ba 'am /
translated: do not arise from a single cause.

original: rgyu med pa bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med pa bsal ba yin no //
translated: Or, the absence of a cause is eliminated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyis bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyis bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the producer of an effect that is produced by another is not another.

original: gang yang 'di mi nus pa las mi 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu las 'bras bu nus pa'i rang bzhin du yod do zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: gang yang 'di mi nus pa las mi 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu las 'bras bu nus pa'i rang bzhin du yod do zhes bya ba de la /
translated: Also, someone says: Since an effect does not arise from what is incapable, an effect exists as a nature that is capable in the cause.

original: 'o ma la zho'i nus ba 'di ci zhig ci zho las gzhan yin nam 'on te zho nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'o ma la zho'i nus ba 'di ci zhig ci zho las gzhan yin nam 'on te zho nyid yin te /
translated: Is the potency of milk for curd something other than curd, or is it curd itself?

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid yin na ni zho ci lta ba de bzhin du de yang dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid yin na ni zho ci lta ba de bzhin du de yang dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is its very nature, then just as curd is perceived, so it would be perceived.

original: nus pa ni zho de las khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩkhyad par yod na yang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa ni dngos po gzhan nyid do zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: nus pa ni zho de las khyad par med pa'i phyir ro // khyad par yod na yang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa ni dngos po gzhan nyid do zhes bshad zin to //
translated: Because the potency is not different from the curd.üîΩIf there is a difference, then it is a different thing, since it is not similar in nature.

original: gzhan nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is different,

original: ci ltar nus pa gzhan yod na de yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ltar nus pa gzhan yod na de yod par 'gyur te /
translated: how could it exist if the other potency exists?

original: skyes bu yod na gtso bo yod par rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu yod na gtso bo yod par rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the existence of a person is understood when the existence of a principle is understood.

original: 'jig rten na rgyu yod na 'bras bu yod do zhes brjod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten na rgyu yod na 'bras bu yod do zhes brjod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it said in the world that when a cause exists, its effect exists?

original: bshad pa / rung ba'i rgyu las 'bras bu nye bar btags pa sgro btags pa tsam du ni 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bshad pa / rung ba'i rgyu las 'bras bu nye bar btags pa sgro btags pa tsam du ni 'gyur gyi /
translated: We say that the effect is merely imputed to exist in dependence on a suitable cause. It is a mere superimposition.

original: dngos po nyid du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po nyid du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a real thing.

original: nye bar btags pa ni 'dir yang mi bzlogs pas 'di ni cung zad kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar btags pa ni 'dir yang mi bzlogs pas 'di ni cung zad kyang ma yin no //
translated: But this is not the case here, so this is not a problem.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu med par bstan pa 'dis ni 'bras bu phyi ma la rgyu yod pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu med par bstan pa 'dis ni 'bras bu phyi ma la rgyu yod pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: This demonstration that the effect does not exist in the cause refutes the existence of the cause in the subsequent effect.

original: phyogs thams cad ni rnam pa bzhis sel ba yin te /
analyzed: phyogs thams cad ni rnam pa bzhis sel ba yin te /
translated: All positions are refuted in four ways.

original: des na chos kyi khyad par bsal ba la sogs pa yang 'di nyid kyis bshad pa yin pas logs shig tu ma brjod do //
analyzed: des na chos kyi khyad par bsal ba la sogs pa yang 'di nyid kyis bshad pa yin pas logs shig tu ma brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the refutation of the distinction of the property of the position, etc., is explained by this alone, so they are not mentioned separately.

original: de ci'i phyir /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ltar phyogs kyi mtshan nyid zhar la bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar phyogs kyi mtshan nyid zhar la bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the characteristics of the position incidentally in this way,

original: phyogs kyi chos kyi rab tu dbye ba sngon du 'gro ba can tshul gsum 'chad pa'i rang bzhin nyid 'chad do //
