original: bshad pa / de gnyis las gcig la yang yod pa gang yin pa de'i nges pa'i sgrub par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / de gnyis las gcig la yang yod pa gang yin pa de'i nges pa'i sgrub par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We reply: Because there is no proof for the existence of the property of the subject in either of the two.

original: 'di dag nyid la yod par 'gyur ro zhes spyir yod par nges pa yin yang de tsam gyis ni 'ga' zhig la rjes su 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: 'di dag nyid la yod par 'gyur ro zhes spyir yod par nges pa yin yang de tsam gyis ni 'ga' zhig la rjes su 'gro ba'am /
translated: Although it is certain that they exist in general, merely that does not entail that they exist in a particular thing.üîΩ

original: 'ga' zhig las ldog par nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig las ldog par nges pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIt exists in these alone‚Äù is the ascertainment of existence in general, but that alone does not ascertain that it exists in some and does not exist in others.

original: gal te gcig la yod par nges pa'i sgrub byed khyad par rab tu bstan pa yin na ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag nges par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te gcig la yod par nges pa'i sgrub byed khyad par rab tu bstan pa yin na ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag nges par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If the proof of the ascertainment of existence in one were to be taught, then the positive and negative concomitances would be ascertained.

original: med pa des na the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: med pa des na the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: But since that is not the case, there is doubt.

original: ci ltar mnyan bya nyid thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir go bar byed pa ma yin pa de ltar lan cig ma yin par brjod zin to //
analyzed: ci ltar mnyan bya nyid thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir go bar byed pa ma yin pa de ltar lan cig ma yin par brjod zin to //
translated: Just as audibility is not a common property, and therefore is not a proof, we have already said many times that it is not a proof.

original: skyes bu gzhan las byung ba ni skyes pa ste /
analyzed: skyes bu gzhan las byung ba ni skyes pa ste /
translated: That which arises from another is produced.

original: de lta ma yin pa ni gzhan las ma byung ba'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin pa ni gzhan las ma byung ba'o //
translated: That which does not arise in that way is not produced.

original: gzhan las ma byung bar nges pa'i mngal gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan las ma byung bar nges pa'i mngal gang yin pa ste /
translated: That which is ascertained as not produced from another is a pot.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i yon tan mtshungs pa skyes bu gang dag la yod pa de dag la ni yon tan mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i yon tan mtshungs pa skyes bu gang dag la yod pa de dag la ni yon tan mtshungs pa ste /
translated: Those who have the same qualities as the one who has these qualities are called those who have the same qualities.

original: yon tan ni gzugs dang / lang cho dang / bud med la mngal 'jog pa'i nus pa dang chags pa can nyid do //üîΩde dag las srid pa'i bud med kyi mngal te /
analyzed: yon tan ni gzugs dang / lang cho dang / bud med la mngal 'jog pa'i nus pa dang chags pa can nyid do // de dag las srid pa'i bud med kyi mngal te /
translated: The qualities are form, beauty, and the ability to place the embryo in the womb of a woman and be attached to her.üîΩThe womb of a woman in the world is the womb of a woman in the world.

original: mngal 'di ni 'di gnyis gang rung zhig gis byas pa yin no zhes rtogs par byed pa'i skyes bu gzhan rnams la the tshom skyed par byed do //
analyzed: mngal 'di ni 'di gnyis gang rung zhig gis byas pa yin no zhes rtogs par byed pa'i skyes bu gzhan rnams la the tshom skyed par byed do //
translated: Other people who know this are caused to doubt which of these two created this womb.

original: 'di ltar ma la de gzhan gyis byas pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma la de gzhan gyis byas pa ni ma yin la /
translated: It is not created by another, the mother.

original: de gnyis kyang mngal 'jog pa la yon tan thams cad mtshungs pa yin pas des na the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyang mngal 'jog pa la yon tan thams cad mtshungs pa yin pas des na the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: Since both have the same qualities in placing the embryo in the womb, they doubt it.

original: de las gzhan las byung ba bkag pas mngal gnyis po de dang nges par 'brel pa nyid dang / yon tan mtshungs pa'i phyir gnyis las gcig la yang nges pa med par smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan las byung ba bkag pas mngal gnyis po de dang nges par 'brel pa nyid dang / yon tan mtshungs pa'i phyir gnyis las gcig la yang nges pa med par smras pa yin no //
translated: Since it is refuted that it arises from another, it is definitely related to those two, and since it is similar to the quality, it is said that there is no certainty even in one of the two.

original: des na don 'ga' zhig la yang gnyis po dang 'brel pa nyid dang / gcig la nges pa med pa the tshom gyi rgyu yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na don 'ga' zhig la yang gnyis po dang 'brel pa nyid dang / gcig la nges pa med pa the tshom gyi rgyu yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the relation to both and the lack of certainty in one are the causes of doubt, but not anything else.üîΩThis very point is stated by the master.

original: don @70b 'di nyid slob dpon gyis gsungs te /
analyzed: don @70b 'di nyid slob dpon gyis gsungs te /
translated: As it is said:

original: ci skad du sgrub par byed pa'i chos can gyis thun mong ma yin pa de ni khyad par ci snyed kyis te /
analyzed: ci skad du sgrub par byed pa'i chos can gyis thun mong ma yin pa de ni khyad par ci snyed kyis te /
translated: That uncommon subject which is to be established is by however many distinctions,

original: rnam pa'i dbye ba ci snyed kyis don thams cad bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa'i dbye ba ci snyed kyis don thams cad bsdus pa ste /
translated: by however many divisions of aspects, all objects are included.

original: thams cad sdud par bya ba'i rnam pa'i khyad par de la the tshom za ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: thams cad sdud par bya ba'i rnam pa'i khyad par de la the tshom za ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: That distinction of aspects which includes everything is the cause of doubt.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dang ldan pa ste thun mong ma yin pa dang ldan pa nges zhes bya ba thams cad sdud pa'i khyad par des bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ste thun mong ma yin pa dang ldan pa nges zhes bya ba thams cad sdud pa'i khyad par des bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which possesses that, i.e., that which possesses the uncommon, is ascertained. Because of that particular inclusion, all are included.

original: gang gi khyad par gyis thams cad bsdus pa de tsam gyis ni the tshom gyi rgyu ma yin pas na gtan tshigs gnyis pa smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi khyad par gyis thams cad bsdus pa de tsam gyis ni the tshom gyi rgyu ma yin pas na gtan tshigs gnyis pa smras pa /
translated: That particular inclusion by which all are included is just that much, and is not a cause of doubt. Therefore, the second reason is stated:

original: gcig tu nges pa zhes bya ba gcig la gdon mi za bar ldog pa'i phyir te med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu nges pa zhes bya ba gcig la gdon mi za bar ldog pa'i phyir te med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is ascertained as one, because of the exclusion of one without a doubt, i.e., because of non-existence.

original: gtan tshigs snga ma'i don bshad pa /
analyzed: gtan tshigs snga ma'i don bshad pa /
translated: The meaning of the former reason is explained:

original: de dang ldan pa des bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam pa'i bye brag dag las phyi rol du gyur pa'i don gang la dngos po'i chos thun mong ma yin pa 'di gnas par 'gyur ba rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i khyad par dag las phyi rol du gyur pa de med par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa des bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam pa'i bye brag dag las phyi rol du gyur pa'i don gang la dngos po'i chos thun mong ma yin pa 'di gnas par 'gyur ba rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i khyad par dag las phyi rol du gyur pa de med par bshad pa yin no //
translated: That which possesses that, i.e., that which is included by that, is ascertained. This explains that the object which is external to the distinctions of mode, in which this uncommon property of entity is located, is non-existent, external to the distinctions of mode of permanence and impermanence.

original: phyi rol du gyur pa gsum pa'i rten yod na ni rnam pa gnyis la the tshom skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol du gyur pa gsum pa'i rten yod na ni rnam pa gnyis la the tshom skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were a third basis, then doubt would not arise with regard to the two.

original: gnyi ga'i cha la dmigs pa'i the tshom ni mi rtag pa ma yin na ni gdon mi za bar rtag pa yin la /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i cha la dmigs pa'i the tshom ni mi rtag pa ma yin na ni gdon mi za bar rtag pa yin la /
translated: When there is doubt that has both aspects as its object, then if it is not impermanent, it must be permanent;

original: rtag pa ma yin na yang gdon mi za bar 'di ni mi rtag pa yin no zhes rnam grangs kyi sgo nas don gcig nyid nges par 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa ma yin na yang gdon mi za bar 'di ni mi rtag pa yin no zhes rnam grangs kyi sgo nas don gcig nyid nges par 'jog pa yin no //
translated: and if it is not permanent, it must be impermanent. Thus, through the process of elimination, it is determined that the object is just one thing.

original: gang du rnam grangs gzhan med kyang rnam grangs gzhan nges par 'jog pa ma yin pa de ni the tshom ma yin te /
analyzed: gang du rnam grangs gzhan med kyang rnam grangs gzhan nges par 'jog pa ma yin pa de ni the tshom ma yin te /
translated: But when there is no other process of elimination, and it is not determined that the object is something else, then that is not doubt.

original: 'on kyang de ni ma rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni ma rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: Rather, it is just a lack of understanding.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsum pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsum pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: That is why it is called a third.

original: khyad par ci snyed kyis zhes bya bas ni phan tshun spangs pas gnas pa'i rnam pa gnyis nyid the tshom gyi yul du bshad pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: khyad par ci snyed kyis zhes bya bas ni phan tshun spangs pas gnas pa'i rnam pa gnyis nyid the tshom gyi yul du bshad pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúto whatever extent there are distinctions‚Äù shows that doubt has as its object just the two aspects that are mutually exclusive.

original: rnam pa gnyis nyid gcig btang na gnyis pa nges par 'thob pa yin gyi rnam pa lnga 'am drug yongs su bzung na ni de dag las gcig btang ba na gnyis pa 'ga' zhig kyang nges par 'thob ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis nyid gcig btang na gnyis pa nges par 'thob pa yin gyi rnam pa lnga 'am drug yongs su bzung na ni de dag las gcig btang ba na gnyis pa 'ga' zhig kyang nges par 'thob ba ma yin te /
translated: If one of the two modes is given up, then the other mode is definitely obtained. But if one holds to five or six modes, then when one of them is given up, the other is not definitely obtained.

original: rnam pa lnga skabs su bab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'ga' @71a * //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga skabs su bab pa yin pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'ga' @71a * //
translated: Because the five modes are the ones that are appropriate.

original: zhig gi skabs su brjod pa'i gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: zhig gi skabs su brjod pa'i gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa'am /
translated: Moreover, in the context of a probandum, a reason is either common or not common.

original: cig shos su bsam par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: cig shos su bsam par bya ba yin no //
translated: The other is to be considered.

original: de la yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos las bzlog pas thams cad phung po gnyis pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos las bzlog pas thams cad phung po gnyis pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And there, because all are twofold in terms of the opposite of the probandum,

original: rnam pa gnyis nyid thams cad sdud par srid pa yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis nyid thams cad sdud par srid pa yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //
translated: it is reasonable to say that it is possible that all two modes are included.

original: gtan tshigs gnyis pa bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gnyis pa bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the second reason is explained.

original: gcig tu nges pa ldog par ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: gcig tu nges pa ldog par ni zhes smos so //
translated: The words ‚Äúin the case of a single determination‚Äù are stated.

original: 'dis ni rtag pa'am mi rtag pa'i phung po gcig la rtogs pa'i tshad ma med par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rtag pa'am mi rtag pa'i phung po gcig la rtogs pa'i tshad ma med par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains that there is no valid cognition that comprehends a single permanent or impermanent aggregate.

original: ci'i phyir gtan tshigs 'di gnyis thun thun mong ma yin pa the tshom gyi sgrub byed du brjod kyi gcig ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gtan tshigs 'di gnyis thun thun mong ma yin pa the tshom gyi sgrub byed du brjod kyi gcig ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are these two reasons stated as the proof of doubt, but not one?

original: bshad pa / gang gi phyir gtan tshigs gnyis po 'di thun mong ma yin pa'i chos gcig la bsdus pas ni thun mong ma yin pa'i rten gyi dngos po'i rnam pa'i khyad par la the tshom za ba yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / gang gi phyir gtan tshigs gnyis po 'di thun mong ma yin pa'i chos gcig la bsdus pas ni thun mong ma yin pa'i rten gyi dngos po'i rnam pa'i khyad par la the tshom za ba yin te /
translated: It is said: Because these two reasons are subsumed in a single uncommon property, there is doubt about the specific aspect of the uncommon basis.

original: de'i phyir gnyis brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, two are stated.

original: the tshom gyi dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: the tshom gyi dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because all two types of objects of doubt are subsumed.

original: khyab pa'i phyir na chos can la gnas pa ni de gnyis dang 'brel pa yin la /
analyzed: khyab pa'i phyir na chos can la gnas pa ni de gnyis dang 'brel pa yin la /
translated: Because it pervades, the property of the subject is related to those two.

original: gcig la rtogs pa'i sgrub par byed pas ni de dag la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par the tshom za bas the tshom gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga chos gcig la bsdu ba la ltos par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gcig la rtogs pa'i sgrub par byed pas ni de dag la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par the tshom za bas the tshom gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga chos gcig la bsdu ba la ltos par bya ba yin no //
translated: Since one is uncertain about the presence and absence of the other, it is the cause of doubt. Therefore, both are to be included in a single property.

original: de ltar na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la the tshom za bas the tshom gyi rgyu yin no //üîΩldog pa nges par rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni 'ga' zhig pas ldog pa des na thun mong ma yin pa'i khyad par rang la yod pa'i yul la gang las ldog par nges pa de rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs nyid yin pa gang gis
analyzed: de ltar na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la the tshom za bas the tshom gyi rgyu yin no // ldog pa nges par rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni 'ga' zhig pas ldog pa des na thun mong ma yin pa'i khyad par rang la yod pa'i yul la gang las ldog par nges pa de rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs nyid yin pa gang gis
translated: Thus, since one is uncertain about the presence and absence of the other, it is the cause of doubt.üîΩAs for the statement that the absence is ascertained to be the cause, it is explained in the second chapter that the absence is the cause of the exclusion of the other.

original: bzlog ces kho bos le'u gnyis par bshad zin to //
analyzed: bzlog ces kho bos le'u gnyis par bshad zin to //
translated: Therefore, the absence that is the cause of the exclusion of the other is the reason for the exclusion of the other.

original: gcig rnam par gcad pa nyid gnas pa yin pa'i phyir mnyan bya nyid go byed du 'gyur ro//
analyzed: gcig rnam par gcad pa nyid gnas pa yin pa'i phyir mnyan bya nyid go byed du 'gyur ro//
translated: Since the exclusion of one thing is the presence of another, audibility becomes the indicator of impermanence.üîΩSince the exclusion of one thing is the presence of another, audibility becomes the indicator of impermanence.

original: de'i phyir thun mong ba bzhin du thun mong ma yin pa yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid kyis the tshom gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir thun mong ba bzhin du thun mong ma yin pa yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid kyis the tshom gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, like the common reason, the uncommon reason is also a cause of doubt because of the doubt about the presence and absence of the reason in similar and dissimilar cases.

original: 'dis ni thun mong ma yin pa ma rtogs pa'i rgyu yin gyi the tshom gyi rgyu yin no zhes gang brjod pa de yang bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni thun mong ma yin pa ma rtogs pa'i rgyu yin gyi the tshom gyi rgyu yin no zhes gang brjod pa de yang bsal ba yin no //
translated: This also eliminates the claim that the uncommon reason is a cause of doubt, not a cause of non-understanding.

original: phyogs kyi chos nges @71b pa mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la yod pa dang med par the tshom za ba tsam gyis ci ltar ma nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos nges @71b pa mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la yod pa dang med par the tshom za ba tsam gyis ci ltar ma nges par 'gyur te /
translated: How can a reason be inconclusive merely by the doubt about the presence and absence of the property of the position in similar and dissimilar cases?

original: gang gi phyir nges pa'i gtan tshigs rab tu sbyar ba la yang smra ba po tshul gsum bsgrub pa la spobs pa med pa'i phyir rtogs pa po the tshom du 'gyur na de tsam gyis nges pa'i gtan tshigs de yang gcig tu nges par te nges pa kho
analyzed: gang gi phyir nges pa'i gtan tshigs rab tu sbyar ba la yang smra ba po tshul gsum bsgrub pa la spobs pa med pa'i phyir rtogs pa po the tshom du 'gyur na de tsam gyis nges pa'i gtan tshigs de yang gcig tu nges par te nges pa kho
translated: For, even when a definite reason is employed, if the speaker lacks confidence in establishing the three modes, the listener will doubt. But merely that much does not make the definite reason inconclusive. It is only definite.

original: na ma nges pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: na ma nges pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not inconclusive.

original: de ltar re zhig tshul gsum ma bsgrubs pa'i phyir rtogs pa po'i the tshom gyi rgyu yin pas ma nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig tshul gsum ma bsgrubs pa'i phyir rtogs pa po'i the tshom gyi rgyu yin pas ma nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because the three modes are not established in this way, it is a cause of doubt for the one who understands. Therefore, it is indefinite.

original: don dam par ni de yang dag pa'i gtan tshigs nyid yin no ;
analyzed: don dam par ni de yang dag pa'i gtan tshigs nyid yin no ;
translated: But in the ultimate, it is a correct reason.

original: de'i phyir ma nges pa nyid de'i ngo bo nges pa gang la yod pa'i phyogs kyi chos de ni ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma nges pa nyid de'i ngo bo nges pa gang la yod pa'i phyogs kyi chos de ni ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is indefinite. The property of the subject that has the nature of that is indefinite.

original: de'i ngo bo nges pa de yang gang las shen /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nges pa de yang gang las shen /
translated: From what is that nature of that ascertained?

original: bshad pa / bstan pa brjod pa'i yon tan te ma nges pa'i chos nges pa nyid las yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / bstan pa brjod pa'i yon tan te ma nges pa'i chos nges pa nyid las yin te /
translated: It is said: The quality of stating what is expressed is ascertained from the nature of the indefinite property.

original: rgyu gzhan las ni ma yin no //üîΩthun mong ba la ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la yod pa ma nges pa'i yon tan yin la /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan las ni ma yin no // thun mong ba la ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la yod pa ma nges pa'i yon tan yin la /
translated: It is not from another cause.üîΩIn the common, the quality of the indefinite property existing in the similar and dissimilar is a quality.

original: thun mong ma yin pa la ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la med pa yon tan yin no //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa la ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la med pa yon tan yin no //
translated: In the uncommon, the quality of the indefinite property not existing in the similar and dissimilar is a quality.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la the tshom za ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gzhi dag la the tshom za ba de nyid yon tan yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la the tshom za ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gzhi dag la the tshom za ba de nyid yon tan yin no //
translated: The doubt about the presence and absence is the doubt about the property of the similar instances and the doubt about the property of the dissimilar instances.

original: the tshom za ba ji ltar nges pa yin zhes de snyam ni bsam par mi bya ste /
analyzed: the tshom za ba ji ltar nges pa yin zhes de snyam ni bsam par mi bya ste /
translated: How can doubt be ascertained?

original: gang gi phyir gal te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag la the tshom za bar tshad mas 'thad pa yin na de'i tshe rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag la the tshom za ba nyid du nges par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gal te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag la the tshom za bar tshad mas 'thad pa yin na de'i tshe rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag la the tshom za ba nyid du nges par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If the doubt about the presence and absence is established by a valid cognition, then at that time the doubt about the presence and absence is ascertained.

original: de'i phyir ma nges pa thams cad la yon tan du brjod pa gang yin pa de thams cad nges par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma nges pa thams cad la yon tan du brjod pa gang yin pa de thams cad nges par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, all the statements about the qualities of the uncertain are ascertained.

original: des na ngo bo nyid nges pa med par yod pa dang med par the tshom yod pa de tsam gyis ni ma nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na ngo bo nyid nges pa med par yod pa dang med par the tshom yod pa de tsam gyis ni ma nges pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the mere existence of doubt about existence and non-existence without ascertaining the nature is not uncertain.

original: gtan tshigs kyang ma nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyang ma nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because even the reason would be uncertain.

original: cig shos kyi skyon 'ga' zhig ni dngos po'i yin gzhan ni smra ba po'i nyes pa yin no //üîΩdes na gal te yang dag pa'i gtan tshigs dngos po skyon med yin yang smra ba po des rang bzhin ji 'dra bar bstan pa'i the tshom @72a * //
analyzed: cig shos kyi skyon 'ga' zhig ni dngos po'i yin gzhan ni smra ba po'i nyes pa yin no // des na gal te yang dag pa'i gtan tshigs dngos po skyon med yin yang smra ba po des rang bzhin ji 'dra bar bstan pa'i the tshom @72a * //
translated: The fault of the other is that of the thing itself, while the other is the fault of the speaker.

original: za ba de'i rang bzhin gyis the tshom gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: za ba de'i rang bzhin gyis the tshom gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, even if the correct reason is a faultless thing, if the speaker has doubt about the nature of the teaching, then the nature of that doubt is the cause of doubt.

original: de'i phyir dngos po'i skyon gyis kyang skyon can du 'gyur la gtan tshigs ston par byed pa'i skyon gyis kyang rang bzhin ma nges pa'i skyon can du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po'i skyon gyis kyang skyon can du 'gyur la gtan tshigs ston par byed pa'i skyon gyis kyang rang bzhin ma nges pa'i skyon can du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is shown that the fault of the thing itself is also a fault, and the fault of the speaker who presents the reason is also a fault of uncertain nature.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par dngos po'i chos ni ngo bo ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag par dngos po'i chos ni ngo bo ste /
translated: In inference for the sake of others, the property of the subject is the nature.

original: gtan tshigs nyid do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs nyid do //
translated: It is the reason itself.

original: de nyid la brten nas so //üîΩ'dir smra ba po ni ston par byed pa'i dbang du byas pa yin la /
analyzed: de nyid la brten nas so // 'dir smra ba po ni ston par byed pa'i dbang du byas pa yin la /
translated: It is based on that.üîΩHere, the speaker is considered the presenter.

original: gtan tshigs ni gsal bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni gsal bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The reason is what is to be made clear.

original: de la dngos po la phyin ci log na de'i rgyu mtshan gyis sgrub pa'i skyon brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: de la dngos po la phyin ci log na de'i rgyu mtshan gyis sgrub pa'i skyon brjod pa yin la /
translated: If the reason is erroneous with respect to the property, then the fault of the proof is stated.

original: smra ba pos phyin ci log tu bstan na ni smra ba po'i spobs pa'i skyon gyis skyon brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: smra ba pos phyin ci log tu bstan na ni smra ba po'i spobs pa'i skyon gyis skyon brjod pa yin no //
translated: If the proponent teaches erroneously, then the fault of the proponent's eloquence is stated.

original: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni don gyi skyon 'ba' zhig bsam par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni don gyi skyon 'ba' zhig bsam par bya ba yin no //
translated: In an inference for oneself, only the fault of the meaning is to be considered.

original: dpe bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: dpe bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to illustrate this, he says:

original: ci ltar skyes bu'i spobs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis /
analyzed: ci ltar skyes bu'i spobs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis /
translated: Just as the fault of the proponent's eloquenceüîΩis non-concomitance and erroneous concomitance,

original: mtshang ba dang rjes su 'gro ba med pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba phyin ci log pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshang ba dang rjes su 'gro ba med pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba phyin ci log pa bzhin no //
translated: so too is the fault of the reason.

original: skyon 'di dag ni skabs ci lta ba de ltar bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: skyon 'di dag ni skabs ci lta ba de ltar bshad par bya'o //
translated: These faults should be explained according to the context.

original: ji ltar 'di dag smra ba po'i spobs pa'i skyon yin pa de bzhin du ma nges pa 'di yang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di dag smra ba po'i spobs pa'i skyon yin pa de bzhin du ma nges pa 'di yang yin no //
translated: Just as these are faults of the proponent's eloquence, so too is this uncertainty.

original: gal te de lta na 'di la ma tshad ba brjod pa med la rjes su 'gro ba med pa dang phyin ci log tu brjod pa yang med pa des na skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'di la ma tshad ba brjod pa med la rjes su 'gro ba med pa dang phyin ci log tu brjod pa yang med pa des na skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIn this case, there is no fault because there is no expression of an incomplete reason, there is no contradiction, and there is no expression of a mistake,‚Äù

original: ji ltar skyon med de /
analyzed: ji ltar skyon med de /
translated: then how is there no fault?

original: gang gi phyir rgol ba des rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan tshul gsum gang yin pa nges par brjod par bya ba'i yon tan de bzhin du zhes bya ba rtogs pa'i yan lag tshul gsum gyi yon tan ma nges par brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgol ba des rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan tshul gsum gang yin pa nges par brjod par bya ba'i yon tan de bzhin du zhes bya ba rtogs pa'i yan lag tshul gsum gyi yon tan ma nges par brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the opponent must state the reason that is understood by the three modes, just as the quality of the three modes is stated, in the same way, the quality of the three modes that are a branch of understanding is not stated.

original: gtan tshigs kyi skyon nyid de ma nges par gtan tshigs nyid ni the tshom gyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi skyon nyid de ma nges par gtan tshigs nyid ni the tshom gyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the reason is faulty because of being uncertain.

original: 'o na phyogs kyi chos la the tshom za ba dang gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'o na phyogs kyi chos la the tshom za ba dang gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa la zhes bya ba la /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIn the case of doubt about the property of the subject and in the case of the reason being unestablished for either of the two parties,‚Äù

original: dngos po'i de kho na la skyon med pa yin yang rgol ba rang phyir rgol ba gnyis the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa nyid dam /
analyzed: dngos po'i de kho na la skyon med pa yin yang rgol ba rang phyir rgol ba gnyis the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa nyid dam /
translated: then although there is no fault in the reality of things, the opponent has doubt about the reason, and it is not established for either of the two parties.

original: gang yang rung ba la ma grub par brjod pa sun 'byin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba la ma grub par brjod pa sun 'byin par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is a refutation that expresses the nonestablishment of something in regard to something.üîΩ

original: mig gis gzung ba la sogs pa gnyi ga la ma grub pa ni dngos po la yang skyon can yin pa'i phyir de ma smos so //
analyzed: mig gis gzung ba la sogs pa gnyi ga la ma grub pa ni dngos po la yang skyon can yin pa'i phyir de ma smos so //
translated: The fault of not being established in regard to either party is not mentioned, because it is a fault in regard to the thing itself.

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is as follows:

original: 'gal bas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i don phyin ci log tu sgrub @72b par byed pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'gal bas ni bsgrub par bya ba'i don phyin ci log tu sgrub @72b par byed pa'i phyir la /
translated: Since contradiction establishes the opposite of the intended meaning,

original: ma nges pas ni bsgrub pa'i don gyis nges pa phyin ci log the tshom sgrub par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: ma nges pas ni bsgrub pa'i don gyis nges pa phyin ci log the tshom sgrub par byed pa yin na /
translated: and since uncertainty establishes the opposite of the certainty of the intended meaning,

original: the tshom za ba dang gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa la ni don nam nges pa 'gal yang phyin ci log tu bsgrubs pa med do //
analyzed: the tshom za ba dang gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa la ni don nam nges pa 'gal yang phyin ci log tu bsgrubs pa med do //
translated: then even if there is contradiction, there is no establishment of the opposite in regard to the doubt or in regard to either party in the case of uncertainty.üîΩFor example, just as the proponent, in order to establish what he wants to prove,

original: dper na rgol bsgrub par byed pa 'dod pa grub par bya ba'i phyir yin pa de bzhin du phyir rgol ba yang de las phyin ci log grub par bya ba'i phyir sun 'byin pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na rgol bsgrub par byed pa 'dod pa grub par bya ba'i phyir yin pa de bzhin du phyir rgol ba yang de las phyin ci log grub par bya ba'i phyir sun 'byin pa yin no zhe na /
translated: so the opponent, in order to establish the opposite of that, is a debater.

original: cig shos kyis smras pa /
analyzed: cig shos kyis smras pa /
translated: The other one says:

original: de ni de lta yin te the tshom za ba dang gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa brjod pa ni sun 'byin par 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni de lta yin te the tshom za ba dang gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa brjod pa ni sun 'byin par 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: That is so, but when one expresses doubt or the nonestablishment of something to someone, one is indeed refuting what the other party wants to prove.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba nges pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba nges pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the other party‚Äôs intended proof is not established.

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is this:

original: sun 'byin pas ni 'dod pa bsgrub bya nges pa'i gags bya ba yin gyi snga ma med pa ni cung zad bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sun 'byin pas ni 'dod pa bsgrub bya nges pa'i gags bya ba yin gyi snga ma med pa ni cung zad bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The refutation is what blocks the other party‚Äôs intended proof, but the mere absence of the former is not a proof of anything.

original: nges pa'i gags ni the tshom za ba dang gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa nyid brjod pas kyang byas pa'i phyir sun 'byin pa nyid do //
analyzed: nges pa'i gags ni the tshom za ba dang gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa nyid brjod pas kyang byas pa'i phyir sun 'byin pa nyid do //
translated: The blocking of the proof is done by expressing doubt or the nonestablishment of something to someone, and so that is the refutation.

original: cig shos kyis gzhan gyi bsam pa ma rig nas /
analyzed: cig shos kyis gzhan gyi bsam pa ma rig nas /
translated: The other party, not understanding the other‚Äôs intention,

original: phyin ci log tu grub pa yang med pa ma yin nam zhes smos so //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu grub pa yang med pa ma yin nam zhes smos so //
translated: says, ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt it the case that there is no refutation of what is already established?‚ÄùüîΩNot only does the opponent‚Äôs proof not become a proof because of the nonestablishment of what is intended,

original: 'dod pa ma grub pa'i phyir rgol pa'i sgrub byed sgrub byed du mi 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: 'dod pa ma grub pa'i phyir rgol pa'i sgrub byed sgrub byed du mi 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: but also

original: phyin ci log grub pa med pa'i phyir rgol ba'i sun 'byin pa yang sun 'byin pa ma yin pa'i phyir na 'dod pa ma grub pa'i phyir sun 'byin pa yin no zhes ci ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: phyin ci log grub pa med pa'i phyir rgol ba'i sun 'byin pa yang sun 'byin pa ma yin pa'i phyir na 'dod pa ma grub pa'i phyir sun 'byin pa yin no zhes ci ltar brjod ce na /
translated: If the opponent‚Äôs refutation is not a refutation because the erroneous is not established, then how can you say, ‚ÄúThe refutation is because the thesis is not established‚Äù?

original: cig shos kyis rang gi bsam pa smras pa /
analyzed: cig shos kyis rang gi bsam pa smras pa /
translated: The other party states his own opinion:

original: phyin ci log tu grub pas ni phyir rgol ba'i tshig sun 'byin pa ma yin no //üîΩ'on kyang pha rol gyi 'dod pa'i gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu grub pas ni phyir rgol ba'i tshig sun 'byin pa ma yin no // 'on kyang pha rol gyi 'dod pa'i gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe opponent‚Äôs words are not refuted by the erroneous.üîΩHowever, the opponent‚Äôs thesis is refuted because it is blocked by the other party‚Äôs thesis.

original: de yang sgrub par byed pa'i nges par byed pa'i nus pa bcom pa'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: de yang sgrub par byed pa'i nges par byed pa'i nus pa bcom pa'i phyir yin no //
translated: Moreover, the opponent‚Äôs thesis is refuted because the opponent‚Äôs proof is destroyed.

original: sun 'byin pa brjod pas snga na med pa cung zad sgrub pa ni ma yin na /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa brjod pas snga na med pa cung zad sgrub pa ni ma yin na /
translated: The statement of the refutation does not establish anything new.

original: 'on kyang bsgrub bya nges pa'i gegs bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bsgrub bya nges pa'i gegs bya ba yin no //
translated: However, the opponent‚Äôs thesis is refuted because it is blocked from ascertaining the probandum.

original: 'gal ba dang ma nges pa brjod pa dag gis ni phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / the tshom skyed pa'i phyir de'i gegs byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'gal ba dang ma nges pa brjod pa dag gis ni phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / the tshom skyed pa'i phyir de'i gegs byed pa yin la /
translated: The statement of contradiction and the statement of the inconclusive refute the opponent‚Äôs thesis because they establish the opposite and generate doubt.

original: ma grub pa'i brjod pas ni sgrub par byed pa'i bsgrub par bya ba la bsgrub par bya bar nges par byed pa'i nus pa 'joms pas gegs byed pa yin te /üîΩgtan tshigs med na nges pa med @73a * //
analyzed: ma grub pa'i brjod pas ni sgrub par byed pa'i bsgrub par bya ba la bsgrub par bya bar nges par byed pa'i nus pa 'joms pas gegs byed pa yin te / gtan tshigs med na nges pa med @73a * //
translated: The expression of nonestablishment is a hindrance because it destroys the power to ascertain the probandum in the proof,

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if there is no reason, there is no ascertainment.

original: gdon mi za bar 'di nyid khas blang bar bya ba yin te /üîΩde lta ma yin na don phyin ci log pa sun 'byin pa'i bsgrub bya yin nam /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'di nyid khas blang bar bya ba yin te / de lta ma yin na don phyin ci log pa sun 'byin pa'i bsgrub bya yin nam /
translated: This must be accepted without doubt.üîΩOtherwise, is the probandum of the refutation the opposite of the object,

original: 'on te nges pa phyin ci log pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te nges pa phyin ci log pa yin /
translated: or is it the opposite of the ascertainment?

original: gal te don phyin ci log yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don phyin ci log yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is the opposite of the object,

original: gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa ma nges pa dag la don phyin ci log yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa ma nges pa dag la don phyin ci log yod pa ma yin no //
translated: then the nonascertainment of the object of comprehension and so on would not have an opposite object.

original: 'on te nges pa phyin ci log pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te nges pa phyin ci log pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is the opposite of the ascertainment,

original: ma nges pa dag la ni nges pa phyin ci log pa'i the tshom yod du chug na /
analyzed: ma nges pa dag la ni nges pa phyin ci log pa'i the tshom yod du chug na /
translated: then nonascertainment may have an opposite ascertainment,

original: 'on kyang mig gis gzung ba nyid la phyin ci log ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'on kyang mig gis gzung ba nyid la phyin ci log ci zhig yod /
translated: but what is the opposite of the ascertainment of what is apprehended by the eye?

original: mig gis gzung ba nyid las ni rtag pa dang mi rtag par the tshom za ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mig gis gzung ba nyid las ni rtag pa dang mi rtag par the tshom za ba ma yin te /
translated: But it is not doubtful whether the eye is permanent or impermanent,

original: sgra dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not related to sound.

original: cig shos kyis smras pa /
analyzed: cig shos kyis smras pa /
translated: The other says:

original: gnyi ga la grub par te grub pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i gtan tshigs gnyi ga la ma grub pa gnyi ga la grub pa med pa ni gtan tshigs nges pa'i phyin ci log pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnyi ga la grub par te grub pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i gtan tshigs gnyi ga la ma grub pa gnyi ga la grub pa med pa ni gtan tshigs nges pa'i phyin ci log pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The reason that is to be proven to both parties, that is, that is to be established for both parties, is not established for both parties. The non-establishment of the reason for both parties is the fallacy of the reason.

original: gal te de lta yin na /üîΩskabs kyis gtan tshigs nges pa 'di la yang phyin ci log pa khyod kyis tshig gis khas blangs pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na / skabs kyis gtan tshigs nges pa 'di la yang phyin ci log pa khyod kyis tshig gis khas blangs pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: If that is so,üîΩthen you have accepted with your own words the fallacy of the reason in this case as well.

original: 'o na ni 'dir yang ste the tshom za ba dang / gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa la yang nges pa nyid du bstan par 'os ba sun 'byin pas ma nges par bstan pa phyin ci log tu grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni 'dir yang ste the tshom za ba dang / gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa la yang nges pa nyid du bstan par 'os ba sun 'byin pas ma nges par bstan pa phyin ci log tu grub pa yin no //
translated: But here also, it is appropriate to teach the certainty of the reason even to one who doubts or to one for whom it is not established in any way. Therefore, your criticism that the teaching of uncertainty is a fallacy is not established.

original: de lta yin dang bsgrub bya nges pa las bzlog pa nges pa med pa ci ste khas mi len te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang bsgrub bya nges pa las bzlog pa nges pa med pa ci ste khas mi len te /
translated: If that is so, then why not accept that the opposite of the definite probandum is indefinite?

original: des na bsgrub bya nges pa las bzlog pa yang yod par brjod par blta'o //
analyzed: des na bsgrub bya nges pa las bzlog pa yang yod par brjod par blta'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be seen that the opposite of the definite probandum is also said to exist.

original: de'i phyir spobs pa med pas rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa la the tshom za ba ni ma nges pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir spobs pa med pas rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa la the tshom za ba ni ma nges pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, when there is doubt about the pervasion and counter-pervasion due to lack of confidence, it is indefinite.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa brjod pa yang phyir rgol ba sun 'byin pa yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa brjod pa yang phyir rgol ba sun 'byin pa yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: And it is established that such expressions are also refutations of the opponent.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba de ni yod pa dang med pa nges pa na rgol ba'i sgrub pa dang / phyir rgol ba dang sun 'byin par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba de ni yod pa dang med pa nges pa na rgol ba'i sgrub pa dang / phyir rgol ba dang sun 'byin par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Because that is so, when the existence and non-existence of the reason are ascertained, it becomes the proof of the proponent and the refutation of the opponent.

original: ma nges pa ni yod pa dang med pa la the tshom du gyur pa na sun 'byin pa yin no //
analyzed: ma nges pa ni yod pa dang med pa la the tshom du gyur pa na sun 'byin pa yin no //
translated: When there is doubt about existence and non-existence, it is a refutation.

original: de dag kyang ci rigs par phyogs kyi chos dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i nges bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang ci rigs par phyogs kyi chos dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i nges bar bya ba yin no //
translated: And these are to be ascertained as the property of the subject, the positive concomitance, and the negative concomitance, respectively.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs kyi chos dgu @73b bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs kyi chos dgu @73b bstan pa ni /
translated: The nine types of property of the subject that exist or do not exist in similar and dissimilar classes are taught.

original: gzhal bya nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs rtag pa la yod pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhal bya nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs rtag pa la yod pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'o //
translated: The property of the subject that exists in the similar class and in the dissimilar class is permanence, which is the property of the subject to be proven in the proof of sound as impermanent.üîΩThe property of the subject that exists in the similar class and does not exist in the dissimilar class is produced, which is the property of the subject to be proven in the proof of sound as impermanent.üîΩThe property of the subject that exists in both ways in the similar class and in the dissimilar class is impermanence, which is the property of the subject to be proven in the proof of sound as produced.

original: byas pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa'o //üîΩmi rtag pa nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs rtsol ba las byung ba la yod pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rnam pa gnyi ga ste /
analyzed: byas pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa'o // mi rtag pa nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs rtsol ba las byung ba la yod pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rnam pa gnyi ga ste /
translated: It exists in the similar class, which is that which arises from exertion, and it exists in the dissimilar class, which is that which does not arise from exertion.

original: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba ma yin pa glog la sogs pa la ni yod pa nam mkha' la sogs pa ni med pa'o //
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba ma yin pa glog la sogs pa la ni yod pa nam mkha' la sogs pa ni med pa'o //
translated: It exists in lightning, etc., and it does not exist in space, etc.

original: rtag pa bsgrub par bya ba la byas pa nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa bsgrub par bya ba la byas pa nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'o //
translated: The property of the subject that does not exist in the similar class and exists in the dissimilar class is produced, which is the property of the subject to be proven in the proof of sound as permanent.

original: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs bdag dang bcas pa la med pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa'o //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs bdag dang bcas pa la med pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa'o //
translated: The presence of life force, etc. is the absence in the similar class, which is endowed with self, and the absence in the dissimilar class.

original: rtsol ba las byung ba nyid ni rtag pa bsgrub par bya ba la mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs bum pa la sogs pa la yod pa glog la sogs pa la med pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyi ga'o ;
analyzed: rtsol ba las byung ba nyid ni rtag pa bsgrub par bya ba la mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs bum pa la sogs pa la yod pa glog la sogs pa la med pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyi ga'o ;
translated: Arising from effort is both kinds, because it is absent in the similar class, which is the probandum, permanence, and it is present in the dissimilar class, such as a pot, but it is absent in lightning, etc.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni rtsol ba las ma byung ba bsgrub par bya ba la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni rtsol ba las ma byung ba bsgrub par bya ba la /
translated: Impermanence is the probandum, not arising from effort.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa la med pa rtsol ba las ma byung ba glog la sogs pa la yod pas mthun pa'i phyogs la gnyi ga mi mthun pa'i phyogs rtsol ba las byung ba mtha' dag la yod pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa la med pa rtsol ba las ma byung ba glog la sogs pa la yod pas mthun pa'i phyogs la gnyi ga mi mthun pa'i phyogs rtsol ba las byung ba mtha' dag la yod pa yin no //
translated: It is absent in space, etc., which are the similar class, but it is present in lightning, etc., which are not arising from effort. Thus, it is both in the similar class and in the dissimilar class.

original: mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub pa na rtsol ba las byung ba nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs la gnyi ga mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub pa na rtsol ba las byung ba nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs la gnyi ga mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa'o //
translated: When establishing impermanence, arising from effort is both in the similar class and absent in the dissimilar class.

original: rtag pa nyid bsgrub pa la reg par bya ba ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi lus can ma yin pa nyid ni rtag pa'i rdul phra rab dag la ni med la /üîΩnam mkha' la sogs pa la ni yod pa'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs la gnyi ga mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi rtag pa bum pa la sogs pa la ni med la /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid bsgrub pa la reg par bya ba ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi lus can ma yin pa nyid ni rtag pa'i rdul phra rab dag la ni med la / nam mkha' la sogs pa la ni yod pa'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs la gnyi ga mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi rtag pa bum pa la sogs pa la ni med la /
translated: The quality of being non-embodiment, which has the characteristic of being intangible, is not a quality of permanent atoms.üîΩBut it is a quality of space, etc. Therefore, the reason is one that is not present in the dissimilar instances.

original: mi rtag pa'i las la yod pa'i phyir na rnam pa gnyi ga yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i las la yod pa'i phyir na rnam pa gnyi ga yin no //
translated: But it is a quality of impermanent karma. Therefore, the reason is one that is present in both the similar and dissimilar instances.

original: 'dis ni phyogs kyi chos bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyogs kyi chos bstan to //
translated: This shows the property of the subject.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ltos nas dbye ba mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ltos nas dbye ba mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to show that it is impossible to divide the reason into two parts in relation to the dissimilar instances, the root text says,

original: dbye ba bya ba la dbye bar bya ba'i ched du me mthun pa'i phyogs la ltos nas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la phyogs kyi chos yod pa 'am med par ji ltar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbye ba bya ba la dbye bar bya ba'i ched du me mthun pa'i phyogs la ltos nas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la phyogs kyi chos yod pa 'am med par ji ltar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúHow could the property of the subject be present or absent in the dissimilar instances?‚Äù The property of the subject cannot be present in the dissimilar instances because the dissimilar instances do not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: me dang ni gzhi ste rten gyi nus pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me dang ni gzhi ste rten gyi nus pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because fire is not a basis, i.e., a substratum, that possesses the potentiality.

original: yod pa ni nus pa dang ldan pa yin @74a * //
analyzed: yod pa ni nus pa dang ldan pa yin @74a * //
translated: But if it exists, it possesses the potentiality,

original: la ; nus pa yang gzhi yin pa'i phyir ci ltar med pa la 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: la ; nus pa yang gzhi yin pa'i phyir ci ltar med pa la 'gyur zhe na /
translated: and since the potentiality is a basis, how can it be nonexistent?

original: rtsod pa 'di ni spangs zin pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rtsod pa 'di ni spangs zin pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: This objection has already been refuted, as has been explained.

original: rtsod pa 'di la med pa la ci ltar 'gog pa de ltar ni bshad zin la /
analyzed: rtsod pa 'di la med pa la ci ltar 'gog pa de ltar ni bshad zin la /
translated: As for this objection, it has been explained how it is that there is no negation of the nonexistent.

original: ji ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni de ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa de ma thag pa kho nar bshad zin to //üîΩmed pa la 'gog pa'i phyir ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa la yang gtan tshigs med pa yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni de ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa de ma thag pa kho nar bshad zin to // med pa la 'gog pa'i phyir ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa la yang gtan tshigs med pa yin la /
translated: And just how the counter-correlate is the characteristic of the non-nonexistent has just been explained.üîΩAs for the negation of the nonexistent, the reason is nonexistent even in the nonexistent counter-correlate.

original: gzhan pa dang 'gal ba dag la yang de ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi mthun phyogs yod pas ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs med pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan pa dang 'gal ba dag la yang de ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi mthun phyogs yod pas ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs med pa yin no //
translated: But in the case of the other and the contradictory, since the counter-correlate exists as the characteristic of the non-nonexistent, the reason is nonexistent in the counter-correlate.

original: rtsod pa gang zhig spro ba'i phyir bshad zin pa 'di yang nye bar bkod pa'i rtsod pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtsod pa gang zhig spro ba'i phyir bshad zin pa 'di yang nye bar bkod pa'i rtsod pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This is also stated in order to generate interest in debate.

original: 'di mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin na zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin na zhes smos so //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is stated in the words, ‚ÄúIf it is the counter-correlate.‚Äù

original: de ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the definition of the other.

original: gzhan pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin na gtan tshigs med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin na gtan tshigs med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the counter-correlate, it follows that there is no reason.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i chos can thams cad bsgrub bya mi rtag pa nyid las chos gzhan mig gis gzung ba nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i chos can thams cad bsgrub bya mi rtag pa nyid las chos gzhan mig gis gzung ba nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all subjects such as pots and so on are endowed with the other, the property to be proven, such as being perceptible by the eye, and so on.

original: chos gcig nyid dang ldan pa ni 'ga' yang mi srid la /
analyzed: chos gcig nyid dang ldan pa ni 'ga' yang mi srid la /
translated: It is impossible for anything to be endowed with just one property.

original: chos tsam la chos gnas pa yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: chos tsam la chos gnas pa yang ma yin gyi /
translated: A mere property does not abide in a property.

original: 'on kyang chos can nyid la yin no ;
analyzed: 'on kyang chos can nyid la yin no ;
translated: However, it is the subject that possesses it.

original: de'i phyir bsgrub bya'i chos las gzhan pa dang ldan pa'i chos can ni gzhan yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub bya'i chos las gzhan pa dang ldan pa'i chos can ni gzhan yin la /
translated: Therefore, the subject that is endowed with the other, the property to be proven, is the other.

original: de nyid kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas mig gis gzung ba nyid dang ldan pa'i bum pa la sogs pa yang gzhan pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur la /
analyzed: de nyid kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas mig gis gzung ba nyid dang ldan pa'i bum pa la sogs pa yang gzhan pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur la /
translated: And since that is the counter-correlate, a pot, etc., which is endowed with what is apprehended by the eye, would also be the counter-correlate.

original: de la zhugs pa'i gtan tshigs kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la zhugs pa'i gtan tshigs kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the reason that engages that would engage the counter-correlate.

original: des na dpe la yod pa'i gtan tshigs thams cad ma nges par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na dpe la yod pa'i gtan tshigs thams cad ma nges par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Therefore, all reasons that exist in the example would be inconclusive.

original: cig shos kyi sgra'i don rnam par gzhag pa la 'jig rten tshad mar mthong nas smras pa /
analyzed: cig shos kyi sgra'i don rnam par gzhag pa la 'jig rten tshad mar mthong nas smras pa /
translated: Seeing that the world is authoritative with regard to the presentation of the meaning of the word ‚Äúother,‚Äù we say:

original: gtan tshigs med par thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs med par thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It does not follow that there is no reason.

original: gang gi phyir bstan bcos byed pa 'jig rten pa'i sgra'i don las 'das nas 'jug pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bstan bcos byed pa 'jig rten pa'i sgra'i don las 'das nas 'jug pa ni ma yin la /
translated: Because the author of the treatise does not engage in transcending the meaning of the word of the world.

original: 'jig rten na skabs kyi chos las chos gzhan dang ldan pa la dgag pa 'jug pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten na skabs kyi chos las chos gzhan dang ldan pa la dgag pa 'jug pa ni med do //
translated: In the world, negation engages the possession of a property that is different from the property under discussion.

original: bram ze ma yin pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bram ze ma yin pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is not the case that there is no such thing as a non-Brahmin.

original: bram ze'i sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan bram ze'i @74b rigs las gzhan pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i skyes bu la bram ze ma yin par brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bram ze'i sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan bram ze'i @74b rigs las gzhan pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i skyes bu la bram ze ma yin par brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The reason for applying the term ‚Äúbrahman‚Äù is not that a person who possesses the qualities of a brahman is called a ‚Äúnon-brahman.‚Äù

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rigs dang ldan pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i rigs dang ldan pa zhes smos so //
translated: Because it says ‚Äúone who possesses that caste.‚Äù

original: gal te bram ze las gzhan pa'i skyes bu la bram ze ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'jug na ni de'i tshe de'i zhes bya ba bram ze'i rigs dang ldan pa'i spyir skyes bu de nyid bram ze yin la /üîΩbram ze las chos gzhan pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir bram ze ma yin pa yang yin no zhes 'jig rten na brjod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te bram ze las gzhan pa'i skyes bu la bram ze ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'jug na ni de'i tshe de'i zhes bya ba bram ze'i rigs dang ldan pa'i spyir skyes bu de nyid bram ze yin la / bram ze las chos gzhan pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir bram ze ma yin pa yang yin no zhes 'jig rten na brjod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the term ‚Äúnon-brahman‚Äù applied to a person who is not a brahman, then at that time the term ‚Äúthat one‚Äù would refer to a person who possesses the caste of a brahman, and he would be a brahman.üîΩBecause he is related to a quality that is different from a brahman, he would also be a non-brahman.

original: gcig po de nyid bram ze ma yin pa dag gis tha snyad byas par rtog pa ni med do //
analyzed: gcig po de nyid bram ze ma yin pa dag gis tha snyad byas par rtog pa ni med do //
translated: But it is not the case that the world would conceive of that very same person as a non-brahman.

original: 'on ci ltar bram ze ma yin pa zhes tha snyad byed par rtogs she na /
analyzed: 'on ci ltar bram ze ma yin pa zhes tha snyad byed par rtogs she na /
translated: How then is it understood that the term ‚Äúnon-brahman‚Äù is used?

original: bshad pa / brjod pa 'dod pa bram ze'i sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan bram ze'i chos kyi gzhi ma yin pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / brjod pa 'dod pa bram ze'i sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan bram ze'i chos kyi gzhi ma yin pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: The reason for applying the term ‚Äúbrahmin‚Äù to one who desires to speak is a thing that is not the basis of the qualities of a brahmin.

original: dgag pa ni gzhan brjod par 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: dgag pa ni gzhan brjod par 'dod pa yin la /
translated: The negation is one who desires to speak about something else.

original: chos gzhan dag kyang bram ze las gzhan ma yin nam /
analyzed: chos gzhan dag kyang bram ze las gzhan ma yin nam /
translated: And aren‚Äôt other qualities also not different from a brahmin?

original: de yang bram ze ma yin par ji ste mi brjod ce na /
analyzed: de yang bram ze ma yin par ji ste mi brjod ce na /
translated: Then why not say that he is not a brahmin?

original: bshad pa / dgag pa'i yul gzhan yin yang brda ni yul rnam par phye nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / dgag pa'i yul gzhan yin yang brda ni yul rnam par phye nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We respond: Even though the object of negation is different, the signifier is applied by distinguishing its object.

original: sgra ni brda dang rjes su mthun par rjod par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sgra ni brda dang rjes su mthun par rjod par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: A word is used in accordance with the signifier.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not follow the nature of things.

original: chos gzhan dang ldan pa tsam la ni dgag pa brdar byas pa yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: chos gzhan dang ldan pa tsam la ni dgag pa brdar byas pa yang ma yin gyi /
translated: The negation is not applied to one who merely possesses other qualities.

original: 'on kyang dgag pa'i bsdu ba tshig phyi ma 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan bram ze nyid bkag nas khyad par can gyi rdzas gzhan la sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dgag pa'i bsdu ba tshig phyi ma 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan bram ze nyid bkag nas khyad par can gyi rdzas gzhan la sbyar ba yin no //
translated: Rather, the negation is applied to a different substance that has a distinguishing feature by excluding brahminhood, which is the reason for applying the subsequent word.

original: des na tshig phyi ma'i 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan spangs nas de bkag pa dang ldan pa gzhan la dgag ba 'jug pa yin no //üîΩde bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sgra yang phyogs kyi sgras brjod par bya ba'i don bsgrub bya dang ldan pa spangs nas gzhan la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: des na tshig phyi ma'i 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan spangs nas de bkag pa dang ldan pa gzhan la dgag ba 'jug pa yin no // de bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sgra yang phyogs kyi sgras brjod par bya ba'i don bsgrub bya dang ldan pa spangs nas gzhan la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, having excluded the reason for the application of the latter term, the application of the negation is to another that possesses the negation.üîΩSimilarly, the term ‚Äúdissimilar‚Äù also applies to another, having excluded the object that is expressed by the term ‚Äúsimilar,‚Äù which possesses the property to be established.

original: mtshan nyid gzhan bstan pa'i shugs kyis kyang de lta bu ni mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ba bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan bstan pa'i shugs kyis kyang de lta bu ni mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ba bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: By the force of teaching another characteristic, in order to eliminate that which is similar,

original: mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe characteristic of the similar class,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang zhig bstan na skabs su bab pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid mi 'gal ba de 'dra ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs su bstan par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gang zhig bstan na skabs su bab pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid mi 'gal ba de 'dra ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs su bstan par bya ba yin na /
translated: If it is taught that which is not contradictory to the characteristic of the similar class that is relevant, then such a thing should be taught as the dissimilar class.

original: 'di lta bu mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'dod na ni mi srid pa zhes bya ba mthun @75a * //
analyzed: 'di lta bu mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'dod na ni mi srid pa zhes bya ba mthun @75a * //
translated: If one asserts that such a thing is the dissimilar class, then it is impossible.

original: pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid 'gal ba yod pa yin na //
analyzed: pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid 'gal ba yod pa yin na //
translated: If there were a contradiction with the characteristic of the similar instance,

original: des na sngar gyi 'jig rten pa'i dbang dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba 'di'i phyir na yang de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs rtogs pa dag ma yin no //
analyzed: des na sngar gyi 'jig rten pa'i dbang dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba 'di'i phyir na yang de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs rtogs pa dag ma yin no //
translated: then there would be a contradiction with the former worldly authority. Therefore, the understanding of the dissimilar instance is not like that.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa ni /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa ni /
translated: In order to demonstrate the contradiction with the characteristic of the similar instance, he says,

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe universal of the property to be established . . .‚Äù

original: dag thams cad rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir na ngag 'di la gal te bsgrub bar bya ba'i chos kyi spyi kho nas mtshungs pa zhes mtshungs pa'i don nges par byed na /
analyzed: dag thams cad rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir na ngag 'di la gal te bsgrub bar bya ba'i chos kyi spyi kho nas mtshungs pa zhes mtshungs pa'i don nges par byed na /
translated: Because the result of this statement is the exclusion of everything, if the meaning of similarity is ascertained as ‚Äúsimilarity by means of the universal of the property to be established alone,‚Äù

original: mthun pa'i phyogs 'ga' yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs 'ga' yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then there would be no similar instance at all.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad pa / rnam pa de lta bu bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'ba' zhig gis mtshungs pa ni 'ga' yang mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bshad pa / rnam pa de lta bu bsgrub par bya ba'i chos 'ba' zhig gis mtshungs pa ni 'ga' yang mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause it is impossible for there to be a similarity by means of the property to be established alone in that way.‚Äù

original: de las gzhan dngos po nyid kyis kyang de mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan dngos po nyid kyis kyang de mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the same by virtue of being an entity, like the other.

original: de'i phyir de ltar nges par gzung pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar nges par gzung pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is not that the property of the subject is ascertained in that way,

original: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyis mtshungs pa nyid gang yin pa'o zhes bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyi dang ma 'brel pa spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyis mtshungs pa nyid gang yin pa'o zhes bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyi dang ma 'brel pa spangs pa yin te /
translated: but rather, it is the mere property of the subject that is similar to the universal of the probandum. This excludes the probandum that is not related to the universal of the probandum.

original: 'di dang ma 'brel ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin no zhes bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di dang ma 'brel ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin no zhes bya ba yin gyi /
translated: That which is not related to this is not a similar instance.

original: chos gzhan dang 'brel pa spong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos gzhan dang 'brel pa spong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it does not exclude being related to another property.

original: de'i phyir phyogs dang 'brel pa'i chos gzhan ma spangs pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyi gang yin pa dang 'brel pa ste bdag nyid dang rjes su 'brel ba'i bum pa la sogs pa de ni phyogs su byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs dang 'brel pa'i chos gzhan ma spangs pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyi gang yin pa dang 'brel pa ste bdag nyid dang rjes su 'brel ba'i bum pa la sogs pa de ni phyogs su byed do //
translated: Therefore, that which is related to the universal of the probandum, which is not excluded as another property related to the subject, and which is related to itself, such as a pot, is taken as the subject.

original: rgyu des na mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba'i sgras chos gzhan dang ldan pa'i gzhan thams cad rtogs pa ni ma yin te /üîΩmthun pa'i phyogs med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu des na mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba'i sgras chos gzhan dang ldan pa'i gzhan thams cad rtogs pa ni ma yin te / mthun pa'i phyogs med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúdissimilar‚Äù does not imply all other things that possess a property other than that.üîΩOtherwise, it would follow, absurdly, that there would be no similar instances.

original: 'on kyang tshig phyi ma 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi chos med pa dang ldan pa'i chos can no //üîΩde'i phyir dgag pa'i bsdu bas skabs su bab pa'i chos dang bral ba gzhan gzung ba'i phyir gzhan pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gzung yang gtan tshigs med par thal ba'i skyon ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang tshig phyi ma 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi chos med pa dang ldan pa'i chos can no // de'i phyir dgag pa'i bsdu bas skabs su bab pa'i chos dang bral ba gzhan gzung ba'i phyir gzhan pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gzung yang gtan tshigs med par thal ba'i skyon ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Rather, it is a subject that possesses the property of the absence of the reason for the application of the subsequent term.üîΩTherefore, because the inclusion of the negation is the subject matter at hand, the dissimilar instance is taken to be that which is devoid of the property in question, and so there is no fault of the reason being nonexistent.

original: 'di ni 'gal ba rnam par gcod par thal ba'i phyir dang / gtan tshigs med par thal ba'i phyir ro zhes kun las btus pa'i gzhung rtogs par byed pa'i t'i ka byed pa rnams ma 'brel par brjod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir nye bar @75b bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'gal ba rnam par gcod par thal ba'i phyir dang / gtan tshigs med par thal ba'i phyir ro zhes kun las btus pa'i gzhung rtogs par byed pa'i t'i ka byed pa rnams ma 'brel par brjod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir nye bar @75b bkod pa yin no //
translated: This is because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be a negation that excludes its contradictory and because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be a reason that is nonexistent.

original: gal te gtan tshigs kyi skabs mdor bsdus nas brjod par 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs kyi skabs mdor bsdus nas brjod par 'dod pa yin na /
translated: If one wishes to state the occasion of the reason in brief,

original: ji tsam zhig la go bar byed ba yod pa de bdag nyid bstan par bya ba'i dgu po 'di dag bstan pas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji tsam zhig la go bar byed ba yod pa de bdag nyid bstan par bya ba'i dgu po 'di dag bstan pas ci bya zhe na /
translated: what is the use of stating these nine parts of the proof, since there is only as much as is necessary to make one understand?

original: phyogs kyi chos bstan pa gnyis ni gtan tshigs yin la gnyis ni 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos bstan pa gnyis ni gtan tshigs yin la gnyis ni 'gal ba yin no //
translated: The two statements of the property of the subject are the reason, and the two are the contradiction.

original: ci'i don du zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i don du zhe na /
translated: For what purpose?

original: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dag grub par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dag grub par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: For the purpose of establishing the nature and the effect.

original: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu ni gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir phyogs kyi chos rnam pa bzhi bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu ni gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir phyogs kyi chos rnam pa bzhi bstan pa yin no //
translated: In order to show that the nature and the effect are the reason and the contradiction, but not the others, the four kinds of property of the subject are stated.

original: khyad par dang spyi'i ni khyad par dang spyi dag ste /
analyzed: khyad par dang spyi'i ni khyad par dang spyi dag ste /
translated: The particular and the general are the particular and the general.

original: thun mong ma yin pa yin pa dang thun mong ba'i phyogs kyi chos te /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa yin pa dang thun mong ba'i phyogs kyi chos te /
translated: The property of the subject that is not common and the property of the subject that is common

original: rtsod pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir nye bar bstan to //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir nye bar bstan to //
translated: are taught because they are the basis of dispute.

original: gzhan dag srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa thun mong ma yin pa ni ldog pa can gyi gtan tshigs su 'dod la /
analyzed: gzhan dag srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa thun mong ma yin pa ni ldog pa can gyi gtan tshigs su 'dod la /
translated: Others assert that the uncommon possession of life force, etc. is the reason for the reversal.

original: gzhal bya nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba can yin na zhes rtsod pa yod do //
analyzed: gzhal bya nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba can yin na zhes rtsod pa yod do //
translated: And there is the dispute that being an object of comprehension is the reason for the forward pervasion.

original: phyogs kyi chos lhag ma ni ldog pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos lhag ma ni ldog pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: The remaining attributes of the subject are the proof of the reversal.

original: phyogs kyi chos 'di rnams kyis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs ni skabs su bab pa'i bsgrub bya go bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos 'di rnams kyis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs ni skabs su bab pa'i bsgrub bya go bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di brjod pa yin no //
translated: These attributes of the subject express the meaning that a reason possessing the reversal from the discordant class causes understanding of the proposition in question.

original: de'i phyir go bar byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos dang / rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa dang / go bar byed pa rnams kyi ldog pa'i yul go bar byed pa'i rtogs pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir go bar byed pa'i phyogs kyi chos dang / rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa dang / go bar byed pa rnams kyi ldog pa'i yul go bar byed pa'i rtogs pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the attributes of the subject that cause understanding, the basis of dispute, and the reversal of those that cause understanding express the understanding of the reason.

original: skabs su nye bar mi mkho ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skabs su nye bar mi mkho ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that which is not required in the context.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don nyid dgrol ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don nyid dgrol ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to explain the meaning of the verses, he says:

original: rang bzhin 'bras bu dag kho na ngo bo nyid kyis 'brel ba'i phyir dngos po go bar byed pa nyid dang / bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa dang / rang bzhin 'brel pa'i phyir phyin ci log tu byed pa'i 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir mi rtag pa bsgrub par bya ba la byas pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'bras bu dag kho na ngo bo nyid kyis 'brel ba'i phyir dngos po go bar byed pa nyid dang / bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa dang / rang bzhin 'brel pa'i phyir phyin ci log tu byed pa'i 'gal ba nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir mi rtag pa bsgrub par bya ba la byas pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Because the nature and effect are related by their very nature, the reason is contradictory in the sense of being contrary to what is to be established, because it is related to the nature of the opposite of the probandum.üîΩIn order to demonstrate this, he presents two reasons that are properties of the subject: ‚Äúbecause it is produced‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause it arises immediately after exertion‚Äù in the proof of sound as impermanent.

original: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyi chos gtan tshigs gnyis nye bar bstan pa dang / sgra rtag par bsgrub par bya la de dag nyid 'gal bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyi chos gtan tshigs gnyis nye bar bstan pa dang / sgra rtag par bsgrub par bya la de dag nyid 'gal bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: These two reasons are contradictory in the proof of sound as permanent.

original: byas pa ni rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: byas pa ni rang bzhin yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúProduced‚Äù is the nature.

original: rtsol ba las byung ba ni 'bras @76a * //üîΩbu yin no //
analyzed: rtsol ba las byung ba ni 'bras @76a * //üîΩbu yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúArising immediately after exertion‚Äù is the effect.

original: byas pa ni rang bzhin du 'dod pa rtsol ba las byung ba ni 'bras bur 'dod pa 'di dgag las she na /
analyzed: byas pa ni rang bzhin du 'dod pa rtsol ba las byung ba ni 'bras bur 'dod pa 'di dgag las she na /
translated: What is the reason for refuting that which is produced as the nature and that which arises from effort as the effect?

original: rang bzhin las gzhan ni zhes smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin las gzhan ni zhes smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúother than the nature,‚Äù

original: rang bzhin las gzhan pa'i gtan tshigs ni mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la yod pa mi srid de /
analyzed: rang bzhin las gzhan pa'i gtan tshigs ni mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la yod pa mi srid de /
translated: because it is impossible for a reason that is other than the nature to exist in all that is similar.

original: gzhan ni bsgrub par bya ba khyad par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
