analyzed: gang gi phyir gang las shes pa med par nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the ascertainment that consciousness does not exist.

original: shes pa med pa de nyid las med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba dngos po rnams rang la dmigs pa'i shes pa de med pa tsam gyis ni de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba shes pa med par nges par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa med pa de nyid las med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba dngos po rnams rang la dmigs pa'i shes pa de med pa tsam gyis ni de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba shes pa med par nges par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The mere absence of consciousness that observes those things does not make them nonexistent.

original: 'o na gang las med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba shes pa med par nges pa gang las shes na /
analyzed: 'o na gang las med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba shes pa med par nges pa gang las shes na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúFrom what is the ascertainment of the absence of consciousness known?‚Äù

original: bshad pa / dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin las khyad par du gyur cing log par gyur pa'i sa phyogs la sogs pa shes pa gcig la 'dre ba'i shes pa yod pa las yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin las khyad par du gyur cing log par gyur pa'i sa phyogs la sogs pa shes pa gcig la 'dre ba'i shes pa yod pa las yin no //
translated: We say that it is from the fact that the place where things are located is different from and separate from the nature of those things.

original: 'di ma dmigs so zhes shes pa med pa 'di ma nges par 'gyur ba de nyid las dmigs pa med par nges pa'i sgo nas tha snyad 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ma dmigs so zhes shes pa med pa 'di ma nges par 'gyur ba de nyid las dmigs pa med par nges pa'i sgo nas tha snyad 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge that ‚Äúit is not observed‚Äù is not ascertained. From that very fact, the absence of observation is ascertained, and the term ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù is used.

original: med pa'i tha snyad de ni shes pa med pa las ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad de ni shes pa med pa las ni ma yin gyi /
translated: That term ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù is not used from the absence of consciousness.

original: 'on kyang shes pa gzhan yod pa las so zhes bya ba de ga las she na /
analyzed: 'on kyang shes pa gzhan yod pa las so zhes bya ba de ga las she na /
translated: But how do you know that it is due to the existence of another cognition?

original: gnyid log pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig tu don thams cad ma rtogs par gyur ba'i tshe /
analyzed: gnyid log pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig tu don thams cad ma rtogs par gyur ba'i tshe /
translated: When someone is asleep and so on, and does not perceive any object at all,

original: shes pa dngos po med pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir shes pa med pa las shes pa med pa rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa dngos po med pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir shes pa med pa las shes pa med pa rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: because he does not perceive a non-existent cognition, he does not perceive the non-existence of cognition.

original: de'i tshe shes pa med pa ma rtogs pa gang las she na /
analyzed: de'i tshe shes pa med pa ma rtogs pa gang las she na /
translated: If at that time he does not perceive the non-existence of cognition, how can he perceive the non-existence of an object?

original: dran pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no memory.

original: gang gi phyir shes pa med pa las shes pa med par rtogs pa'i phyir don mngon sum du gyur na mngon sum @88a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes pa med pa las shes pa med par rtogs pa'i phyir don mngon sum du gyur na mngon sum @88a * //
translated: Because he does not perceive the non-existence of cognition from the non-existence of cognition, when an object is present, he has a valid cognition that perceives it.

original: du gyur pa'i tshad ma'i stobs kyis dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du gyur pa'i tshad ma'i stobs kyis dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of that valid cognition that perceives it, the conceptual thought that it is perceived arises.

original: mngon sum gyis ni dmigs pa med pa nyid tha snyad du bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni dmigs pa med pa nyid tha snyad du bya ba yin gyi /
translated: It is by means of perception that one can conventionally say that it is not perceived.

original: don med pa ni tha snyad du bya bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don med pa ni tha snyad du bya bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: But one cannot conventionally say that it does not exist.

original: ma dmigs pa dag kyang yod pa'i mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma dmigs pa dag kyang yod pa'i mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the non-observation of the object is also seen to exist.

original: des na snang ba mi dmigs pas na tha snyad du bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na snang ba mi dmigs pas na tha snyad du bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the appearance is not observed, it is conventionally said to be non-existent.

original: med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba ni bltar rung ba'i mi dmigs pa med par nges par bshad la /
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba ni bltar rung ba'i mi dmigs pa med par nges par bshad la /
translated: The possibility of the conventional designation of non-existence is explained as the definite non-observation of the observable.

original: 'di ma dmigs so zhes bya ba mngon sum las yin te /
analyzed: 'di ma dmigs so zhes bya ba mngon sum las yin te /
translated: The statement this is not observed is based on direct perception.

original: 'di ltar shes pa tsam med par nges pa ni gzhan las kyang 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa tsam med par nges pa ni gzhan las kyang 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Thus, the ascertainment of the mere absence of cognition can also occur from other [means of knowledge].

original: yang ci'i phyir shes pa gcig nyams su myong ba las don gzhan gyi dmigs pa med par nges she na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir shes pa gcig nyams su myong ba las don gzhan gyi dmigs pa med par nges she na /
translated: Again, why is it ascertained that there is no object other than the experience of a single cognition?

original: gang gi phyir don gyi khyad par rtogs pa ni khyad par can gyi myong ba las 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don gyi khyad par rtogs pa ni khyad par can gyi myong ba las 'gyur la /
translated: Because the understanding of the particular object occurs from the experience of the particular [cognition].

original: myong ba'i khyad par rtogs pa ni rnam pa de lta bu khyad par can sngon po'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid rang gi rig pas yin gyi /
analyzed: myong ba'i khyad par rtogs pa ni rnam pa de lta bu khyad par can sngon po'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid rang gi rig pas yin gyi /
translated: The understanding of the particular experience is of that kind of particularity, the nature of the aspect of blue, by one's own awareness.

original: myong ba'i khyad par gzhan las ma yin no //
analyzed: myong ba'i khyad par gzhan las ma yin no //
translated: It is not from another particular experience.

original: de lta yin dang rang nyid grub pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par gyi myong ba de don gyis gzung bar bya ba'i don kyang khyad par du byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang rang nyid grub pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par gyi myong ba de don gyis gzung bar bya ba'i don kyang khyad par du byed pa yin te /
translated: If that were so, then the experience of the nature of the object that is established would also be the qualifier of the object that is apprehended.

original: don gyi khyad par nges pa ni shes pa'i khyad par nges pa la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde la khyad par can gyi shes pa nges pa'i rang bzhin shes pas gzhan med par nges pa ni shes pa las rig na /
analyzed: don gyi khyad par nges pa ni shes pa'i khyad par nges pa la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir ro // de la khyad par can gyi shes pa nges pa'i rang bzhin shes pas gzhan med par nges pa ni shes pa las rig na /
translated: This is because the ascertainment of the qualifier of the object depends on the ascertainment of the qualifier of the consciousness.

original: don gyis don rnam par gcod do zhes ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
analyzed: don gyis don rnam par gcod do zhes ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
translated: If the ascertainment of the nature of the consciousness that is the qualifier is ascertained without another consciousness, then why is it said that ‚Äúthe object is ascertained by the object-possessor‚Äù?

original: shes pa gcig la 'dren pa can mthong ba na gal te bum pa la sogs pa yod na ni mthong ba kho nar 'gyur ba de'i phyir snang du srid pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bshad zin te /
analyzed: shes pa gcig la 'dren pa can mthong ba na gal te bum pa la sogs pa yod na ni mthong ba kho nar 'gyur ba de'i phyir snang du srid pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bshad zin te /
translated: When one sees a single consciousness that is the qualifier, if a pot and so on exists, then it would be seen. Therefore it is possible that it appears. This has already been explained.

original: des na 'dir snang ba mi dmigs par nges pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis don rnam par gcod par brjod do //
analyzed: des na 'dir snang ba mi dmigs par nges pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis don rnam par gcod par brjod do //
translated: Therefore here it is said that the nonobservation of appearance is the cause of ascertainment, and it is said that the object is ascertained.

original: des na shes pa dang shes bya'i rang bzhin ni mi dmigs pa yin par de dang de dag tu brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na shes pa dang shes bya'i rang bzhin ni mi dmigs pa yin par de dang de dag tu brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the nature of consciousness and the object of consciousness is non-apprehension, and this is stated in various places.

original: gal te ci ltar don gyi khyad par nges pa ni shes pa las yin gyi rang nyid las ni ma yin pa de bzhin du shes pa'i yang shes pa gzhan las yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ci ltar don gyi khyad par nges pa ni shes pa las yin gyi rang nyid las ni ma yin pa de bzhin du shes pa'i yang shes pa gzhan las yin no zhe na /
translated: If one says: Just as the ascertainment of the particular object is from consciousness and not from itself, so too, the ascertainment of consciousness is from another consciousness.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes smos so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes smos so //
translated: To this, the root text says, ‚ÄúOtherwise,‚Äù

original: gal te myong ba'i khyad par de nges pa'i rnam @88b par shes pa gzhan gyis nges par byas pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te myong ba'i khyad par de nges pa'i rnam @88b par shes pa gzhan gyis nges par byas pa yin na /
translated: If the ascertainment of that particular experience were ascertained by another consciousness,

original: shes pa gzhan de'i yang shes pa gzhan las yin pa'i phyir shes pa'i khyad par rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan dang gzhan mtha' thug pa med par 'gyur bas don nam shes pa'i khyad par 'ga' yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: shes pa gzhan de'i yang shes pa gzhan las yin pa'i phyir shes pa'i khyad par rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan dang gzhan mtha' thug pa med par 'gyur bas don nam shes pa'i khyad par 'ga' yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro ;
translated: then, because the ascertainment of that other consciousness would be from another consciousness, there would be an infinite regress of other reasons for the ascertainment of the particular consciousness. Therefore, neither the particular object nor the particular consciousness would be established.

original: yang ci ltar na shes pa'i khyad par bzhin du don gyi khyad par yang rang las mi 'grub ce na /
analyzed: yang ci ltar na shes pa'i khyad par bzhin du don gyi khyad par yang rang las mi 'grub ce na /
translated: If one says: Just as the particular consciousness is not established from itself, why is the particular object not established from itself in the same way?

original: bshad pa / don ni rang gi yod pa'am khyad par dag gis don dang 'brel pa'i yod pa dang khyad par nges pa yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / don ni rang gi yod pa'am khyad par dag gis don dang 'brel pa'i yod pa dang khyad par nges pa yin te /
translated: An object is related to existence or its attributes through the ascertainment of existence or its attributes.

original: de dag ni rig pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rig pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those are not the nature of awareness.

original: rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi yod pa dang khyad par gang yin pa de dag ni rang las grub par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi yod pa dang khyad par gang yin pa de dag ni rang las grub par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Those that are the nature of awareness, existence, and attributes are established from themselves.

original: 'di skad du brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: gang zhig yod pa rang nyid las grub pa de'i khyad par yang 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig yod pa rang nyid las grub pa de'i khyad par yang 'grub pa yin no //
translated: That which is established as existent from itself, its attributes are also established.
